While the browser renders pages on Amazon.com quickly and with similar speed as a traditional browser on a PC or Mac, be prepared for very long load times, page load access errors and a lot of time spent watching the little circle spin on other sites.While my days are spent providing software support for a Cloud based application where typically my PC will have two versions of Internet Explorer and Firefox, Chrome and Safari browsers all open at the same time, I was not looking to write a review on the Silk browser. I just wanted to be able to surf the internet with a tablet.But instead of surfing the internet, I'm here writing a review because visiting amazon.com is the only site that will load. I wanted to relax and read the news or the sports, but instead I end up sitting with my Mac, PC and kindle next to my router trying to figure out whats up with the Silk browser and why sometimes it will render a page and others times be totally hopeless on the same page.I've tried a number of tests where a computer and the kindle were active and where only the kindle or laptop were on the network. The results are consistent where the kindle can take minutes and the same page (ex: sportsillustrated) will take minutes to render or just fail to load at all and the laptop will render in a couple of seconds.Yes a laptop has more processing power, but taking minutes to load a text based site such as drudge or not being able to load it at all is just not acceptable. Sometimes the page loads and sometimes not.I'm hoping there is a fixable solution and Amazon is not doing what MS did in the early days of breaking other peoples products to keep you using their products. Just as I hope that Amazon is dedicating enough resources to provide a quality browser product. Amazon is big and very profitable and should be able to develop a quality browser. So far they have not.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the mobile writer, reader, & student (and those with binocular vision issues!) ALSO HAS TEXT TO SPEECH!
Reviews.Author: Andrew Butts "College Cinephile"
Reviews.Content: WHY THE FIRE WORKS FOR ME: I've developed an avid passion for reading non-fiction due to the first fire. (More on Binocular Vision at the bottom) I read about a book a month, I write essays for a blog twice a month, and as a student, I found the amazing advantage of having a kindle as an even more portable option to my old, heavy laptop. I could get to my google docs, surf the web, listen to my music, watch media and pretty much satiate all my needs for my laptop save actually typing things out. With the addition of blutooth, I can now do that very easily with a bluetooth keyboard. I like to do alot of casual dining, and I usually read while I'm out and about, so it's great that I can work away at my essays as well. The screen size is apt for long documents, and media consumption without being excessive. With the Marware Vibe case it still just fits in my jacket or cargo pocket and follows me everywhere I go. It's got the right power behind it this time to cut down on the sytem lag present in the old fire.TEXT TO SPEECH: One AWESOME feature I didn't know the Fire had was Text to Speech. It's hidden under the settings while in the reader, under more options. I highly suggest it for the non-fiction reader. This way I can listen to my books at work when I can't be reading them, as well as in my car on the go. Saves a ton on audio books. It does a surprisingly good job with pronunciation and sentence structure, though it's still far from perfect. The lady's voice ends up sounding like British NPR, in that, she sometimes says things a little funny and she reads like it's the news, so it's probably not the best for fiction, but on the whole I know alot of real people that are more difficult to understand.MY ONE CON: The lack of google apps. Particularly Google+ and Hangouts. I was hoping to use the webcam for that...ON THE TOPIC OF BINOCULAR VISION: I can't focus on physical books, I apparently have a problem with my binocular near vision I've only recently found out about where my eyes struggle to focus properly on things up close. Having a kindle on a stand, has allowed me to move books further away, reducing the strain, and unlocked this voracious appetite for books I never knew I had. I always liked the idea of books, people always mistook me for a bookish person, but they couldn't keep my attention, often making me quite tired. Depending on the study you read, up to 7% of the population is affected by this. If you have trouble reading, focusing, or staying awake while reading books, you should ask you optometrist about it, and if so, the Kindle might be just the answer you've been looking for. It has been for me.

Reviews.Title: 4G useless for me
Reviews.Author: Tom Diaz
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of the Kindle and this one is no exception.  I love it.  Sort of.  I would give it five stars except that I bought the wireless option and have now discovered that you cannot download videos and movies through the 4G...you still have to be hooked up to Wi-Fi.  So, for me, what was the point?  I cannot think of an instance when I wanted a book right this very moment, but I was looking forward to watching a video I bought through Prime and now I'll just have to wait, which is the same as the lower-priced version and the same as my previous Kindle Fire.  Forgive me, but I feel a bit screwed.

Reviews.Title: Another great Kindle...
Reviews.Author: Allura
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle (second Fire). I am disabled but LOVE to read. Not real fond of listening to books. This Kindle allows both options, but I still prefer to read the book. I love the touch feature because of fused finger joints. I had been rereading physical books the past week while waiting for this & found that I was trying to use the touch-to-turn-page feature & the definition feature. I am already addicted to the features of the Fire series.I registered this one for the $49.99 deal with AT&T; for a year's 4G but intend to use mostly WiFi when available. But the deal is great for when I'm traveling or in an area I don't have WiFi available. The plans for after seem reasonable with the 250 MB a month @ just $15 a month. But I'll have to see if I can keep usage down that low.For the download of books (most) the WiFi feature is great, it's the movie downloads & streaming that really need the 4G. There is a way to turn on/off the 4G feature & it was relatively easy to stumble upon if you are familiar with the previous Fire & how to change the settings. You go to the menu bar & select Wireless then turn off the Mobile networking. Turn it back on when you need but keep it off otherwise. This also saves on the battery usage, it'll last longer per charge with 4G & WiFi off.The bigger but lighter chassis is great for the arthritis. It spreads the weight over larger area so it doesn't hurt as much. Like the option to Skype, although have not tried it I do intend to use this feature.This model also has better parental controls with the Freetime system. You can set up individual "accounts" for each child with content control, time control, age appropriate content, etc. I don't know yet how many separate "accounts" you can create but I will be testing the number because of the number of kids I watch.One thing I'm ambivalent on is the Favorites. The old way was simple, they were just under the Carousel. Now you have a star icon that you can access from anywhere. I was used to the other way, so I'm still having to stop & think "where are the favorites?" I think I'll get it soon enough.The new touch system is more sensitive, which is good & bad. It doesn't take as much pressure so sometimes you find you open something you didn't want or making a move in a game that you didn't intend. But that, too, is something I think I'll adapt to.The big thing I don't like is that the menu bar is no longer accessible by simply touching the strip. You have to drag down the strip & then select what you want to do. I realize I'll get used to this & it probably seems minor to others but it bugs me because you have to drag it a minimum distance & sometimes I don't get that distance & have to try again.The sound is better & louder than before, too. But I discovered some of my previous apps aren't compatible with this HD model. They can still be played on the other Fire but not here. That kinda bummed me out, but I'll just have to find other versions or replace them with something altogether new.The option to have advertisements/special offers don't bother me. But if they did, you can get rid of them for $15, which seems a real deal if you just can't ignore the ads.All-in-all, I'd say this is the best thing out there. Better than iPad by far considering all features & the price. & it also is easy to fix if it freezes, just power down by holding the power button for 30 secs & let rest before rebooting. Very user friendly. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Week One Review
Reviews.Author: Adrienne Carsman
Reviews.Content: Received just in time to take on Thanksgiving Holiday week trip.  The 8.9" HD is faster in almost everything I do. The WiFi connection ability is much better than my one year old Kindle Fire.  Screen touch response is smoother and more consistent. Picture quality is excellent.  The HDMI connection provided a fine HD picture quality on the hotel's Panasonic 42" LCD television. I enjoyed Men in Black 3 streaming through the Hilton free WiFi network.  The 8.9" is thinner than the old 7" Fire and I'm happy with its utility as my ebook reader.  After a week of intensive use, I'm pleased and glad that I purchased this from Amazon. Next week my case is to arrive and that should further improve my experience.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Teacher
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire when it first came out last year and have never been happier.  In fact, my kids use it so much that I had to go back to my old kindle to read books again. Now, I have my own tablet, a bigger one, and I love it!  Color on this thing is great. Netflix is also sharp on this device.

Reviews.Title: Enjoying The New Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: KAT10
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle Fire.  I love the new larger screen. Easier to work with but still portable. Set up was quick and easy.  Setting up the 4G was easy as well.  I am loving the 4G option.The amazon prime instant video works great.I was not sure about paying extra for the larger screen and 4G, but when I compared to other options out there, this really was the best deal for my family.  We all use it.Web browsing and e-mail works much better than on my first Kindle Fire.Charges quickly and the charge lasts.Sound quality is a nice upgrade from the previous Kindle Fire.Set up of the Free-Time for my kids was quick and easy.  My kids are older, so don't really think we will use this feature too much.  Nice to have though.  Thanks amazon for providing an affordable, family friendly device!

Reviews.Title: Goldilocks Would Approve
Reviews.Author: Pie Grrrl
Reviews.Content: 7" tablet? Too small.10" tablet? Too big.8.9" HD tablet. Just right!!!!I knew EXACTLY what I was buying when I signed up for this tablet: a device to tap into amazon. I already own a hardcore work tablet so I didn't need a duplicate; WHY would I?I just wanted a dedicated Kindle, in colour, so I could read magazines, download my books and stream amazon's videos. No need for any other apps, as again, my Samsung tablet does all of that for me.Colour is fantastically sharp, the sound is 100% better than my tablet (rich and loud enough that I don't need to hook up a bluetooth speaker to hear a film). Weight is lighter than I thought and I can't wait to start tapping into the free once-a-month loaned books through amazon.I got exactly what I wanted and ordered.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9 32gb
Reviews.Author: Russell W Alexander
Reviews.Content: I will be brief as there are a lot of reviews on here already regarding what it can and can't do.  All I can say, is Awesome.  I had the original Fire and thought it was pretty cool, but this one is fantastic.  It is lightning fast (having said that I pay for a very high level of internet so it might be different for you).  Beautiful screen, videos look great and run smoothly and the sound is terrific.Having said all that, I knew up front there were ads; I knew that google play was not an option without a few adjustments, etc.  It is everything that I had hope for and then some.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: C. Collett
Reviews.Content: Received it yesterday.....so glad I preordered it back in September!  Well worth the wait.Last year I purchased the Kindle Fire HD 7 for my 12 yr old daughter and she loves it.....says it's the  best thing she ever received.We both love to read so sharing her's was a big problem.This Kindle is everything the reviews say and more....Well done Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Performance on everything I load into it.
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I was debating over Kindle Fire HDX and Kindle Fire HD 8.9 but I decided that this is a better deal and that it will handle everything I needed. We have the 2012 version of Kindle Fire HD 7 inches screen which still performs well but I would like to get another one that I can also use to take with me to meetings to take notes.The Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is a big difference as compare to the 7 inch version. The screen is a lot bigger and the CPU is a little faster.Below are the list of things I usually do with my Kindle.1. Internet: Internet is fast both from browsing and streaming videos.  I stream videos from HBO GO, Netflix, Amazon Prime and Youtube and all apps performs well on both my Kindle.  No lag or buffering issue.2. Home Network: I was able to connect easily to my home network and was able to access and stream home videos and movies from my cloud drive (WD Mycloud 3TB) using both Skifta and PLEX.3. Apps: I have downloaded hundreds of apps from Amazon with their Free App of the day most of them I tried and removed from my 7 inch kindle but let it stay on the cloud and so far I have not experience any problem with the apps I have tried on this device.  Some of the apps I can remember from my head.  Angry Bird (Original, Starwars, GO), Cogs puzzle, Looney Tunes Phonics, Flick Golf, Flick Soccer, Pocket Informant 3, Dora ABC, Facebook, HBO GO, Netflix, Youtube, Overdrive, etc.4. Reading: I have the Money Magazine and Kiplinger App and both works without any problem. The only thing is that the Kindle screen size is too long for those magazine so there is a black bar at the bottom if you are reading on portrait mode.  Books from Overdrive and Kindle were fine.Some Features I like on Kindle Fire HD.1. Display: The display on this device is much clearer than it's 7 inch counterpart. Also, I could say that even though that the Ipad have a higher resolution, the kindle Fire HD 8.9 looks much sharper on the classroom lighting.  It could just be the setting on each device but I'm not sure as I  don't play with other people's device. i just compare it side by side.2. Speaker: The speaker on this device is decent. It is clear and loud enough to play music and also movies. We have actually used this in our church to show video to around 12 kids sitting in front to watch a video. The sound is actually clear in a room that is around 15 x 12 when everybody is quiet.  The Ipad that the other teacher use actually needs an external speaker for the same setting.3. Size:  The bigger screen is a lot better than the 7 inch HD that we have. It's bigger real estate made it easier to type on a desk setting or while it is on your lap and give you a better experience watching videos and reading books.  However, bigger screen also means that it is heavier and you will need bigger hands to be able to reach all the letters while typing.  When it is on my lap or desk, typing is much better but when I am holding it up while lying down and reading, it is a little inconvenient for my medium sized hand to reach all the letters of the keyboard without changing the way I am holding it.This Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is great for adults but it may be a little inconvenient for small children.  Observing my kids ages 6, 4 and 2 on how they handle both Kindle Fire HD 7 and 8.9 inch, I could say that they are more comfortable with the smaller version due to the size and weight.  So, if you want one for yourself then go for it but if you are thinking of buying it for your young kids then consider saving more and get the new 7 inch screen.HDX vs HD: I'm sure that some of the people looking at this review is also confused on which version of Kindle to get. What I suggest is first know what you wanted to do with your tablet and also if you will need constant customer support. If you call customer support a lot then the HDX is for you due to the mayday feature where you can get support right on the tablet instead of via phone or email.  HDX have a a better resolution and sound and also a faster processor but if you are just looking for a tablet for video streaming, books and some games then this version should be more than what you need.

Reviews.Title: Kindle is elderly friendly, no digital conversation required
Reviews.Author: Happy Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My wife absolutely loves her Kindle.  Excellent readability with white backlit screen and three font sizes.  She was having trouble with the smaller print inside her glossy covered romance novels.  Her reading time has gone way down and her enjoyment level is probably back to times past when we both had younger eyes.  Neither of us are digital gurus and the Kindle is very user friendly.  We also took advantage of Amazon's Kindle help desk and they are patient and personable.

Reviews.Title: Kudos for Amazon Customer Service.
Reviews.Author: David P. Squire
Reviews.Content: I purchased two Kindles earlier this year; one for me and one for my wife.  My wife has never been happier and myself, well I wasn't gaga as I had posted in my review about my Kindle. I just wasn't that impressed and I made my comments clear. I didn't feel it was up to I [Pod standards, but that's just me.  I was contacted by Amazon via email in April about my review and they seemed to want to help but I didn't bother to get back to them.  Then this week  my music stopped playing; my videos wouldn't play and so I decided to call them even though by this time almost five months had gone by and I felt I was too late to get any help.  Not so, Amazon's customer service walked me through some easy trouble shooting and when that still didn't work they sent me a brand new one the next day with overnight shipping. So the reason I was not crazy about my Kindle was due to the fact that I had a defective model and now my new one works superbly and I am extremely happy and I can't say enough how much customer service from Amazon made the experience much more worth it.  You got a problem? Contact Amazon.  They want to know why you're not happy. They will bend over backwards to satisfy you and that will bring me back more and more and I will spread the word, also.Thanks so much Amazon.  Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: I made the perfect decision!
Reviews.Author: Tinypaws "Tinypaws"
Reviews.Content: Because I'm retired and on a fixed income, I did a lot of research before I bought a tablet/reader, including reading virtually every review on Amazon at the time, and the larger Kindle Fire HD seemed the right one for me and it has proved to be all I'd hoped for.  I even made a few trips to Best Buy so I could handle and use each size to compare the two, as well as other brands.  I figured that the larger 8.9" size was best for me because I need reading glasses now and I was a little hesitant about the smaller screen model.  I also joined Amazon Prime when I bought my Kindle and the instant videos are fantastic.  I've had my Kindle about 3 months now and I've ordered more books than I ever would have thought because there are some great low prices (for me - $3.99 and under) on many wonderful books on Amazon.  I am wary of which games I download because of permissions but am totally hooked on the few I have which were either free or cost $1.99 or less.I bought my Kindle because I was going to be starting dialysis and I didn't want to use my laptop on a shared network and of course because the Kindle Fire is so much smaller and lighter weight.  It has proved to be no problem to hold for long periods of time and is very comfortable to use.  Movies are clear and beautiful and many of the ones I watch are subtitled and those are very easy to read.  Typing on the keyboard is easy and never annoys me unlike trying to use the tiny one on my Dell Mini 9".  I have not needed to purchase a stylus and doubt that I will.  Wiping the screen with a microfiber cloth keeps it clean and print-free, though I am very careful and protective of my Kindle.  I bought a strapless neoprene carrying case that fits perfectly into another neoprene carrying case with handles as my intention was for the Kindle to bounce when tucked inside it's protection if it ever falls and I think it just may do that.I ordered the charger with my Kindle because I didn't have any other that I could use and it is great, too and was only $10.00.  The only function that really seems to eat up battery power is playing games but in one 6 hour dialysis session, I can easily watch a movie, read a book, and play games all on one charge.The only drawback is mine, nothing to do with the Kindle.  I live very rurally and my internet connection is beyond slow, so I have to load movies when I visit friends who have high speed connections, but I just load 10 or 12 (at perhaps 2 minutes per movie) and they remain on the Kindle more than long enough for me to watch one per dialysis session (every other day).  Books load with no problem, despite my ISP.  An operator at Amazon said that he'd worked there for 9 years and never seen anyone with as slow a download speed as mine!I am enormously pleased with my Kindle Fire HD and still cannot believe I own it.  Furthremore, I bought it for $250 with free shipping on a special one day offer from Amazon and that discount made a huge difference to me.

Reviews.Title: Price dropped today! Amazon allowed return or price match!
Reviews.Author: Weesie
Reviews.Content: I opened my Kindle Fire 8.9" 16 Gig and then went online to get more information about the new case. I saw that I could have had the 32 Gig for the same price today as I paid two days ago. I called Amazon and they told me that I have 30 days to get a refund of the difference or upgrade to the model I want. I love Amazon! I will be able to upgrade to the 32 Gig 4G LTE for less than the 32 Gig Fire HD would have cost me two days ago. They will not allow a direct exchange, but they will email me a return label and I can purchase the upgrade. I am happy and love Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD rules
Reviews.Author: Crazy about Coffee
Reviews.Content: Now I can read my books, listen to my music, play games, download aps and watch tv shows and movies.  The picture quality is fantastic, great definition and it's the perfect size.  Best buy I ever made.  Everything about my Kindle Fire HD is user friendly. I can find ratings, descriptions and obtain new books, music games, download aps, tv shows & music when ever and where ever I am.

Reviews.Title: Excellent device
Reviews.Author: Daniel "God is my judge" "Cigar Man"
Reviews.Content: Purchased for wife for Christmas. She absolutely loves it. Has lots of features and free apps. Beautiful screen. Would purchase again.

Reviews.Title: A Convenient Companion
Reviews.Author: Airbus30B
Reviews.Content: The longer I have this Kindle, the more I love it. I read books with it, and love the way I can let the voice read to me while I follow along with the text. Although I have a Samsung HD Plasma TV in my room, I like most of the time to watch movies on this Kindle, the HD picture is so sharp. I use Amazon Prime, and also download YouTube videos to it. The internet works fine on it, although I prefer to do most of my internet surfing on my desktop computer. I'm 58 years old, this technology amazes me. I have downloaded many apps, most of them free, some fairly cheap to buy. Most of what I do download in the way of apps, I eventually clear out of the Kindle, finding many of them not so useful to me. One app however called FSWidgets is very useful to me, I use it in Microsoft Flight Simulator 2004. I have a customer review on this app if your interested. Never having owned any other tablet, I can only base my rating of the Kindle HD 8.9 on what I've experienced, the past month using it. I think the price is great, although I think Amazon should throw in the charger for free.

Reviews.Title: Better Than The Samsung Galaxy Tablet
Reviews.Author: Frank Turner
Reviews.Content: My wife has the Samsung Galaxy Tablet and loves my Kindle more. Crisp picture and great sound. Easy to use and a multitude of Apps. Sure the Ipad had more bells and whistles but to me it's not worth the $700.00. I love it at a fraction of thge cost of the Ipad or Galaxy.

Reviews.Title: It's Awesome and cost much less than the IPAD
Reviews.Author: PHIL WILLIAMS
Reviews.Content: Bought this item for my wife for Christmas. She loves and it operates awesome. No need to spend nearly double on an iPad, plus this has Dolby sound with dual speakes. Very Nice! Would recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle.
Reviews.Author: Deiby Garcia
Reviews.Content: I bought this product because I bought last year the Kindle Fire 7" and was so happy with what it offered. I got my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" and couldn't be happier. It looks awesome. It's not as heavy as I thought it would be. Didn't have to overpay for it like I think you do when you buy an IPAD. This product offers the same thing withoug being overpriced. I love reading my books on it. I would recommend this product for sure.

Reviews.Title: Hesistant at first, definitely glad I bought it
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I wrestled with the decision to buy this. I am a broke college student and wanted to get myself something for Christmas and decided to give this a try, mostly because I looked ahead at my future textbook requirements and saw I could rent them on amazon prime and the tablet would pay itself off within about a year. I am so glad I bought this tablet. Had it about a week now, been glued to it since. It's not an iPad, but if you aren't planning on using it as a heavy duty work tablet and you are mostly going to use it for books (first thing I bought was a book and it is beautiful, feels completely natural reading it), textbooks, games, and watching movies and videos, this is the tablet for you. I love it and I am extremely glad I bought it. If you are hesistant, just try it. It is an excellent price for an excellent tablet.Also, I wanted to add that the sound is incredible! It sounds like surround sound when I am lying in bed watching a movie.

Reviews.Title: ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Bonnie L Kirby
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would be able to give up my hard copy books until I got my Kindle Fire HD.  What a difference.  I am already reading more.  It's comfortable to hold and easy on the eyes.  Set print font as you like.  Love the games apps and have found so many fun things to do.  I am 63 years old and found this easy to use also.  The pictures are crystal clear HD with fabulous sound for movies, tv and music.  I am also an Amazon Prime Member and would recommend that to anyone as there are great free movies and tv shows.  I like getting the daily Kindle deals and have purchased several books this way for a $$$ savings.  Another feature is the dictionary.  Have used it when reading and come across a word not familiar with.  It is so cool to just click on the word and up pops the definition.  Maybe I am easily amused but for my Senior friends out there....if you are thinking about buying a Kindle Fire HD ...... buy it ... you will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Definitely satisfied with my Kindle Fire HD!
Reviews.Author: Tony "Tony"
Reviews.Content: I have a 1st generation iPad, which I still will use often and like it very much. I was considering the latest iPad, but the cost was a little too high for me to purchase it. Then I thoroughly researched the other various tablets available. I was at a crossroads between the Nexus and the Fire HD.  I purchased the Fire HD due to the very good reviews and how good Amazon's customer service has been for me through the years. And since I've been an Amazon Prime member for the last 6 or so years, I decided to get the Kindle Fire HD.  The first Kindle Fire HD that I bought is for my grand daughter as a Christmas gift.  It is the 7" Kindle Fire HD. When it arrived here to my home (I wanted to thoroughly familiarize myself with it before presenting it to her.), I was very much satisfied with it.  I was then fortunate enough to purchase my 8.9" Kindle Fire HD at $50 off when Amazon ran the 1-day discount!  My Kindle promptly arrived and I'm extremely satisfied with it!  Great job Amazon! There some minor things which I would like, such as a front facing camera, more apps available (which will come in time). But other then those two items, I'm a very satisfied owner!

Reviews.Title: The perfect entertainment device
Reviews.Author: Mike Bartlett
Reviews.Content: For someone who does not own a smart phone and probably never will, this is just the perfect device.  My wife had received one from our children for her 70th birthday.  The more I played with it the more that I realized that I needed one!  Of course being a guy, the larger 8.9" HD model would be just right.  I was going to go with another manufacturer and get a 10" model, but I was so impressed with how seamless the unit performed with Amazon content.  It didn't make sense to have two different devices.I would recommend a Kindle Fire HD anytime!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Aidan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my mother who is not the biggest fan of technology, but she took to this so quickly it was a miracle. I personally have a first generation Kindle Fire and the current iPad 3. I have to say this is a huge improvement over the first generation Kindle Fire and I personally think is very similar to the iPad 3. Side by side the retina image on the iPad is clear and performance wise a bit faster, but the Kindle is just as easy to use and if your looking for something to get online and read books its fantastic. If I did not have an iPad I would purchase a new Fire for myself.

Reviews.Title: I absolutely love my new Kindle Fire!  Great product--cannot believe I waited so long to purchase.
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: I purchased my first Kindle a little over a year ago (Kindle keyboard with 3G) and was completely happy with all the reading I was doing.  I ordered the Fire and wasn't sure how I would like it or use it--but let me tell you--I am using this in ways I never imagined and I am so happy with this purchase.  I like being able to see all the covers of the books I purchase in color--something that was missing on the Kindle keyboard with 3G.  Additionally, I would have never believed that I would be using this reader to do anything but reading--but I was feeling under the weather and decided to get comfy and try watching one of the many videos available with my Prime account on my new Kindle Fire.  I am now hooked on Downton Abbey--almost through with Season 2.  This great device is an entertainment mecca--and I didn't even know I wanted to be entertained, lol!  Thinking of canceling my cable television as I feel that I don't need it at this point.  Don't hesitate to jump in with both feet and purchase a Kindle Fire today--you won't be disappointed . . .

Reviews.Title: Finally
Reviews.Author: Pamela M. Fox
Reviews.Content: I have waited over a year to get a Kindle and glad I did to get this model. I am LOVING it - my main purpose was for reading - of course it does a wonderful job with that!! It is hard to put it down!

Reviews.Title: Great device for the money
Reviews.Author: Herky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both use the device to watch TV shows.  The streaming feature is really nice and works great for traveling.  Prime is essential if you are going to do this because there is so much free content.  The picture is beautiful---works great on the airplane.  If you need to actually download something because there is no Internet somewhere you are going it usually only takes about 10minutes for a 2 hour movie.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Tablet for the Family
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We just got a Kindle Fire HD 8.9 for my wife and 6 year old daughter.  By comparison I have a Transformer Prime with the latest Android operating system (Jelly bean).  I can't overstate how impressed I am by The Kindle Fire HD.  The 8.9" screen feels better in my hands than a 10".  On the other hand a 7" just seems like its for a child only.  The screen is stunning and the dual speakers with Dolby surround blow my Prime out of the water (which isn't saying much in terms of sound).  Don't get me wrong, if you're an Android pro/geek than you will prefer a pure Google experience and Jelly Bean is sweet but the Kindle Fire is w/o doubt THE family tablet.  The Kindle Freetime makes setting a profile for your kids so easy and you don't have to worry about them screwing something up which is why I didn't get a Nexus 7.  I can't wait for the upcoming release of Kindle Freetime Unlimited.  I will update as we all get time to play with it more but so far it is a home run with one significant exception:The only issue thus far is no YouTube app and the YouTube website doesn't function properly because flash is no longer supported. I'm TEMPORARILY giving a Amazon a pass and not deducting a star with full expectation of a fix as many people are upset about this.  However it is not resolved by the first of the year I will have to deduct a star if the most used online video service is still not working.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB
Reviews.Author: Viktor von M
Reviews.Content: Love it very much.  So entertaining and useful in so many ways. Am 71 years old and hope to be able to use the Kindle until my last breath.

Reviews.Title: MUCH Better for Math Formulas and Education!
Reviews.Author: Let's Compare Options "Amazon Rocks"
Reviews.Content: If you read many math oriented textbook reviews here on Amazon, you'll see 5 stars for the book and one star for the same book on Kindle-- because the LaTEX type breaks in the wrong place or doesn't display correctly. You can only imagine what it does for students or even Engineers to have errors in formulas due to display! Personally, I don't want to be driving over a bridge calculated by an Engineer reading an incorrectly displayed formula, you know?We're developers and work on this problem for all e-readers, and I was more than pleased to see that both the HD and larger screen REALLY helps eliminate this problem, both for texts and journals. We've even had to convert some complex math to graphics/ pictures to get formulas to display on older Kindles, and this new device will please both readers and publishers alike, who will be much less reticent to try more complex texts on Kindle.For any of you dear readers that are thinking not just of gaming and music-- the advanced display features here are also outstanding for those professional journals in both STEM and more pictorial subscriptions like chess magazines. All the hype about this new tablet is around entertainment, but don't forget that it started life as a READER-- and devices that can't handle certain types of texts are pretty useless! This is a happy side benefit, whether planned by Amazon or not, and we wanted you math, science, technology, engineering, physics, chemistry and other journal folks to be aware of it. If you've been waiting for a work around on this issue-- it's not perfect yet, but MUCH MUCH better with this iteration!Technical note: If you're an author, teacher or publisher, a lot of the value of this new device for technology publishing is that the bigger screen size, finer resolution and Xray features all make the normal paperback text size down and linking much more palatable, eliminating many of the terrible page breaks or formula slaughters of previous devices, INCLUDING Ipad and other tablets. This means that you probably already have a format that will translate your LaTEX, diagrams, chemical formulas, etc. nicely for this device. The HD renders them beautifully, and the size eliminates a lot of wrap issues. We do recommend you NOT use reverses in print for formulas, because many e readers will black them out. This device gray scales or color voxels them so they are at least readable-- a VAST improvement.

Reviews.Title: Everything you could ask for, plus great Amazon support
Reviews.Author: Bhuddahood "AWAKE"
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.0" screen with 32 GB storage has exceeded my expectations. I got off to a bit of a rocky start, I have not been a tablet person, but Amazon's Customer Service deserves a five star rating for their efforts to ensure that my problems were resolved. There are also several free or nearly free books available fopr direct download to the kindle from the bookstore that have filled in any small gaps in info that the tutorial onboard the Kindle may not have covered in enough detail. For the Kindle itself, the sound is amazing, expecially through a pair of good earbuds, which also conserves on battery use. The life of a battery charge is very good and if you do not have a quick charger for a tablet already, it is worth the price to get the one made especially for the Kindle. It is very easy to download files from my computer to the Kindle. The screen images are nothing short of stunning. I have particularly enjoyed the books where the user can switch between reading oncreen or listening to the audio (while following the highlighted part onscreen, or even with the screen darkened). There are just a ton of inexpensive apps availoable through Amazon that work on the Kindle Fire. I particularly like the app that updates missions at NASA. The Kindle Fire has proven to be a pleasure to the eyes, the ears and my mind. As I keep learning more about how things work and how Amazon supports different features, the payoffs in all three areas keeps growing.I was interested in getting the Kindle Fire because of the claims made in the advertising. I was also interested in buying it because Amazon has always proven to be helpful to customers with valid problems. My experience with my beloved Kindle Fire has proven both of these reasons to be well founded. Amazon has definitely raised the bar with this product!UPDATE: MY WIFE HAS ENDURED WATCHING ME ENJOY MY KINDLE FIRE HD FOR AS LONG AS SHE COULD. TODAY, SHE HAD ME ORDER ONE EXACTLY LIE MINE FOR HER. I WAS ALWAYS WILLING TO SHARE, BUT IT HAS BECOME OBVIOUS THAT SHE NEEDED HER OWN. I EVEN SUGGESTED THAT SHE MIGHT WANT TPO GET AN APPLE WITH AIOS SYSTEM SO THAT WE WOULD HAVE ALL OF OUR BASES COVERED, APPLICATION WISE. HOWEVER, SHE HAS SEEN ME ENJOY TOO MANY GREATR BOOKS ON THE 8.9 INCH SCREEM. I HHAVE A CLOSE FRIEND WITH A 7 INCH SCREEN AND READING ON THE 8.9 IS MUCH MORE OF A PLEASURE. OVER EIGHT MONTHS LATER AND I STILL HAVE NOTHING BUT GOOD THINGS TO SAY FOR THE KINDLE FIRE HD AND FPOR THE GREAT SUPPORT AMAZON PROVIDES. THEY HAVE COME THROUGH EVERY TIME!

Reviews.Title: Incredible for entertainment content
Reviews.Author: Sean Lipscomb "lips01313"
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to consume entertainment, which most tablet users do, this device is the best device for the money.  With their prime videos, book library and list of top magazines, I have all the entertainment I need in a smooth operating device.  Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: very nice tablet
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: Very user friendly, definitely recommend for seniors or less computer literate people.  Not to take away from the tablet but things are just simplified and easy to access.  I actually cant see a techie liking it much as customization is bare minimum and apps are fewer to those who care.  That said, the display is beautiful for videos (though the 7 in is a tad sharper because of the size.  Its light, big but not too big and amazon prime provides endless entertainment, a very decent amount free.  I bought one for mom and own the 7 in myself.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality, Poor overseas customer support.
Reviews.Author: Grandchawhee
Reviews.Content: i really hate doing this, honestly I have been an amazon customer for years and have spent 1000's of dollars online on amazon. My kindle 8.9 experience however has since changed my opinion of the kindle format and of Amazon as a retailer.First of all, I am writing this following packing up 2, yes 2 replacement kindles (simultaneously) that are sitting on my table.I initially purchased the 8.9 HD on Jan 15 for the sole purpose of using it for textbooks. The 1st one came quickly however, the rocker volume was broken so a replacement was sent out. The replacement  had a defective touchscreen that was replaced by another. This one had what the tech described as a defective software/hardware interface. All I know is that the volume did not work when running an app.Sadly, I begin this evening by installing the 4th purchased screen protector on the 4th replacement kindle only to find after flipping it over that this kindle was a refurb! It honestly looked like someone ate a sheet pizza and then drew with their oily fingers on the back. Again, I called and talked to a gentleman who was overseas and spoke in broken English. He is now sending me yet another (5th kindle) and I anticipate that I might perhaps be able to view the digital textbook that was purchased in January for the class that ends in 2 weeks within a couple days.I understand that some people who have working kindle hd's love them. My daughter who owns an original Kindle Fire loves hers very much. I however can't in good conscious recommend this device to anyone. Or the Amazon customer service/replacement team for that matter. All I can do is hope that maybe the 5th time is the charm. Oh, that would be after I get the screen protector pack that I yet again just ordered on Amazon.Update 10/8/2013 -After 6 months of use, the 5th kindle has proven to be functional and usable (touch screen works and volume adjusts properly). The continued issues I experience are as follows:- The included Web browser is garbage and will lockup routinely. Do yourself a favor and download a replacement browser and set it to be the system default ASAP. I have experienced no issues with competing internet browsers and have concluded that amazon SILK is simply unusable.- Text books are hit or miss. Some of the texts that I have bought have formatting issues that cause in some cases text to be missing and/or picture artifacts to be displayed over certain text boxes, making reading complete chapters impossible. This may or may not be an amazon issue however, amazon should not market this tablet for college text books as they are not fully functional. My rating of this product stands as 5 kindles later the kindle is still not what I payed for.

Reviews.Title: I shoulda done my research
Reviews.Author: RAlthouse "justareview"
Reviews.Content: I've been a fan of Kindle since forever, so when I was in the market for a tablet, I ordered Fire 8.9. I wish I had researched it better. Fire is a fine device, but has some shortcomings in areas that are important to me.As an e-book device, my first disappointment was was lack of "collections", something I enjoyed on Touch. On Fire, books you download from the cloud appear on your home page page on Kindle's carousel arranged by date, author or title. But say you want to put all your 'mysteries' together? Won't be happening. My Catholic Studies books are mixed in with random fiction. A small thing, maybe, but a step backward from Touch.The next HUGE disappointment is that Kindle Fire seems less able to download and use most apps than my (very simple) smart phone. This isn't just lack of flash, this I believe, is Amazon hoping to market other apps. Take the simple yet very popular Candy Crush game. Nope, can't have that...but Amz has a ripoff of it. Or you can buy a book that will tell you HOW to use the app on Fire.  Facebook and Tumblr, yep, no problem. EPIX movie channel?  Well, you can dl the app, but since you have no Flash, you won't be watching movies with it.  And there are many, many games I had on my Touch which just aren't available on Fire. Look, if someone like ME is angered about apps that won't work, young people will surely be disappointed.I bought the cover Amazon recommends, and it's a dandy cover. Except that when Fire is plugged in and charging, you can't set your Kindle up to read or watch in landscape mode...the plug comes out the bottom. *So, you wanna watch a video, and keep your Fire plugged in?...see the problem there?Fire is fine for web browsing, and I like the fact that all my email accounts can be synch'd and in one location.  It is wonderful for reading, backlit and in color for magazines.But, even with my limited prowess of tablets and iPads, I just couldn't recommend it as a viable alternative to other tablets. Not until Amazon does whatever it is they need to do to make many common apps USEABLE on Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Mixed bag, not  a full featured device
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: Before I continue there are many features that the Kindle Fire provides, e.g. screen quality, access to streaming, decent sound (though volume c/b greater), HDMI connectivity, easy email access.......  that I like.  It continues to provide a reasonable platform to access media for entertainment purposes.My primary issue is that the Kindle is not a stand-a-lone device primarily in two areas:1.  It is impossible according to Amazon support to load pictures directly from my camera onto the Kindle Fire HD.  I do not understand the need to load the pictures on to a PC or or on the web via a PC before I can access them on my Kindle.2.  The Kindle also lacks the ability to connect to my WIFI connected printer. While this is likely due to lack of an app for my particular printer (an HP) it does reflect on the lack of some basic apps for this tablet or differences between the Windows and Amazon/Android approach to basic utilities.For now it looks like I will need to use my Windows laptop to accomplish these two basic tasks.  I find myself using the laptop at home and the Kindle less frequently.I expect that when it comes time to replace either the laptop or the tablet, that I will look at a Windows 8 tablet or for a different Android device that overcomes these limitations so that I don't need two computers.I recently purchased a Google Chromecast fob from Amazon and have been able to configure and use it with the Kindle.  Side loading Chrome and the Chromecast apps was relatively easy to do.  To date I have been able to use only with Netflix and Youtube, but not with the Chrome browser.  The experiment will continue as time allows.  The picture quality and streaming are fine.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: LT
Reviews.Content: Before purchasing a Kindle, I read reviews of each of the Kindles offered-could not decide between the Paperwhite and the Kindle Fire HD 8.9. When the price dropped to $269 for the 8.9, my mind was made up. Am so happy with the purchase.  The previous reviews stated web surfing was slow-mine flies. They said Silk crashes-has not happened on this one yet. There were complaints of limited apps--I have downloaded those I want so far and don't have time to search through all that are available. The sound is great-especially with headphones. Connected  it to our tv and watch Prime moves & TV-GREAT! I have a Macbook Pro and Asus Transformer laptop. They are great for what they do, and so is this Kindle. On top of it all, it fits in my purse so it is always with me. My latest venture was adding an app to download recipes from the websites, therefore I always have my recipe box with me at the grocery store!Really, really enjoy this Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Expectations exceeded...
Reviews.Author: William Schaefer "Billytech"
Reviews.Content: I had ordered and received a few Android tablets, and was not at all impressed - in the least. That is, until I got my first Kindle fire. I was hooked. (Check out my review). I had no real complaints, but I wanted a bigger screen. Then came Kindle HD, and HD8.9... I had to check it out. I checked the specs and decided that the first one was so well thought out, I'd try it out. Long story short, I was absolutely blown away when I got it. The HD8.9 is much better than I had hoped. The case is slim, really slim. It is balanced in weight, so it cradles in your hand perfectly. Then there is the screen. It's Bright, and very sharp. The color on it is especially warm... and not to be outdone by the sound - If you are into video viewing on your tablet - This is THE best experience out there - PERIOD. The picture is head to head with any Retina display from Apple, but the sound is FAR better. The Dolby speaker setup is absolutely astounding. Particularly when you realize the case of the 8.9 is SO thin. The simple to use "Masked" android OS is as simple as ever to use, and because Amazon screens every app to assure it will work on the fire HD, you can be sure it does.The battery life is crazy good, and there are surprise features that are outstanding. For example, The Fire HD has a "play button" when you open a book. Pressing the play button starts your Kindle reading the book to you in very clear English. Not and audio book, but every book I have put on it. I really like this... what a cool surprise.Another feature worthy of additional mention is the Wifi reception. The dual band/Antenna setup is very noticeable. A few wireless devices have trouble in certain rooms of my house...but certainly not my Kindle. Reception is strong in every room. This is noteworthy if this is an issue for you. Even my original Kindle fire had reception issues in certain rooms, but not my HD. If you tablet use consists of web browsing, Facebook/Twitter, Email, Movies and books, and general entertainment, you can NOT go wrong with the Kindle Fire HD's. This combined with Amazons rock solid reputation for customer service is reason enough to try it. Its performance and price are reason to keep and appreciate it. If you're on the fence on which tablet to get, I seriously recommend you check it out.You may be as surprised as I was, and if so, you will be quite glad you did.Amazon did it again.

Reviews.Title: Stunning Device - but not as a primary tablet
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: The bad:  Typing is not highly responsive.  The processor is a dual-core where as other devices built to be primary devices can be had with quad-cores.  If this comes out with a quad-core, I think it could have quite a slice of the market.That's my only complaint.  The device is born of its roots as a e-reader, and that functionality is simply mind-boggling in its simplicity and beauty.So... the good:Unimagineably beautiful display.  So glad I went with the 8.9 vice 7 inch model. I bought the Kindle Fire HD specifically for the hdmi output port. I tried in on a 24" Viewsonic 1080p HD computer monitor, and content rendered quite nicely.  Especially nice when reading magazines or books.  HD Movies played great on the larger screen (also tried on an Insignia 32" 720p HDTV) and this makes it quite fun and convenient.  However, the display on the Kindle Fire HD really blew away the images on my larger monitor and TV.Great Navigation.  It was pretty easy to get up and running with the device. But where my ownership gratitude meter really got pegged was when I downloaded the CNET user guide book in the lending library.Special Offers:  I find this tolerable enough to where I don't see the need to spend $15.00 for the no-ad device.  There's an ad on the unlock screen, and then that is it.  I say live with 'em and spend the 15 bucks on books, magazines and other content.Reading:  Unqualified.  Magazines display so nicely, they're almost preferable to me than hard copy (certainly the aspect of all those trees that gave their lives so I can have something interesting to read is a guilt-trip I no longer have suffer with :) )  I also like how you can zoom on the magazine pages and enlarge them to your own reading comfort level.Power:  The device is VERY SLOW to charge if you use any other device than the PowerFast charger.  I didn't order one when I got my Kindle, as I assumed any of my existing mini-usb chargers would work.  They do.  But it takes many hourse (overnite, actually) to charge.  I've since ordered the PowerFast adapter and eagerly await its arrival.Particular Scenario of note:  I was unable to get an appointment for an eye exam I needed to do this past weekend. The rep told me told me the walk-in wait would be 2-3 hours.  So, I rented an HD movie I wanted to see (you can only download videos if you rent them, a reasonable requirement to me) for $3.99.  Most enjoyable wait time I've ever had.I did go for the 32G of storage.  I did so for several reasons not the least of which is storage of my digital photos, etc.  I think it is the smart move.  I don't regret it at all.(Update) - Forgot to mention about the device's weight.  The 8.9-inch device is a bit on the heavy side.  With the Otterbox I purchased to protect it, the combo weighs in at 2 lbs 5 ozs.  It doesn't sound like much but it is a bit too heavy to comfortably hold and read with 1 hand.  However, the otterbox serves a dual purpose:  as a solid protective case as well as the fact it converts into a tray to stand or lean the device in.  This works well, as doing so makes a VERY comfortable to hold in your lap and read/watch your content.  Matter of fact so comfortable, I would hesitate to own it without the Otterbox (some reviews of the otterbox complain it changes the screen dynamics because of their protective screen - I have not found any problem along that lines.  However you can if you wish remove the screen and put a screen protector straight on the device.  I didn't see the need as I didn't experience any viewing degradation).Overall, I am completely enthralled with the unit.  Just to revisit what I was saying about the CNET lender book "Mastering the Kindle Fire":  The Device is set up to primarily direct you to Amazon's content store.  You can override that, but it's not easy to find the how-to's.  This book takes you through that so you can load and run non-Amazon approved apps and content safely and without risking damage to your Kindle's OS.  I highly recommend grabbing that book.Also, I have Google Play and found a website with instructions on how to set that up on the Kindle, as you will have to side-load the Google Play App.  I've not done that yet, but once I do I will update my review.I will also update on how it goes installing and using Calibre as I do have a library of e-books I want to side load on the device.Happy reading y'all!

Reviews.Title: Greatest Christmas Present
Reviews.Author: Tori K.
Reviews.Content: The Amazon Kindle Fire HD is a great Christmas present for ALL ages! I received it as a gift for Christmas and I haven't even had it a week. I'm still trying to figure out how it works, but so far, it's working great! The 16 GB holds so much memory and it almost never runs out! I'm using my gift cards to pay for things. If you're looking to purchase a Kindle Fire, you made the right decision! If you have an iPod that is running out of space to download music, you can download the songs you can't seem to find any space for on your iPod onto your Kindle Fire! You can watch videos, movies, and trailers of movies just like Netflix. You can download apps, books, games, search the web, and more!

Reviews.Title: It's the best tablet at any price
Reviews.Author: Z. Guo "Z"
Reviews.Content: **Hardware**Kindle fire HD 8.9"  has 254 PPI (pixels per inch), and the iPad III is just 264 PPI. Kindle fire HD 8.9'' gives 33% more PPI than iPad mini. Kindle Fire HD also uses wide polarized filter and luminated the touch surface which makes it more colorful and reduces 20% glare.Kindle fire HD 2-core OMAP processor can do 12 billion FLOP (floating point operations per second) which is 50% faster than the 4-core Tegra 3 processor used by nexus 7. Kindle fire HD 2-core OMAP processor also gives 7.3 MB memory bandwidth which is 40% faster than Tegra 3 processor used by nexus 7. Please ask someone who knows computer architecture on the reason that a 2-core processor can be faster than a 4-core processor.Kindle Fire HD has dual speaker and Dolby sound. Both iPad III and Nexus 7 have just single speaker and no Dolby sound.Kindle file HD supports dual band wifi and has dual antenna which is 41% faster than iPad III and 54% faster than Nexus 7. Kindle fire HD also has MIMO which enhances signal strengths. Neither iPad III nor Nexus 7 has MIMO which means the echo of the radio frequency weakens the signal strength.Kindle Fire HD stands out easily with its superior hardware and it delivers better experience when watching HD movies and reading books and magzines.The 199$ 7'' Kindle Fire HD comes with 16GB storage while the 200$ Nexus 7'' comes with only 8GB. The 16GB Nexus 7 costs 249$.The 199$ 7'' Kindle Fire HD and the 8.9'' Kindle Fire HD come with 1GB RAM. Nexus 7 also has 1GB RAM. iPad mini only has 500MB RAM.The Kindle Fire HD (both the 7'' and 8.9'') has HDMI output. Neither iPad nor Nexus 7 has HDMI output. How painful it would be to link to a HDTV without HDMI?**Content**Amazon ecosystem has 20+ million songs, 100+ thousand movies and TV shows, and 1.7 million books (without counting free books). Among the books, 15+ thousands have audio companion books. Amazon also allows Kindle lending library. Don't forget Amazon also has Kindle Direct Publishing books, which makes 27% of the top 100 kindle books sold. Kindle Fire HD uses Android so it can run almost all Android Apps (just download the apk first and then install).Google's ecosystem has only 4+ million books (after counting free books), millions of songs and thousands of movies and TV shows.Apple's iTune has only 1.5+ million books (after counting free books),  millions of songs and thousands of movies and TV shows.** Software innovations **Kindle Fire HD has the following features (which I think neither iPad nor Nexus 7 has):  Whisphersync for books and games.  Immersion reading for audio books.  X-ray for books and movies.  Parental Control.** Cost **Kindle Fire HD 8.9'' costs 30$ less than iPad mini. Kindle fire HD 7'' 16GB costs 50$ less than Nexus 7 16GB.Kindle Fire HD does not force customers to buy a charger. The charger can be bought together with Kindle Fire HD for just 10$, and  20$ if it is purchased separated.** Customer Service **Amazon is very customer centric.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Big D
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire 8.9" for about a month now & I love everything about it. It exceeds all my expectations. I wanted something bigger than the 7", yet smaller thatn the 10.1" of larger tablets. It's still small enought to carry in a purse. All features are great!

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd 8,.9
Reviews.Author: deaneane delong
Reviews.Content: this is the BEST gagget ever invented !!! I never thought i would have to have something other than my cell phone to play when i was board but now i have my kindle and i NEVER leave home without it !! Ive got games and movies always ready when i am & the perks of prime is awsome love streaming free movies

Reviews.Title: Great tablet at a great price
Reviews.Author: Walter Gross
Reviews.Content: I just got this tablet and I love it. I have the old kindle fire and this is a very big improvement. The screen is fantastic but in my opinion the biggest improvement is the faster processor. The old kindle fire could be unresponsive at times. That problem is gone with the new better processor. Also the wifi is wicked good. It picks up five or six networks where other tablets pick up just one. Finally, the old kindle was a little thick and clunky.  This is very thin and light. I was thinking of getting the 7 inch Kindle Fire HD. I'm very glad I spent the extra 100 dollars and got the 8.9 inch version instead. It is totally worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: Love this bigger and brighter Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Barbara T. Canario "Bobbie C."
Reviews.Content: I bought the 1st Kindle Fire 7" and let my sister try it and she wanted one so I ordered her the Fire 7". Passed my original Fire 7" to my granddaughter who encouraged me to go bigger if I was going to order the Fire HD.  I'm so glad I did. Love everything about it and can hardly wait to watch a movie on it this week on my long flight to Florida from Hawaii. I've owned every Kindle that was made and I keep on upgrading and passing on my used ones which family and friends are happy to receive. So far Kindle readers have never let me down.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Awesome Tablet (added more)
Reviews.Author: Haywood "Haywood"
Reviews.Content: My short initial take on the new generation of Kindle. My Kindle Fire HD 8.9 arrived earlier today. I was very anxious to open the package and get my hands on this baby to see how it felt. First thing I noticed is the quality of the build. Excellent all around. I fired it up, using the optional quick charger I bought with it. Had it registered and software updated within 10 minutes or so. The images on the screen are crystal clear with vivid and true color. I played an Eric Clapton YouTube video right out of the box to see how the picture and sound quality were. Very impressive, to say the least. The speed between my WiFi and the Kindle is great. No flutter, no hiccups, just a fast and consistent connection. I surfed the web a little bit and this new Kindle HD moved effortlessly through the pages I browsed.I have many more things I want to try on this new tablet, and I'll get around to it when time allows. That said, my early impressions are WINNER WINNER Chicken Dinner. This thing is top notch. We have a first generation Kindle Fire and use the heck out of it. The new generation is everything I expected and so much more. I also bought several of the Kindle Fire HD 7" tablets for family members. I fully expect they will enjoy them a bunch. I have an Apple I-Phone 4S and think it's a very good phone. I tried the I-Pad out, and while it impressed, for me, it was severely over priced given what you get. I'm not bashing the I-Pad at all, so please don't you Apple FanBoys come out and attack me en masse. LOL I know how sensitive Apple users can be. Look, they make very cool stuff, no question. My problem is this. Simply put, it's way over priced. All you have to do is look at their profit margins. For me, the new generation Kindle HD is right in my wheelhouse. It's priced very well for what it delivers. I am a BIG time Amazon junkie too. I buy a ton of stuff from Amazon and have never once had a bad customer service experience. Buying the Kindle HD was a natural fit for me. I am looking forward to using it a ton.I'd like to take a second to thank Jeff Bezos and his great team for bringing us an affordable tablet with top notch quality and features too numerous to mention. I love Amazon. I'm a customer for life.More to come, stay tuned.Added this >>>>>>>>Battery life on this 8.9" Kindle Fire HD is simply outstanding. I seriously can't believe how long the juice lasts. Outstanding!!!As I add apps to my Kindle, I am even more impressed with the flexibility of this tablet. And whoever said the app store is lacking is seriously mislead. there's a huge variety of superbly done apps.I use my Kindle a TON. I can't tell you how impressive this tablet is. And when I consider what I paid for it, I can only once again say a huge Thank you to Amazon's Team kindle. This tablet is everything and a lot more than I expected. The scary part is, I'm just getting to know it. Thank you Jeff and team. I'm a thrilled customer/user of this tablet and of course, Amazon in general.

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: Dianne A. Van Voorhees
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to get the new Kindle Fire HD. I use an iPhone and have iPads in the house. I also have a Kindle with keypad that I love. This new device is well made and has a beautiful display. The web browser is awesome. I was surprised at how many apps were available for the Kindle Fire. I set it up with my multiple email accounts, calendars, and contacts. This lead to my first real disappointment. It's not possible to sync my Outlook contacts or calendar from work. While I don't need this device for work, it starts getting annoying when I have to put it down and reach for my phone to see all of my calendars and contacts in one place. The next issue I had was the power button. It's hidden so well in the frame of the device that I really have to search and almost need to actually look at it to find it. What's the big deal? Well, I like the iPhone and iPad's obvious wake button because I can get to it right away without searching for it. And, since I thought this new Kindle with its backlit display would be nice for after dark reading in bed without waking my husband, I would appreciate less awkward fumbling in the dark to turn the thing on.That leads to my next complaint- this thing is too big for reading in bed. I can't lie on my side and hold it propped up with one hand comfortably. And, it's a spotlight shining at my husband's side of the bed when I do.Finally, though it has a lot of apps, most aren't free. So, to have apps I use on my iPhone or iPad on the Kindle, I have to pay. That's jarring since I've used many if them for free on the other platforms. And, the app I use most often is Facebook. The Facebook app on iPhone is annoying. But, on the Kindle Fire, it's nearly useless. And, if you think that autocorrect is frustrating on iPhone/iPad - you will be as frustrated by Kindle's auto correct spell checking feature. And, possibly frustrated with what seemed to me a slower keyboard.If I didn't have a familiarity and daily reliance on my synced email, calendars and contacts, or constant need to check FB, I'd be completely satisfied with this Kindle. Alas, I don't like putting a fancy expensive device down to use another to get information I need/want. So, it's a 4 not a 5.

Reviews.Title: Media Consumption Monster--get this tablet!!!
Reviews.Author: Thorr
Reviews.Content: Not going to go into a long detailed review of the Kindle Fire HD.  There are many others out there since this model has been out for quite some time.  But I will add that this device does exactly what it advertises.  If you are looking for a "media consumption device" then the Kindle Fire HD is for you.  It is NOT a productivity device!!  I repeat...do not buy this if you are expecting to get caught up on your spreadsheet building, PowerPoint presentations, Word documents or photo editing.  It is not designed for that nor is it marketed for that purpose.  The Kindle Fire HD is a media device and that is all.  It excels at playing high quality HD videos/movies, music, games and works wonderfully for browsing the net.  Can other devices do the same stuff and maybe even more...yes.  Can they do it at this price point...no.I have not signed up for the 4G LTE service so I can't speak to that.  I only use mine on Wi-Fi and it works great.  I got the 4G LTE model because it was so discounted as a refurb and I wanted the option of signing up for the 4G LTE service in the future.Also, if you are like me and already very involved with the Amazon ecosystem, there is no better tablet.  I believe it would still hold it's own even if your not heavily involved in the Amazon ecosystem but it probably won't be the shining star when separated from the ecosystem.  Overall, a solid 5 stars and I would recommend this to anyone ans especially people involved in the Amazon ecosystem.Oh and the refurb Kindle Fire HD that I got was new.  I mean I even inspected the entire device with a bright flashlight specifically looking for a blemish of any type.  Nothing.  This is a new device and works just like new.

Reviews.Title: Very well pleased met and it exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: Joe  J
Reviews.Content: I had the smaller Kindle reader with 3g since it first came out so this was an amazing upgrade.  All my books in the smaller reader (which I find I want to keep) were readily available in the 8.9 in fact they sync between the two and both readers remained activated, all at no cost to me.The 4G is good stuff to have and fast, also!  I Skyped from a hospital room so my ill wife could talk and see her son.  I made a quick check on an important prescription availability from my car.  The browser is powerful and easy to use.Reading on this Kindle is a treat.  I bookmark and highlight when I read, and it is so easy to do on this one.  There are lots and lots of good apps for this.  Unless I need online services, I read in airplane mode and battery time really gets extended but it's very easy to switch back online, it only takes about 5 seconds.I could go on and on but there is nothing that I don't like about this.

Reviews.Title: Tablet Novice here, read on if you identify, leave if you're a know-it-all
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoMan
Reviews.Content: So I pick up on technology a bit late, usually a few years late. This review is meant for late comers like me, people who are tech savvy but choose to wait out for the new tech to mature and then spend 25% of the initial cost.Was hearing a lot about everybody replacing their notebooks/home PC's with tablets and upon seeing Asian tourists takingpictures at Hoover dam with these instead of their cameras, I decided to enter the 2010's.After doing the exhaustive research as you have to do for any buying decision nowadays, I narrowed down my choices to Kindle 8.9HD, Nexus 10.1" and the iPad 10", felt like a cheat at BestBuy where I went to check out all my choices without any intention of buying them there.  I decided to go with FireHD as the intended use for me is to watch videos, read emails, view PDF's and light spreadsheet work, the deciding factor was the price, stereo speakers and most importantly the screen resolution.Must point out that the Amazon AppStore does have very limited offerings, I hate that the kindle OS does not let me read my gmail emails on the app I downloaded from the 1market store, the other apps I downloaded from there do work, including the google maps which saved me from returning this tablet.So, in conclusion, here's the gist:1) Great product for Amazon-Heads, people who are married into their system with prime membership and so on2) Great product for limited use like basic email/spreadsheet/doc work, watch video on netflix/prime, view PDFs etc., NOT a great  product if you're designing the next city center or the next new gen car...sorry had to take a dig at the reviewers who make it  sound like these are the reasons they are buying the higher end tablets3) Great product when looked at as an alternative to the more expensive and a bit bigger screen sized tablets, which by the way  are only about an inch bigger, I'd rather save the $2004) Now if you are an advanced user and still reading this review, you know there are ways to root the latest Google OS on this  devise and have it run just as efficiently and smoothly, this bit of info is only meant for tech savvy novices who like me are a bit  lazy but do want the newest OS to run on their investment :)

Reviews.Title: True HD viewing!
Reviews.Author: Kat M.
Reviews.Content: I really like the HD clarity. Although not all video's work on this tablet. I had to install Dolphin to be able to install and watch video's that requires Adobe flash player. I am glad and thankful to those people on youtube that did the video on step by step way to install the flash player which Kindle does not support but those smart tech people still found have a way to make it work. The only thing bad about this kindle is you can not use it while charging, it won't charge when in use. You have to close or shut it down and it takes forever to charge. So I made sure to charge it before I sleep then by morning hopefully it will be at least 98 to 100% charge. other than that its a nice tablet for what I use it for. ..reading and watch videos and email.

Reviews.Title: leaves me frustrated far too often
Reviews.Author: T. Raynoha
Reviews.Content: Apps often stop mid-use, and some even stop when I've never used them. Swype to type often has dead spots, and not always the same places. The quick charger completely ruins the whole machine, but the usb charger is very slow and doesn't last a day.  I had to return my first for a replacement and within hours had the dead spot on the keyboard.  Not sure why the hiccups, but I wanted so badly to love my kindle fire, particularly when the rest of the family is iPod ... the movies do look and sound great, but it's not worth the extra money to buy HD, which sort of makes the whole system moot. It's pretty heavy with the case on it.  I love the IDEA of the fire, but I have to be honest and say in reality it's not what I hoped for the price.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" does everything I expect it to
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I lost my 7" Kindle Fire HD and thought long and hard about what to replace it with.  I considered another 7", the Paperwhite, and the 8.9" as well as a tablet (Android and iPad).  The reviews almost talked me out of the 8.9" but I decided to give it a try.  Simply put, it does everything I expect it to.Please understand that I mostly use it as a reader and sometimes to watch movies or surf the web.  I play a couple of games every now and then and run an app or two.  I didn't buy it because it is a tablet.  I bought it because it is a media delivery device and my media vendor of choice is Amazon.  It does its job well.  If you want a tablet, go buy a tablet.  Don't buy something that is almost a tablet and then complain about the things it doesn't do.If you are looking for a device to enjoy the wide range of media services offered by Amazon, the 8.9" Kindle Fire HD will serve you well.  If you are more interested in apps, well, you may need to consider another device.

Reviews.Title: Love it -- Especially for the price, but . . .
Reviews.Author: J. G. Ziegler "Kid Zig"
Reviews.Content: This review is for the 32gb WiFi version.  This is my 3rd kindle and my favorite yet.  This one replaces my original Kindle Fire (which my wife now uses, replacing her Nook tablet).  This is a great device -- fast, awesome screen and sound, and full of features.  But it is not perfect -- the negatives would include: (1) no rear-facing camera to take pictures or video of what you are facing, (2) no plug-in charging cord -- costs $20 extra (or $10 if you catch it on sale), (3)charging time is not fast, even with the fast power cord.  I have not had it out in sunlight to see how well the screen works outside.That being said, the positives far outweigh the negatives.  First, this device is inexpensive -- especially now that they have lowered the price.  I will pay this price and take a little smaller screen any day rather than pay for an IPad.  The processor is lightning fast, and streams very well -- I love Amazon prime and have only had one glitch so far -- better than my computer (which has an extremely fast processor).  The screen resolution is awesome and the sound is also great.  I can't wait to use on a long plane flight (to Hawaii in May).  The Internet and download speeds are great, and it is much nicer reading magazines on this bigger screen -- as far as books go, I don't really see it being much better than the 7" Kindle -- but for people with vision issues the bigger screen would make it easier to read in a larger font.Once again love this item -- some minor issues, but for the price it blows away anything else out there.  I am not necessarily anti-IPad, but not going to pay that price when Amazon gives me this.  Thanks again Amazon for giving us an AWESOME product.

Reviews.Title: Nook HD+ vs Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "xcasto"
Reviews.Content: Lately I've become a huge fan of UltraViolet (UV) and the ability to LEGALLY stream movies, so when I saw that the Nook HD/HD+ connected to UV and also had a micro SD slot I rushed out to get one, the full nine inch one. B&N; only gave me those features to rave about since the Kindle Fire HD didn't have them.Though the Amazon Kindle Fire HD 8.9" doesn't have an expansion SD slot or UV connection (via the device) it does have a built in camera, micro HDMI port, Stereo speakers, ties into Prime and I can watch the movies I've purchased on Google or a couple UV services like VUDU, Flixster and CinemaNow. All those things weren't available on the Nook HD at the time I originally wrote this review.I've read a number of reviews that criticize Amazon for having the Fire HD too proprietary. Obviously they have not even looked at the Nooks which decided to move away from the universal micro USB charger to a proprietary one that doesn't even allow charging when connected to a USB port (only data transfer, with the last OS update it appears to trickle charge now).  For those that think the SD slot or data transfer will allow "Side Loading" apps onto the Nook, NOPE, B&N; has blocked that and the only way to even come close to that ability is to become a Software Developer and load the apps as a Developer would... Though even this doesn't allow the apps to be visible until you use button press options to gain access to the apps (with the last OS update developer loaded apps are now visible if they are loaded after the upgrade, those loaded before will remain hidden until they are updated). What a pain, and the UV connection the Nook brags about fails to update as it should causing further headaches.Yes, I'm loving my Fire HD even with a shorter battery life and a missing SD slot. The Amazon AppStore alone makes it a worthy investment, but I added a bluetooth keyboard and now I use it more frequently than I do my Laptop.Since I purchased this through Amazon it came to me ready to go and even gave a discount for the Keyboard and AC adapter I got with it.If you are torn between the Nook or the Kindle, I can tell you that the Kindle sports more features that will be used than those that won't.-- I have to admit that B&N; did a smart move by allowing the Google Play Store to be included in their last OS update. This is a needed improvement for the Kindle Fire HD (as well) but not one I expect anytime soon, if at all.

Reviews.Title: My very good multi-functional photo album. .
Reviews.Author: Gordon Ramsay
Reviews.Content: Bought my wife an iPad and I own a Mac but I needed something to show my photos of our trips. I was told (and shown) by another Kindle Fire user that it was a terrific tool for that plus it gives you just about everything else that its competitors offer. . and I am very pleased with its pefformance

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB
Reviews.Author: ROBERT E. KELLY
