Reviews.Content: SO FAR, SO GOOD.My wife has had her new toy just a few days and enjoys it.A word to the wise, The Kindle Fire does not come with an instruction manual. However, all the info you will need can be accessed on the screen. Take the time to READ before you attempt to start SKYPE etc.. Also, it turns out, the screen is a bit weak in daylight.I purchased my wife's Kindle with the Fast charger, Leather Case, Screen Protector, 16 GB, 2 year coverage and DID NOT pay extra for the "Without Special Offers" feature. The Special Offers don't interfere with my wife's enjoyment at all. Save your money, buy 2 gallons of gas for your car and a candy bar!Oh, the SKYPE feature and the HD camera are the bomb! My wife is video chatting everyone! You'll probably get a call soon. FYI: It seems that everything on the Kindle costs $$$, just watch what you are ordering.UPDATE: A few days later and it turns out I should have ordered my wife's Kindle with 32 GB - apparently games need more GB's than I thought. Ops!

Reviews.Title: Switched from iPad to Kindle
Reviews.Author: drseuss74
Reviews.Content: I had an 1st gen ipad and was looking to upgrade.  I had looked at all of the newer ipads, but wasn't sure if I wanted to spend that much money.  Over the last 6 months I have become a prime member and started making all of my purchases from Amazon for items such as movies, mp3's, and other products.  After realizing that I could purchase movies and mp3's cheaper than iTunes I started looking more into the Kindle Fire.The picture quality is noticeably better on the Kindle Fire when held side by side.  I would recommend downloading movies in 720P, because if you download in 1080p it takes up almost twice as much space.  The sound is perfect, downloads are fast, and the only complaint is that some of my favorite apps are not compatible with the Kindle.I still have my iphone, but doubt I will ever puchase another ipad based on price and features.

Reviews.Title: Good for the proce - good hardware, but stuck to Amazon store
Reviews.Author: jokerji
Reviews.Content: Tough choice and spent a week comparing the Nook, Kindle and iPad and finally settled on the Kindle.  I had a bad experience with my previous two el-cheapo Android tablets and ended up returning them all and was a little skeptical about Anroid, being an iOS fan.  I'm keeping the Kindle..PROS:Great for the priceGreat clarity and soundRight size - like the carouselGood wifi and battery lifeReading more books now!CONS:No GPS and SD card (free cloud isn't all that)Charger should be FREEToo long to chargeNo Google Store!The front only camera is poorBe ready for occassional crashesHidden power buttonAd's are not bad - show during screen unlock only

Reviews.Title: Best investment for the price
Reviews.Author: Christy
Reviews.Content: Today's economy every penny counts ...do some homework. This is a smart purchase. OK have no limits! I can complete business with ease on my Kindle Fire. I shop..research...store pictures and videos....watch movies and check email with connection speeds faster than my home computer.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was looking for.
Reviews.Author: Multi Media Addict
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire for about a month now and have no complaints.  It is exactly what I expected and wanted.  It does not have all of the functionality of an iPad, but it is not supposed to.  I use my Fire as a media delivery and communication tool.  If you want to do work or have a replacement for a laptop, this may not be for you.  I wanted something with a great screen and sound for video for watching movies on planes and while traveling.  Movies look and sound fantastic.  As far as other online activities, I use it for e-mail and general web surfing and it does all of these exceptionally well.  Now that Amazon has auto-rip for CD purchases, I have the majority of my music available via the cloud as well, which was an unexpected benefit!

Reviews.Title: It Does What I Want!!
Reviews.Author: James Gilbert
Reviews.Content: I researched affordable tablet options and upon a great offer on the Kindle I pounced.  I enjoyed reading the reviews of some users..massive litanies...with some helpful information.I really did not know what to expect from this tablet.  But I think one must ascertain what they expect and want from a tablet or any device.  I realized that I wanted a device that had good battery life, web browsing, music, movies and book availabilty, maybe some games...sort of a media device.  The Wi-Fi reception was a great selling point.The Kindle has exceeded my expectations.  An example:  I was watching Amazon Prime Movies via my Blu-Ray dvd player with wi-fi and the signal faded for some reason.  I picked up my Kindle and the movie was there at the same point it had stopped on my dvd  player..I resumed watching on Kindle.Another example:  I purchased a CD from Amazon 6 years ago..and to my surprise I received an e-mail that the CD was being added to my Cloud Player for free.  I didn't even remember I had the CD! Nice touch.I had some questions and some slight user issues.  I emailed Kindle service and I will tell you, the customer service wasamazing.  Very helpful resolution. One issue was with my email account that I had changed password on.  I could not get the Kindle to accept the password.  I sent an email to service and they advised I should call them to resolve the issue.  I requested a call from them on the Amazon site..within a split second my phone rang and I was assisted very professionally.I am still discovering my Kindle.  I'm not sure that books will be easy to read.  I must adjust brightness and perhaps chose a different background or font.  The HD resolution is outstanding.I recommend th Kindle Fire HD 8.9 very highly.

Reviews.Title: Blown Away by Display
Reviews.Author: Doc Wittmer "DocWittmer"
Reviews.Content: This is one fantastic device.  I have had several others, including the newest iPad and Motorola Xoom.  I sent the iPad and Xoom off to Best Buy exchange to get gift cards.  I ordered the Fire because I wanted something that was more portable and easier for my wife to use with little computer knowledge.  I think I am going to keep it instead!!  HA!  The device is so easy to use and the picture quality is exceptional.  The screen is large enough for 2 to watch a movie in bed without discomfort.  Yes you need to buy a charger or use a USB charger.  If you have any USB charger for your iPod or iPhone or other electronic device it will work and they are really cheap anyway.  Also, if you want to watch movies on your TV through the micro HDMI port then you will need to buy a cable.  Make sure you buy the micro and not the mini as the mini will not fit the Fire.  They also make converter tips for a standard HDMI cable if you don't want to purchase the cable.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet for a college student
Reviews.Author: Anne Gray
Reviews.Content: (Writing from my moms amazon account)This is by far the best tablet that you can get for a college student. Yes it is not an iPad people...but through that it allows me to not be distracted as much as i would be with an iPad or an actual android tablet. The fire definitely contends with all other tablets and is plenty powerful. I myself and a computer junkie and i use this tablet over my macbook pro whenever i can for the portability as well as functionality. I love this thing and take it to every class and have it due everything for me simply a must have for any college student.

Reviews.Title: Glad I held out for this product
Reviews.Author: Sharon Mcdonald "Travel mom"
Reviews.Content: I am loving my new kindle. I had the second edition, i think it was the 2nd.  I had the one with the keyboard, I loved this one and took it with me every where.  When I heard about this larger screen with HD I started saving up for it.  The larger screen is awesome.  I love reading my magazines on a tablet now.  The display is crystal clear.  Amazon Prime movies are instantly available to watch.  Great investment.  I am so glad I got the 4G LTE wireless edition.  I love being able to search for something right away and not having to wait until I get home. I was hedging between an iPad or this.  I selected the kindle because the library of books I already had with my older kindle.  I am more a reader then internet surfer but with this product I can do both anytime, anywhere!!!  I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with the product.
Reviews.Author: Encourage thinking "xena"
Reviews.Content: I purchased 3 for holiday presents for my hubby, son, and myself.  At first, we were happy, but a bit confused since there was no manual.  Our initial impression was well... they look nice... but what do they do besides look pretty and you can read books?  I purchased a manual and now we're thrilled.  Love them! I had read the reviews before my purchase and knew enough to go ahead and purchase the charger.  Surfing the web is a little strange, but I expected it to be different than a PC or laptop.  It's fine.  The facebook app is a little less than wonderful, but it's fine.  What I've been so impressed by is HD screen.  It's everything promised.  We haven't owned any of the previous Kindles so I have nothing to compare my experience with, but I love reading a book with the Kindle HD.  It took me forever to struggle with my feelings about e-readers because of my fear of publishing companies losing jobs, etc., compared to my wish to save some trees.  Quite a problem for my deeply held convictions, but I talked myself into it.  I LOVE IT for reading books.  Yes, I will still order books (it's the only way I can justify it in my mind) but when I've finished a book in a series and I don't have the next, or the e-book only novellas or supplements, it's great.  I can read after my husband has gone to sleep without having a light on.  Lamps never seem to put out the correct light for reading or you have to sit where you're not comfortable.  No problem with the Kindle.  You can read anywhere.  My son loves the fact he can read out of print or free books.  I got one for him especially because when he goes to college next year he will have no place to store all the books he reads.  Trust me, you can hardly find his bedroom furniture under all his stacks of books (he has filled up his bookshelves to maximum limit).  So, for college students who read a lot, it's perfect.  My husband does a lot with facebook, surfing the web, and playing solitaire.  He is thrilled he can use his Kindle as opposed to sitting with his laptop on his lap.  They're perfect.  We are all thrilled.  Just make sure you get a book so you know what all the Kindle contains.  There's a lot of stuff you won't even know you have.  It's pretty loaded.  But you have to have a manual to tell you where to find them.

Reviews.Title: What a wonderful upgrade
Reviews.Author: C. Bowman
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the Kindle came right on the day it said it would. Thank you, Amazon. You open up the box, and there is your new 'toy'. I bought the charger when I purchased the Kindle so I was ready to go.I have had the Kindle Fire 7" since last October '11 and loved it.  I used it every day to read, check mail, search the web, play games and watch movies from Droid TV. (great app). I also have a Galaxy tab 10".When Amazon came out with the HD 8.9" I couldn't resist.  I received it yesterday and cannot put it down.  The HD is wonderful.  Sound is much better than on the 7".  I don't have to strain to hear music or movies.  Over all, it is a wonderful upgrade from the regular Kindle Fire 7".  As for the ads people mention; I don't even see them.If you are considering buying a Kindle, this is the one.  You will not be disappointed.Also, I needed some questions answered about transferring my old Kindle 7" to a family member, and the email service I received from Amazon was awesome.  Very quick to respond.  Thank you again. Also the Swype for the keyboard is a great time-saver.

Reviews.Title: Fills a great niche
Reviews.Author: Edward Hrybenko "Ed H NY"
Reviews.Content: I love my iphone, use my wife's ipad and have owned the first nook and nook tablet.  After a week with the Kindle Fire 8.9, I have very few complaints and far more praise:The great:- Perfect size for a commuter:  Can be held easily when sitting and standing on the subway.  Very light.- Perfect size for content:  WSJ, Sports Ilustrated, GQ, movies, books all look great. Love the easy navigation for digital publications- Nice, simple layout:  Didn't need much of a tutorial.  Carousel, simple settings page, top navigation all easy to use- Amazon Prime: A great deal if you order often from Amazon and want free content for your Kindle- Price:  I bought during a one day sale for  about $250.  With the free content, can't be beat.- Screen: Text and video crisp and clear- Sound: I used to have to take my nook tablet out of the case to hear.  Not with KindleThe ok:- I haven't paid to avoid ads yet, but I'm close.  Not great with random things popping up as your home screen- App selection: Hoping it improves.  Strong with medai, weak with games. Not much out there.The rest:- I was torn about buying the Amazon case based on mediocre reviews, but I think it's fine.  About as slim, sturdy and light as possible, which is exactly what I was looking for.  If you want more functionality and visual appeal (better stand, leather, etc) you'll end up with extra weight and bulk.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new kindle fire HD! I'm personally not an apple kinda gal but did consider getting the ipad since it's one of the top tablets out there. My bf loves his ipad but playing around with it I learned that I do love the menu buttons that the ipad lacks. I did also look at the nook, asus, and other tablets and decided to go with the fire hd and couldn't be happier. I already own the samsung galaxy s powered but android and this kindle runs in a very similar was so the transition wasn't that hard. the graphics are great and the battery life is awesome. I play sims on it a lot which tends to drain the battery when i play on my phone but with my kindle it lasts a few hours of playtime no problem. I'm able to download most of my phone apps on my kindle and skype works great on here too. Very satisfied with my purchase and the price couldn't be beat. I bought the wall adapter in the same purchase as my kindle to save $10 on the adapter price (when purchased together). If you're debating on which tablet to get. Get what's best for you, not what's popular. For me, the kindle suits all my needs.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 32 GB!!
Reviews.Author: CK
Reviews.Content: I am having so much fun with this Kindle Fire HD 8.9 32 GB!I already have the 3G older Kindle which was great for reading books but when my 83 year old Dad showed me his 7" Kindle fire, I fell in love with the idea of being able to play movies and look at photos on a Kindle.A year later my husband asked me what I wanted for Christmas and so I started my research on Kindles!I chose the larger size KIndle Fire HD because of my less than stellar eyesight and the speakers sounded better than the 7" version which I tested at BB. I chose the 32 GB version since you can never have too much storage space and doubling the storage was worth the extra $70.I also chose the Kindle over its competitors because I love Amazon and their products and their super easy to navigate website. After I discovered the location of their free ebooks, I have oodles to read and for free and Amazon also offers lots of ebooks under $3.I connected my new Kindle to my PC and it was very easy to transfer my photos and favorite music to the new Kindle...did all this without reading any instruction manual just the old trial and error method.My personal videos were harder but found a free converter link to convert my videos to mp3 so they could be viewed on my kindle:  [...] The Freemake converter was the only one I found that was totally free and didn't put a watermark on your video and was super easy to use too!I also transferred from my PC some of my adobe format ebooks. Still figuring out how to move them to the books tab but for now they show on the kindle carousel and read just like the regular Kindle e books.I chose the Defender Otter box to house my kindle since it comes with the screen protector already in place.It does make the Kindle heavier but makes up for the weight since I just rest the kindle in the otter box tray on my lap. The otter also makes the volume and on/off button easier to see and the touch screen works perfectly with the Otter screen protector in place.The only defect I found on my Kindle was a tiny pin prick sized hole in the center of the glass. The screen protector from the Otterbox makes the tiny hole invisible. I hadn't noticed the pin prick hole in the glass until I had already downloaded all my stuff so decided to keep the kindle since the hole has not affected the performance or appearance.I clicked on the "web" tab and was easily able to bookmark my favorite websites. I had no problem accessing them and didn't have any freezing problems.I purchased the DVD Hunger Games through Amazon and was delighted to find it also in my Amazon cloud. It was very easy to also download onto my Kindle device. The picture was crystal clear...truly HD quality and it was a blast to watch the movie on my kindle...speakers worked great and it also worked great with the ear phones I already had.I joined Amazon prime and loved watching the free streaming tv shows...watched the first Star trek episode and several episodes from Glee so far...all free and easy to access. Also "borrowed" my first book and am reading it now. Only downside to the book per month that we're able to borrow is that they're not new books.As for the "advertising" shown on the kindle it is ONLY on the lock screen and did not distract at all from the kIndle so save your $15 and leave it on!I've been using my Kindle since Dec 23rd and absolutely ADORE it.I highly recommend the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 version!

Reviews.Title: From A Senior
Reviews.Author: Judith E. Tarr
Reviews.Content: I have never used a I pad or tablet before and find it very easy to use and follow the instructions. My reason for purchasing it was to be able to take it with me when I visit my husband in hospital and eventurally a nursing home. It will definatelly meet my needs and then some.

Reviews.Title: Great early Christmas present
Reviews.Author: M. Murray "Msquared"
Reviews.Content: First off, I should explain that this is my first tablet.  I've been a PC guy since the mid 80's and between a desktop and my IPhone I really never saw a place for anything in between.  I certainly wasn't going to pay anymore to an ISP, so for me, wi fi was the way to go.  I may regret that later, but for now, I can load up anything I need at home if I'm going out.  So, I started out reading books and downloading a lot of free content, while buying a few top choices.  Then I discovered how well this thing streams netflix.  HD screen, and the sound, without headphones in a small room reaches around.  I'm amazed at the surround sound effect from such a small device.  I've been keeping an eye on the battery, and I doubt I could get ten hours of straight video from it, but it still holds a charge pretty well.  Better than my Iphone even with wi fi turned off.  Apple has some competition now.  BTW, I have not liked any Android products, so this was a hard sell for me.  Amazon has smoothed it out quite a bit though so its not as clunky an OS as on my previous Galaxy S.  Definitely purchase the wall plug that does not come with the unit.  The fact that they don't include this is literally my only reason for dropping a star.  You don't get GPS with this device, but otherwise it does everything an IPAD will do, without all the proprietary connections.  And there are benefits to having Amazon prime with this device, as you can borrow books for free.  This is my second Kindle and I'm hooked.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet !!
Reviews.Author: BLOSSUM62
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 4G LTE Wireless, I am very impressed and satisfied.  Excellent screen, Dolby stereo sound and perfect size for reading.  Does everything expected.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire 8.9!
Reviews.Author: Primitive Daisy
Reviews.Content: This is my first Kindle Fire and I love it! Of course I love it for reading, but playing games is fun, while listening to Pmusic from either my music downloads, or Tunein radio, or Pandora. The graphics and sound are phenomenal. I have had a few instances where it froze, but I am able to unfreeze it by either closing and opening the cover, or just restarting it. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Favorite Tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had the ipad and my husband has the nexus 7 but I really love this tablet it is so amazing. It does everything I want it too, movies are great on it and games are even better!

Reviews.Title: My first tablet and a very good one it is!
Reviews.Author: librarian in the wild
Reviews.Content: I held out for a long time to buy a tablet and I am glad I did!  I wanted full color so the early kindles never interested me even though reading books is something that I plan to do with my new tablet.  I also wanted something larger than 7 inches for watching video.  The web search capability seems totally adequate.  After all if I am power searching, I have several other computers already to do that with.  For $299, I feel that I got a very good value and I look forward to using this kindle for several years...

Reviews.Title: Netflix
Reviews.Author: Jason Birnbaum
Reviews.Content: Streaming netflix on this is absolutely wonderful. I use this for everything, but the streaming is fabulous. I especially enjoy it at night. I can watch something with earphones in and not wake up my wife.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 32 G
Reviews.Author: Micheal Preston
Reviews.Content: Just got this last week and It's was worth the wait.Haven't found anything to dislike about it.plays music, through the car radio which was one thing i was hoping forI one tried one movie from prime so far which was fantastic. hat go off to Kindle for thisGetting use to the Carousal but i'm getting to like it.One reason i got the 8.9" screen was i was hoping to replace my paper subscription with electronic one to reduce the paper mess i have. I was very very happy when i tried shutter bug on the Kindle Color in the pictures are fantastic I don't have to re-size the screen to read the print. looks like this is going to work out great.One of the reasons I bought this is my laptop gave of the ghost last February and had been looking at the 7" kindle fire to replace it but then i hear about the new kindle coming out and decided to wait.'  Loved the fact that their wasn't a lot of set up with it just had to find the password to the wifi and i was up and going.From my experiences so far i'd say Amazon knocked it out of the park with this one.

Reviews.Title: Love My new Kindle HD!
Reviews.Author: Dianne Peterson
Reviews.Content: This Kindle is very nice! I haven't had it very long but so far i love it. It works so much better then my first Kindle Fire. Especially the web! I can click on links and it actually works! It's like having a mini computer. I love the Swype Keyboard. The only problem I had was when I ordered it, I didn't realize that it didn't come with a wall charger. You will need a wall charger. The USB it comes with will charge it at a snails pace.

Reviews.Title: Updating myself. Review for 4G version.
Reviews.Author: Brian Nallick "METALMANMN"
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you a little about myself.I'm 38 and from MN.Back in the late 90's when the internet really took off (56K modem lol) I ran out and bought my one and only computer.A HP that was/is running Windows ME.Yes, it's that old.I used to pride myself that people would come to me for computer knowledge but after a few years I lost all interest and now I'm the blundering novice all over again.I was still using that computer and a dial up connection.My computer was so old that most pages wouldn't even load.But really, what did I use a home pc for?Email, Amazon and Facebook.And that was about it really.So when I finally started reading about this Kindle Fire thing I really had to take a hard look at myself and my needs.I was looking at a Mac desktop....roughly $1,500.00 or a new Dell all in one...roughly $1,300.00.And while both are marvelous machines I had to ask myself...Do I really need them?The answer was a simple no.I understand that for most people a tablet cannot replace a desktop or a laptop.But for me the tablet seemed like the best choice possible.I've been an Amazon fan boy since the late 90's so being married to Amazon's ecosystem really doesn't bother me all that much.But really?This thing scared the heck out of me.I don't have cable TV.I don't even have a cell phone.Yes, I'm that far in the dark ages but I keep asking myself, do I really need these things?Sorry, no.I have a home and work phone and the only TV I watch is the news so why bother with cable?But as soon as I started reading about Wi-Fi, Blue Tooth, 4G......uugh!!!It's so overwhelming!I really had to start doing my homework again.Thankfully Google is right at my fingertips and still loads on my HP.Learning the ins and outs of Wi-Fi is not easy.Routers.Cables.Broadband.OH MY!!!I had NONE of these things.Just my trusty, buggy old HP with Windows ME that crashed every time I had to log off.So I started researching and...Minneapolis has a whole Wi-Fi network that I can access for free.And my hometown has quite a few hotspots so I figured no big deal.But my home obviously has no Wi-Fi.Why bother getting cable when I don't want it?Why bother getting internet without a new desktop/laptop?This is why I bought the 4G version. 4G is great for the little bit I use it at home and I don't have to worry about Wi-Fi.The price is more but really but for me it was worth it.Anyway....I get the box and open it...and...first impressions...The Kindle comes in a nice black box.I opened it and...wow...I was shocked at just how big this thing is.Wonderful....but it is a tad heavy. If I'm going to read anything on it I'll definitely have to rest it on my sizeable tummy while sitting down.I took it out of the box and turned on the power and got it registered.It took some time to find a darn Wi-Fi spot....an area near a window seemed to work best lol.Anyway it got registered just fine but when I tried to set up the AT & T it disconnected....grrrr......I'll try that one again later.All in all...I took to this the same way I took to Window's ME over a decade ago.I'm completely self-taught and this was/is no different.The pull down screens I had mastered in a snap.The little sub menus are easily navigated.I guess some people don't really like the volume or power buttons but for me it's really a non-issue.I've also heard people complain about the lack of a charger.Thanks to all the other reviewers for pointing out that it doesn't come with the Kindle.It should, but I'm not going to freak out about a twenty dollar charger.Coming from Windows ME to this is a revelation no matter the small annoyances.My biggest annoyance seems to be the open Wi-Fi spots.Wireless is nice but still not quite the same as wired.As for the volume and sound...I haven't had time to download any music yet. This is only day one with the Kindle.But I'll update later.I do like all the fun little notification noises you can pick from.I also wish you could choose different wallpapers.And the lock screens are beautiful but I also wish I had some control over those also.I also got mine without the ads so I can't complain about that either but thanks fellow reviewers for pointing out the ads before I bought it.The touchscreen is nice and very responsive.I haven't had time for the apps either but I'll definitely get Skype, the camera and some others.I'm not too big on games or any of that.Facebook looks to be a breeze also.I'll update frequently as I've had more time to explore my new baby.Oh and when the Kindle is turned off the screen is so shiny it makes a nice little mirror.All in all, five stars so far.The technology wasn't nearly as overwhelming as I anticipated and I picked everything up within a matter of minutes for the easy set up and an hour or so later for the menu's and other things.I plan on getting the Logitech keyboard and a headset and some other wireless goodies to go with it.I also got the HDMI cable for my big screen plasma so watching movies should be very nice.Bye bye Window's ME...your glitchy, buggy, constantly crashing self has served me well for twelve years but all good things must come to an end.Daddy will miss you...well..not really...see ya.I like my Kindle....happy, happy...joy, joy.Minor update...I did manage to sign up for AT&T; without a hitch.I, for the life of me couldn't figure out how to connect via the 4g connection. Once again, thank you fellow Amazon users...you have to turn the Wi-Fi off before you can use the 4g. I managed to download a few apps and I think I might need more than the 250mb per month as I'm already halfway though my monthly allowance. I also went into facebook and it loaded very slowly but that may just be the area I'm living in. I'll try Facebook again tomorrow over Wi-Fi. I did download the cameral app and my face, in all of its "almost, but not quite, middle aged glory" appeared very grainy but it might just be the app I was using. You know when you look at your reflection in the side of a toaster oven? Uh huh, that's kind of what I looked liked...well...maybe not that bad. :)I also listened to some music samples to try out the speakers and their nice and clear. Nothing phenomenal and it won't replace my IPod or surround sound for music but for what it is, it's very nice.

Reviews.Title: ScreenDim saved the kindle fire HD
Reviews.Author: Manoranjan
Reviews.Content: I have owned the second generation kindle and this is my first kindle fire. I have been using this for close to 3 months now and my review is below:Size (4 stars):* The size is good for me to read books and watch videos.* Since I read more books than watch videos I might have preferred the apples iPad dimensions probably better (little more wider). However it is also much costlier than the fire.Screen (3 stars):* Screen is very good and crisp.* Sometimes I feel I pressed a link but it will actually press the one below - so not very accurate to touch. This is sometimes annoying.* It is really bright to read at night when the lights are turned off - even when the brightness settings is set to the lowest. This was the biggest deal breaker for me. However the screen dim app saved the kindle and I did not send it back. That is the best app for the kindle for my usage.Power button (3 stars):* The power button is placed in the top of the kindle almost very hard to find without looking at it.Software (1 star):* The software is just horrible. They have heavily customized android as many know. It has crashed on me close to 10 times in the last 3 months. The whole device will suddenly become unresponsive and it will automatically restart after 2 to 3 minutes.* I was looking forward to use the silk browser after I saw the amazon demo. It was easily the worst browser so far. It crashes almost all the time. I am now using the dolphin browser which is decent.* Many people complain about the carousel (homepage) but I think I got used to it now.* Accessing amazon's content is awesome - they have done that very well. It is easy to access videos, books, etc. I believe this was the primary purpose for the kindle when amazon built it probably. This is excellent.* Email app - It is not good and I dont use it. The push notifications of gmail did not work for me but I did not care to check it since my phone has a much better app than fighting with this.Apps (3 stars):* Apps are very limited to the kindle as many know. I knew this before I bought it so this is ok.* I installed the 1mobile app and that gave me access to almost all the android apps. Many dont work as expected like chrome browser, firefox, etc. However dolphin browser, dropbox and some other apps works. I had to get the apk file of 1mobile and install it - I think they call this process sideloading.Will I recommend it or buy it again:It will be a NO. The software provided is so limited to use for anything else apart from browsing amazon content that paying $249 (I got this in a deal) seems high. If I had known these issues before I would have probably went for the iPad mini or a prev generation iPad by paying a little extra. If the only reason you buy is to access amazon content (which I think many wont) this will be an excellent choice. If not, it is better to shell out the little extra to get the iOS tables or android tablets.

Reviews.Title: Overcontrolled
Reviews.Author: S. McNulty
Reviews.Content: I've owned a 32 GB 8.9 inch kindle for the last 2 months, and I've explored usage heavily, having used just about anything in my power to expand on the device. It works fairly well, and I've never really had any issues with the quality of the picture and sound. The primary weakness of the kindle is it's horrible creator's app store. In their attempt to force you to use their various cloud services, they heavily limit what you can do on the device.To get around that, I rooted the thing in the first week I had it, allowing me to finally use the play store, which voids the warranty, which I could live with. I uninstalled a few system apps, installed at least 30 apps from the play store, and then a few dozen from the internet itself. After that, I loved this thing, it ran perfectly, I had a really nice collection of apps and I could watch videos and TV and read ebooks from anywhere, not just amazon.About 2 or 3 days ago, Amazon SCREWED everyone who had their device rooted and installed an OTA update (Which I thought I had disabled with a play store app, kindlefree). They completely upgraded OS, deleted my root backups, re-installed every system app and un-installed all my system apps like play store and supersu. Now around ~20% of my apps don't work, soon to be more most likely if I don't fix it. Needless to say I was angry and called Amazon, they basically told me it sucks but there's nothing they can do.They pretty much ruined the $300 device for me, and apparently this update patched the method of rooting I had used.So let me summarize-Picture is great-Audio is great-Interface is okay-App selection is awful-Customer support is fairly useless regarding kindles

Reviews.Title: Not as Good as the Fire
Reviews.Author: Disgruntled
Reviews.Content: I owned a Kindle Fire for over a year, and I found that one to be great with just a few expected limitations.I just bought the Fire HD 8.9 inch one month ago.  Today it stopped working (will not power on).Even before today, I found the WiFi downloads to be slow (about half as fast as the predecessor Kindle Fire), the power connection is placed on the wrong side for the accessory covers, and the power on screen is an ad machine.  The on-screen keyboard doesn't work properly with most web pages, and the keyboard's special character layout requires going to the additional alt character screen to find commonly used characters.  The touch screen is also inaccurate and often took multiple attempts.I should have kept my original Kindle Fire and saved this money toward an iPad.

Reviews.Title: Initial Review
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've had my new 8.9" Kindle Fire HD for a couple weeks now and I feel I can make at least some intial comments on the new device. The new, larger version of the device is I think better for watching videos or surfing the net, although people who mainly use it as a book reader may prefer the smaller, lighter 7" version. The new display is very bright and clear and the new speakers sound great when watching a video.Overall, this second generation device seems to address all the critisisms I had of my Kindle Fire 7", LCD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB - Includes Special Offers.  The touch screen is much more accurate and responsive than the original one, the updated Silk web browser is faster and displays non-mobile formated pages much better, and the autocorrection when typing works much better than before.  Even the minor problem of the original, bottom mounted power button has been resolved and it was moved to the top, along with a "hard" volume control that maks listening to music or videos much easier.Honestly, at this point I have no real complaints about the device.  The device integrates smoothly and seamlessly with Amazon content (books, movies and music) which is my main use.  Even the much maligned "ads" are not at all intrusive and I decided they are not even worth the $15 charge to opt out.  I suppose if I had to point out something, its that the micro-USB port is very easy to confuse with the micro-HMDI port right next to it as there are no markings on the case to identify them.

Reviews.Title: What they DIDN'T TELL YOU
Reviews.Author: Jamie G. Ashley
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Kindle Fire HD 4G LTE Wireless and was looking forward to using it!  I received it and was having GREAT FUN. I soon discovered a really BIG PROBLEM-when I attempted to set up the 4G provided in the special deal by Amazon through ATT I kept receiving an error message saying the account couldn't be set up. After spending time with Amazon Tech support and ATT I discovered that if your credit card address is a PO Box ATT WILL NOT allow you to have an account. I have been an ATT landline customer for over 20 years and they send my bill to a PO Box, but they will not for this. I am walking out the door to return the KINDLE now and heading to get an I PAD. Amazon and ATT failed to disclose this detail. Rotten trick.

Reviews.Title: Old Age - Review with Old Eyes
Reviews.Author: The Old One
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle...........love them!  Seems each successive model has a few things I don't like along with stuff I do like.  Wish this model had an easier on/off switch.  On my Kindle Fire I can just feel and slide it on/off.  This one I have trouble trying to locate it.  Would be nice if somehow it could becolored to help locate it.  I also think the 'super charger' should be shipped with the unit and not sold as an 'add on'.  The graphics are displayed beautifully!  Love reading after I go to bed, so convenient.....no light to turn on or off, just fire up the Kindle.  I would be lost without my Kindles now.  They caught my eye when the first one hit the market, thought it would be so wonderful for anyone traveling to be able to carry books so conveniently.  Never thought as an old retired lady I would want one.......BOY, WAS I WRONG!!  I would also like to add that I have found Amazon's Customer Service to be such a pleasure in today's world.  They listened, acted promptly without customer hassle got the job done.That's another star.........guess I should have made it 5!

Reviews.Title: Good Fun. Nice Device. Just don't expect an iPad for this little money
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I've had this device for a little over a month now so I think I can be pretty fair/objective about it. I was toying with the idea of a tablet for awhile and did a lot of side-by-side comparisons by playing with them in stores. I liked the idea of a tablet mainly for media consumption reasons. I like ebooks (I also have an older eReader), I stream lots of movies and content from Netflix/Hulu+ and have an audible membership. Games are funner to play on bigger screens too. For these needs, the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is perfect. It has a nice screen resolution, the sound quality is excellent and gets really loud when you need it to. The dual band means that it is kicking my laptop's butt in streaming quality, especially in my bedroom where the wifi in our house drops out a bit. My laptop is usually hiccuping in there, while my kindle runs smoothly. And you know what, the price is right too! I am also an amazon prime member so being able to check out kindle books and have access to other free content is nice. The Prime Video content isn't that different from what Netflix has but it's still a nice bonus. Screen is a perfect size too. It's big enough so that it doesn't have that "I'm reading on a giant cell phone" feeling that you get from 7" tablets. And pretty much the perfect device to sync all of my other amazon content to- for instance, I already used my cloud drive extensively for documents, buy mainly amazon music, and am an audible member. On my iPhone, I can stream my amazon content, but not purchase any additional content, and even if you download it from your cloud drive, on an apple device, you can't access it through anything but the app that downloaded it. I always thought that was lame and was one of the reason I didn't want an iPad.Cons to the device: The camera is a bit lacking (reminds me of the camera on my first cameraphone) but still functional. App library is not nearly as extensive as the android or apple app store. (some work arounds available for android apps though0- think getjar). Lack of expandable media really bugs me. I mean, even apple, who is notorious about locking people out of their devices, offers a camera (SD) card reader as an accessory. I have yet to see that for kindle, which is disappointing because otherwise this would be in my camera bag all the time. I will just have to try to find a solution that works with the micro usb port. So no, this is not an iPad 4, but then again, it costs about $200 less so I think these are fair trades. Most of us use tablets as streaming media devices and in that function, the Kindle Fire HD excels.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Brian Futrelle
Reviews.Content: I was a current owner of an IPAD 2 that I spent 700 dollars on when it first came out.  I really wasn't looking into getting a new tablet, but I dropped my IPAD and the corner class was cracked.  It did not interfer with the screen at all, and it still worked just fine, but it did bug me a bit.  When my co-worker purchased his Kindle Fire HD 8.9, we did a basic side by side compare, and the Kindle just blew the IPAD 2 out of the water in picture quality.  We played the same movie side by side, and it was a pronounced difference.The biggest difference to me is the download speed, which a lot of people might dismiss.  I did a unscientific test and downloaded the same episode of big bang theroy on my ipad and then seperatly on my kindle.  Standing in the same spot right beside my router.  The kindle downloaded the episode in just over 5 minutes, then IPAD 2 took 21 minutes.  I was blown away.  While I don't expect these types of results typically, the kindle HD is consistently faster no matter what network I am on.  To me that made the kindle worth the upgrade right there.  Throw in Amazon prime and getting a free book every month, full color magazines, and having all my content stored on amazon.  The kindle fire is one of the best purchases i've made in a long time.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love my new Kindle HD!
Reviews.Author: M. Kelly "Life is a Cabernet"
Reviews.Content: I was currently an Ipad 4 user, having owned an Ipad 3 previously as well. I thought I was sold on Apple until till I purchased my nephew a 7" Kindle Fire HD for Christmas. When he opened the box and began to use it, I was mesmorized with the quality of the picture and the amazing sound. Being that I have been a Prime member for years, I began to consider purchasing one for myself so I could benefit from the free Kindle book loans and streaming videos. I purchased this 4G LTE 8.9" version on the Kindle Fire HD and after having used it for several days now non-stop, I assure you that the Ipad is going into the closet (or will be made a gift to one of my neices shortly). I could not resist the $49.99 package for 250 mb a month for 12 months along with the $50 credit Amazon was doing as a promotion. Surfing the web is easy, speed is amazing, I am just so happy with my purchase. You honestly can't get a better deal out there. I love the Fire HD!

Reviews.Title: What they don't tell you...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Rather then restate all the positive comments that everyone else has mentioned about the Fire HD, I'd like to make potential buyers aware of a couple things that aren't obvious.Android devices (the Fire is one) do not support Adobe flash. This is annoying to say the least. I never realized how much stuff uses flash until I didn't have it. This often results in YouTube videos not functioning. There is allegedly a work-around involving using the Dolphin browser instead of Silk, but I'm not savvy enough to get it to function. If you're a techno-peasant like me, you'll have to learn to live with spotty YouTube application or get someone to configure it for you.Reading books on the Fire is far better than I expected it to be. Which leads me to a related issue. The Amazon prime membership has many great perks, but the "kindle owners lending library" is not one of them. Meaning, the selection of free monthly books is horrible. With the exception of the three Hunger Games series books and some classics, it's a bunch of trash no one has ever heard of, much of it bordering on porn. Forget "borrowing" a free book that's a best seller, not going to happen. Expect to pay $10-$13 for most anything you'd find at a bookstore.On a brighter note, the Prime live movie streaming is flawless! With the purchase of a $6 micro-usb cable you can connect your Fire HD to your HDTV and watch crystal clear, no stuttering, HD movies. The selection of free stuff is not super current/just released, but still very good.My point is, don't get lost in the advertising hype. No tablet does everything. Read between the lines and do your homework and you won't be surprised or disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Inferior--Not good for books if that is why you use this Kindle
Reviews.Author: Baty Reasoner
Reviews.Content: In the beginning I was extremely disappointed with the lack of book organization, but I could read a book. Presumably now I may have too many books on the device, but it does not let me remove books like it did when I first got the Kindle.  When the books happen to apppear ( which the books often don't show), they will do nothing.  You can't read a book or remove it.  This purchase was such a waste of money.  I would like an organized, electronic library device that works on demand, without major troubleshooting.  This Kindle certainly is not useful to me for an electronic library.Very, very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: The best yet!
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Ivie R. Bellone
Reviews.Content: T best yet!  I have used it a lot since I got it.  It was so easy to set up.  I love having the two pages show on one screen - makes it easier for me to read.  I love the pictures that are so clear.  Reading is a breeze with this and listening to the radio is great.  I also set it up to work with my blue toothe hearing aid.  It's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: Non-tech (sorta) totally honest review
Reviews.Author: Living in the Amazon
Reviews.Content: I own several devices and am well over the age of innocence. This is a remarkable  device and I am a very happy owner of several Kindles.The sound is extraordinary and completely immersing I thought my tv was playing in the background...nope...the Dolby.If you feel risque, allow third party apps to install  and you will be amazed with what this true tablet can do. Amazon should consider being a bit less stingy and more forthcoming with info as to how you can make this your go to device. Not kidding. The offers are such a non-issue for me its the only mention I will make.Resolution is awesome (however a speck less than B&N; Nook HD which I bought and returned) so...I just loaded B&N; on the HD, yes you can, and Flash.I use my mobile WiFi hotspot to connect and its respectfully fast. I am honestly not understanding the negative reviews. IPad it is not and that precisely the point but if you take a short time to make it "yours" I truly believe you will love it.Truly. And I love my paperwhite! I hope this encourages some of the naysayers.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Tablet No Issues so Far
Reviews.Author: B. Peroceschi
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure - I'm fairly new to tablets.What I own:  Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 4G LTE 32GB - purchased the no advertising option.  I have the quick charger, case, and screen protectors.I use the Amazon Ecosystem quite a bit so having the device more limited to Amazon does not bother me.I also had a Kindle Fire 7" before this but I just did not use it very much.  Mostly for playing Asphalt 7.Pros for the 8.9"-Excellent Screen-Excellent Sound condsidering what it is.  Don't expect the same sound as your home surround sound system, but this is obvious.-Great for viewing magazines, I appreciate the larger screen compared to the 7" kindle fire.  I have a subscription to ATV Rider.-Skype has worked well for me so far, I use skype as my primary phone from either my home PC or from my Kindle Fire 8.9.  I broke my PC headset a couple of days ago and Skype on the kinle fire worked just fine.  I do need to get a bluetooth headset for it though to make it more like my pc experience.  Full disclosure - most of my skype calls are to landlines, and not other skype calls so I have not tried skype video yet.-WiFi was very easy to setup.Cons:-The only Con I have seen so far is that the battery life did not seem that long.  I decided to completely discharge the device and then charge it again slowly with the USB cable so it had a nice, long, slow charge.  That seems to have worked and the battery life now seems good.What I don't know so far:I have not explored too many apps yet.  People always talk about ipad vs android app availability.  I have not explored this enough yet to comment on it much.Have not tried the 4G connectivity yet, but will update the review when I do.

Reviews.Title: Great for my Purposes
Reviews.Author: Paul Coverstone
Reviews.Content: I must say this is my fourth Kindle and it does what I need it to do.  My wife has a Ipad and a Kindle Fire and we both end up using the Fire more.  Not that there anything really wrong with the IPad, it's just that we seem more comfortable with the android operating system since that is what our phones use too.

Reviews.Title: Claim about reduced glare isn't true, but otherwise excellent.
Reviews.Author: J. Metzner
Reviews.Content: I can't tell any difference between the screen glare on my original Kindle Fire vs. this model, but otherwise this is an excellent product.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE Amazon, but sadly, NOT my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Kathryn
Reviews.Content: I love Amazon; I'm a loyal customer, stockholder. I love my Kindle e-reader. I REALLY wanted to LOVE my Kindle Fire 8.9" (not 4G).Since you should always start with the positives:I'm incredibly impressed with the video and sound on the Kindle Fire!Amazon customer service is very nice!Ok. Now the negatives:The Internet browser is worthless. "Silk not responding." SO excrutiatingly slow! No Flash player. The web pages don't look normal. Half of the options for Yahoo, MSN are cut off. I can't find anything. This is a pretty big deal, since the main purpose of a tablet is its portability for internet browsing. One should be able to pick it up, browse, shop.My first app download wasn't compatible. Another app slowed the whole system to a crawl. Had to delete it everywhere, reset Kindle.Takes forever to charge. Leaving it plugged in all night should be sufficient, wouldn't you think? Nope, that gets you about 35% battery. It also will not charge while it's being used. If it's out of battery (which happens quickly), you can't use it.Typing is INSANE. You would think that a keyboard would type exactly what you type. No. It guesses the word you want and imports it, sometimes twice right in a row! So, you have to back space. (There's no delete key). When you turn OFF all of the keyboard options, you still get two spaces after an apostrophe, random capitalization, and double words. Also, it's so slow you often have to type three letters, wait until they appear, then type three more.The touch screen is off, sometimes I have to press too hard, other times so soft. My son saw my trying to unlock the Kindle (slide to unlock), I was flicking my finger over and over, harder, softer, slightly above, below, longer, shorter. He said, "Why does it do that? That happened to me too." One time I tried over 100 flicks and could not unlock it. Had to put it down and come back later. UGHGHGHGH!!!The screen locks up! I wait. I tap all over, try the home button, it's completely locked. I close the cover and the Kindle Fire is still on with the cover closed. It's completely locked. The only option is to hold the off button for 30 seconds.And the final straw. It now turns off randomly ALL the time. Right in the middle of a game or TV show, or a magazine article. Whether the Kindle is moved or stationary, doesn't matter. The screen just disappears. Even with full battery. Sometimes I can still hear the sound but the screen is gone. Sometimes it completely turns off, no sound no picture. I just sit there starring at a blank screen like, "Are you kidding me?!"  I've almost thrown it against the wall several times.I find myself using my laptop more and more and the Kindle Fire less and less and the Fire is only 3 months old. Very sad.Amazon will not lose me as a customer. They have earned my loyalty. I wanted to be able to spend my Tablet dollars with them. But sadly, I will have to go to the competitor to fulfill Tablet "needs." Luckily the competitor does not also sell Organic/Gluten-Free foods, craft and pet supplies, nutritional supplements, and everything else I could possibly need at awesome prices, fast shipping with satisfaction guaranteed.Update: I now have the competitor's newest product and it has none of the problems that the Fire has. However, the Fire has better looking video and better sound. But now I can't get the Fire's battery to charge. I leave it plugged in all night  and all the following day, come home from work - 40 % charged. I watch 15 minutes of Netflix and I get the "only 15% battery remaining" warning. Arghghgh!!! Seriously, 4 months, that's how old it is. Very, very bad.

Reviews.Title: What, no wall charger???
Reviews.Author: GBS
Reviews.Content: Just kidding!  I bought two of these WITH wall chargers through the Amazon "Deal of the Day" discount a few days ago.  My wife and I bought the original Kindle Fire last year, decided to upgrade, and give the hand-me-downs to the kids.  For $258 each, INCLUDING CHARGER, it was an easy decision.Maybe it's just me, but it's rare when I can't get something to work correctly.  Right out of the box, both Kindle HDs "fired" up, and the set-up was so simple that I think most elementary-age kids could manage it.  All the more widely used apps were downloaded and Amazon purchases sync'd in just a few minutes.  The size is right, the video excellent, and the sound improved.  Although the web browser was working well, on the advice of some experienced users, I turned off the "Accelerate Page Loading" in Applications / Silk.I'm a regular Amazon customer, so the "Special Offer" advertising on the lock screen falls squarely into the "no big deal" category.  Ignore it, or pay $15 more to make it go away.  Just don't complain because you didn't read the product description!A few observations:- Because the screen is bigger than its 7-inch brother, the keyboard is also bigger; this is a really good thing if you have fingers wider than a pencil.- Web browsing and video downloads are fast and crystal clear, but I also have a solid cable internet connection and a good wireless router (plus a downstairs amplifier).  Perhaps the problems that some have with web connections are more their wireless setup than their Kindle device.- Although it charges properly with the Kindle wall charger, it wouldn't with my Samsung Galaxy USB charger.  I'll need to experiment with a few others to see if this problem extends further.- On the original Kindle Fire, the power button had an LED light that indicated a charging / fully charged condition.  The power button on the "HD" model is just an on/off type with no LED.I use tablets for reading books, web-browsing on the couch or while away from home, or to watch the occasional video.  Whenever I want to do something substantial with a computer, I sit down at my desk and work with a keyboard and a full-size monitor.  That's why some of the more capable (but also more expensive) tablets were more than what I needed or wanted.  I was leaning towards purchasing the 8.9 inch HD before the discount.  It lines up very well with tablets in the $300-400 dollar range.  At $258 (INCLUDING the wall charger), it appears a slam-dunk value winner.

Reviews.Title: I don't just like it, I LOVE it!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Lyons "Liz Lyons"
Reviews.Content: I write long and short reviews.  This one will be short to start with and I imagine I will add to it later as I tend to analyze things in detail.But, I wanted to cut to the chase - I had no idea what I would think of this device, but it was love at first click.Now, I buy a new computer-type device every two years.  I just got a new ultrabook for work/travel purposes in the summer.I spent six months studying every pad in great detail, talked to friends and family, and finally decided on the Kindle Fire HD 8.9".First off, it came sooner than expected.  Yay.  Wanted it the minute I ordered it so the wait was tough, but coming early was a bonus.Secondly, the box, the device, every design and display aspect of the Fire HD is gorgeous: sleek, elegant, sophisticated, vivid.  Love that.There were far more apps and features available than I imagined.  It is like being a kid in a candy store.  And the quality is high.  Could it be higher? Maybe, but I don't drive a Jaguar, I am happy with high, not ultimate quality.Like so many things, if someone knows the difference between one HD TV and another, that is their talent.  Mine is getting a great item for a great price and that is what the Fire HD is on both counts.I ordered the sleek little power charger and it arrived instantly - its just as beautiful as the Fire.  So, good on that.  I am awaiting my 'skin' with excitement, due tomorrow (but who knows, maybe today?). Fun.  I topped it off with clear screen protectors.  I am all set now.The Fire took 10 hours to charge through the computer - expected that.  The power charger should cut that in half.  So, charge at night, right?Lastly, let me fully disclose I am an Amazon fanatic.  The company never fails - customer service is a mouse click or phone call away and they are so competent and attentive, they restore my faith in large companies.  So, it didn't take much to convince me I would be right at home in an Amazon environment.That said, let me also say I have Acers, HPs, a Vaio, Mac's, an iPod - I love those brands too - none of them have ever let me down.And finally, I am pretty picky - with Virgo-like insistence on detail and perfection, so if this Fire continues to please me, believe me, you would have to be overly ocd not to like it too.I will keep this updated - gotta go play with my Kindle.Okay, one week or so later and after reading all the cranky reviews as well as the laudatory ones like mine:Here is the way I see it. The Kindle Fire should have every accessory, come in a sleek box but be perfectly and flawlessly protected, should offer every single luxury that anyone anywhere on the planet could imagine. And should cost almost nothing.When I read posts complaining about delivery issues, packaging, and all the things that the uninformed buyers were unaware of because they failed to do their homework, in short those of all the demanding complainers, I wonder what they can be thinking. This device is so cheap and so elegant and so robust. Be grateful. If you lived twenty years ago, you wouldn't even dream this was possible.I liked the box mine came in. It protected it perfectly. For ten dollars I bought the super charger that charges my Kindle Fire in three hours, well worth it. The device itself is beautiful, works flawlessly and has everything I can imagine wanting, and I am pretty demanding.If it makes me happy, then I know the complainers are asking for the moon.Period.

Reviews.Title: Not Even Close to an iPad
Reviews.Author: Shannon Heskett
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle Fire HD for my 12 year old son as a less expensive alternative to the 2 iPads that we already owned.  After six months of hearing him complain and then refuse to use it, I switched him his Kindle tablet for my iPad.  BIG mistake!  The Kindle locked up constantly and I had to do a hard reboot multiple times a day.  I contacted Kindle support and because it was still under warranty, they shipped me out a new replacement.  I used the new tablet for about 2 weeks and started encountering the same issues with freezing.  Once again, I contacted Kindle support and they shipped me another tablet.  Same issue yet again.  This is the 3rd replacement now and I have given up.  I asked for a refund, but was told that was impossible.  They will only keep replacing a defective tablet with the same defective tablet.FYI ... I have purchased 9 (yes, 9!) Kindle e-readers over the years for myself and friends and family.  I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE the Kindle e-readers and have never had a problem with any of them.  My complaint is specifically about the Kindle Fire HD 8.9, so don't let this review scare you off about any of the other e-readers.  I am just disappointed that Amazon would not refund the money on an obviously defective tablet to such a loyal e-reader customer.  You don't have to take my word alone though.  Do a Google search on the Kindle Fire HD tablet, and you will see many, many complaints about the freezing issue.  Amazon needs to remove this tablet from their product line so other consumers are not stuck paying almost $200 for a tablet that won't work!

Reviews.Title: This Kindle not for me!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Georgina LaCour
Reviews.Content: I can not express how disappointed I am with this Kindle. It constantly freezes, kicks me off the page I'm on, takes me to web sites I have never been on, acts like it just has a mind of it's own. When it freezes I have to wait ten minutes or more before it recovers. It constantly says Silk is not responding like every ten minutes. I would not buy another or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Would not recommend...
Reviews.Author: Liam's Dad
Reviews.Content: I am now on my third Kindle HD as the previous two would constantly crash - specifically when web browsing. I wish I could say the third one is better, but it isn't. The support I received from Amazon was also lacking as it took them well over three weeks to for their tech support to troubleshoot. Not only was the advice they gave me late, but incorrect as they told me to uninstall a program that wasn't even installed.

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: JoeBrown "ToolGuy"
Reviews.Content: So this is the 3rd Kindle I have purchased. Amazon likes mixing all the reviews together so they can build the number of reviews making it difficult to find the "exact" review you are wanting to see. This review is for the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Dual-Band Wi-fi, 16 GB. I use this Kindle every day. Great for checking my many email accounts, reading books, playing apps (games), reading the news.The problem I have is the web browser "silk" is not good, poor really. I like to surf the web while watching TV. This thing locks up every time I use it. I contacted Amazon customer service and they told me to clear the history. Their instructions to do so were poor and I asking them if they had every used this version of the Kindle. Finally I figured it out myself. This clearing of the history helped a little but not much. Every time I use this thing to surf I get an error message telling me "Silk has error'd , do I want to close my session or wait". My wife tried to use it last week (which does not happen much) and she was ready to toss this thing in the garbage. It is very frustrating. For years I have resisted going to an IPad (not a Steve Jobs fan) but I may have to switch. Maybe I will go back to reading books on my black and white Kindle and surf on an IPad?I have owned this Kindle for over a year. Wouldn't you think Amazon would have me download a software upgraded to correct this issue?This may be the last Kindle I purchase.3/19/14 update: Used my kindle to order the new iPad Air thru Amazon 3rd party merchant. Wanted amazon to see the purchase so maybe they will fix the kindle operating system. It is terrible. Will post a comparison to iPad soon.

Reviews.Title: Very Disapointed
Reviews.Author: LK "LK"
Reviews.Content: Well, I just got back from the UPS store to return my "new" Kindle Fire HD 8.9".I just received it this morning and was ready to go. I powered it up and registered it. OK so far. Then I had problemswith the keyboard function. Talked to support and I had to reset it. Then I had problems with the date/time. Had to reset it.Then I had a problem with Silk working properly. Talked to support and they could not resolve the problem.From my experiences when you get something "new" and immediately have several problems with ityou're probably going to have other problems too. So I decided to return it. I don't know for sure if thiswas "new" or "refurbished". I bought it as new. I will give 5 stars to Amazon's return process. That seemedto work fine. Now I don't know what to do. The 8.9" at $189 is a really good deal. I don't want to go through thisagain though. I have had the Fire HD 7" for awhile and have never had a problem.While I was on the phone with support the Kindle reset and did an upgrade on it's own. That'swhy I don't think this was a new unit.

Reviews.Title: don't recommend to buy refurbished
Reviews.Author: Dicran Hanessian
Reviews.Content: don't buy refurbished. I bought this refurbished and was never able to connect to the wifi I tried on several ways and diferent places (wifi) .and for the price they charge is better spend $20.00 more and buy new.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" review after almost one year of ownership.
Reviews.Author: Vicki Cheney
Reviews.Content: I probably would have given it 5 stars a while ago.  Now that it is almost a year old I find it freezing, stopping, ignoring my touches on the screen and being slower than molasses.  I have a decent wireless network and other devices work just fine.  I have claered the browser cached and turned the device off completely to try to resolve the issues. I rate it 4 stars because I like the concept and the display is good.  The sound could be a bit louder for these old ears but I don't use it for video often or for music.  I find I have to put my head pretty close to the speakers when I do want to hear something.  And, of course, I like it because of the content available.I will be calling Amazon support today about the device because of the issues I am having with it, before the one year is up.I am still an Amazon device fan and spend a lot of time on my Kindle Keyboard. I don't want to switch to another device because, I hate to say it, short of the Apple devices, they all have problems, from what I hear.  But having one Kindle ereader give out in less than a year, Kindle Fire first generation devices having to be replaced because of charging dock issues, and the current problems with the Kindle Fire HD, I am not sure I want to spend nearly $400 on the new HDX version.  Longevity seems to be an issue with these devices.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic value, great tablet
Reviews.Author: Book Collector
Reviews.Content: I'd love this tablet/reader even if the price were the same as an iPad 2, but the fact that it now costs $170 less makes it a no-brainer for me.  The screen is gorgeous to look at and very responsive (I hate twitchy touchscreens).  I've had no problems with freezing or with charging, and the battery has been holding a charge very well.  If you are looking to save money while still getting the HD experience, in my opinion this bigger model is a better value than the "new" small Kindle Fire HD, which, while inexpensive, has had some features like the camera stripped out.  And while the new HDX looks great, I don't need to spend that much money to satisfy my reading/surfing/videos/email/social media habits.I don't find the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 heavy, but then I don't expect to be able to hold an 8.9 inch tablet in one hand and not propped up for a long period of time. (I still carry only my smaller Kindle in my handbag, though; the bigger model tends to stay at home, but that's because of size, not weight.)Amazon Prime makes this model perfect for my family, because streaming movies and TV episodes is so easy. I love being able to set up separate profiles for my teenagers, too.  When it comes to online content, books and movies, sometimes teens need even more supervision than younger kids. ;)

Reviews.Title: I feel guilty!!!!
Reviews.Author: Mike H.
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I was able to get tablet at such a great price. Amazon you amaze me. Though this is refurbished, it looks, feels and acts brand new. You would have no idea that it was refurbished!!!. Variety of apps are limited in the Amazon App store but I gave this 5 stars because you CAN NOT find anything out there that compares in terms of features, the quality video/audio speed of operations system AND price. Blew my mind!!

Reviews.Title: I would not buy the Kindle HD again.....
Reviews.Author: Adam Rembisz
Reviews.Content: The pros of the Kindle HD are simply video, such as Netflix you are guaranteed an awesome picture quality for movies.The reading is okay but strains your eyes after a while plus the unit is too heavy to use as an everyday reader.The sound quality is okay but only if you are in a quiet room, just doesn't put out the sound loud enough to use while cooking or if there is any background noise.The internet browser is terrible and very slow.  Definitely not good for internet use at all takes forever to switch pages or upload a new page.  Bottom line is that the unit comes at a good price but just doesn't deliver what Amazon brags about.

Reviews.Title: What's not to love?
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I just got my new Kindle HD 8.9.  I wanted the bigger display.  I already owned the Kindle HD 7", Paperwhite and Kindle Keyboard.  I love it!  The display is lovely and crisp!  I have been watching Shark week with Amazon Streaming and it is beautiful.  The only issue that I see different is that the battery does not stay charged nearly as long as the Kindle HD 7". I did what was expected when I first got it in, I charged for 24 hours. I did research on this and was told that this is the thing to do.  In any case, I love it, and I love the Kindle case that I bought also, the Persimmon Amazon version.  I would recommend this product 100%.  I should have just paid the extra money for the large display to begin with.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THE H/D 8.9
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift already had a kindle reader and the fire and was really wanting the H/D when they came out it has meet all my expectations and then some I love the amazing video quality when watching movies and the x-ray ability is really cool. I really like the Immersion reading I've been a member of audible for a long time and the pairing of the kindle books and audible professional readers is a prefect match. The kindle H/D is a great tablet

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: k davis
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle because it is light to handle. The screen is a nice size which makes it easy to read my books. There are so many features on the kindle and I am still learning how to do everything. The Kindle is easy to carry around. I Love it. I would recommend it to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Karen Erlanson
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire HD! I have an older read-only Kindle and I liked my husband's iPad, so I looked at upgrading to the Kindle Fire HD 8.9", and I'm so glad I did! I play the same games as I did on the iPad, and the picture quality is crystal clear. I love the different light settings to read my books, no need for a separate light anymore. And it is much easier to pick the book I want to read; also all my books on my older Kindle automatically transferred to the new one. I still do Facebook and browse the web, etc., just like on the iPad. And with the lower price of $269, I feel I got a bargain!

Reviews.Title: Happy but some problems
Reviews.Author: k brearley
Reviews.Content: I REALLY like Kindle Fire but I have had some problems with charging my table.I had a second generation Kindle for a long time and REALLY loved it.I never had a problem charging my first Kindle but the fire does not seem to connect unless I plug it in and then unplug and replying it.I contacted c Ted Kindle support I was not very happy with the support I was given.I was told a replacement would be sent to me but was told they could not guarantee it would be new. I had just bought my Kindle and that did nit sit well with me. I spoke with someone who said he would try to make sure I got a new one.He left me a message on my machine that was not clear and never heard back.I like my product but will not buy another amazon product because of the way I have been treated.

Reviews.Title: A Nice Gadget
Reviews.Author: RSMH
Reviews.Content: As an IT Professional I have not been one that has get too involved in having to have the latest and greatest in today's technology. It was seeking the next line of book(s) from one of my favorite authors that had me purchase a Kindle, because the likes of 'hardcover' was dwindling down faster than 'paperback'. In discussing the purchase with my wife she too had contemplated getting one so I purchased two at the same time. She has enjoying hers, using the wireless connection to review all that Amazon has to offer for the device. But unfortunately the other unit has had a problem in connecting to wireless networks since the very first day. Having tried every trick listed and those of my own as an IT Professional, there comes a time when you have to surrender and replace the unit. There is where things have become a little uncomfortable, as I have spent 'good money' on these devices but am not getting very much communication from Amazon in trying to rectify/replace my problemed Kindle. My last attempt was via email, where it said I would hear something in a timeframe that has been more than surpassed. It is as simple as me wanting to get this resolved inside of the 'one week' that I have had the unit.

Reviews.Title: Excellent multimedia product
Reviews.Author: mini_hakr "mini_hakr"
Reviews.Content: I was an early adopter of the original Fire - which I liked, but ... so so. It had some design problems IMO like the protruding power button which was easy to press while in use, etc. That being said - I ended up using it much more than my (original) 32GB WiFi/3G iPad. The iPad however was useful on-the-go (because of the 3G).I decided to wait on the Fire HD this time, and after the price drop, decided to pick up the 64GB/4G LTE version (without ads). I don't know why you would spend $500 to still get ads on your lockscreen ... but I digress ...The picture quality is awesome, as is the sound. The overall build quality and design is markedly better than the Fire - it 'feels' good in your hands, I like the location of the power and volume buttons. As I had the predecessor, the Fire HD UI is pretty seamless and straight forward. Overall, its a very good device - especially for video playback.The 4G LTE option with $50 250MB option was the feature which pushed me over. I only rarely need on-the-go web access, as free WiFi seems about everywhere now, but when I do need it, its good to have.I never had trouble with WiFi before on the Fire, so I can't say the Fire HD is faster or better (?). I guess I could run some internet benchmark tool like speednet ... but WiFi service in my neighborhood has as much to do with microwave oven and cordless phone use (as well as activity among the some 20 APs I can see in my house) than anything else.I was surprised about not having a charger in the box.The ATT service setup is not without some hitches ... if you are an existing ATT customer, you can't (apparently?) take advantage of the special $50/250MB mo promotional offer (its based on email address). After sign up and activation of the account, I had to power cycle the device to really activate the 4G service. 4G in Hillsboro, OR overall seems hit-or-miss coverage-wise, and the device doesn't seem to handle downgrading to a lower-speed option well/at all.I am somewhat surprised at the battery-life of the device. Connected standby/idle states seem 'good' - it holds a charge for days. However, with web-browsing use, the battery drops faster than expected (e.g. down to 80% from full-charge within ~1+ hour?) I'm still trying to find a 'battery use' panel similar to what I have on my Google Nexus ... to see if it is some background app to blame ...And lastly, the on-screen keyboard seems a bit more twitchy than the old Fire keyboard - for whatever reason, its harder to type on the Fire HD (?).8-April-13 UpdateUsing my Samsung/Google Nexus USB charger to charge up this device is glacial ... it doesn't charge to 100% overnight. You should seriously consider the Kindle HD charger for this device.I downloaded a few games to the device e.g. "Asphalt Heat 7", and "Modern Combat 4" - the gaming graphics performance is honestly awesome for a tablet and totally unexpected (game load times are slow though). That being said - goodbye to battery life.Overall, at a family get-together they were asking "Is that the latest iPad?". Amazon's latest kindle fire HD is really impressive.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Texas Rose "Roseanna"
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Kindle, and I love it. It is a little bigger, therefore heavier, than others, but for my purposes, it is great. The only thing that I have found that I don't like it that when I download videos or TV shows and save to this Kindle, then I cannot watch them offline like on the original Kindle Fire. On this Kindle HD, I have to ALWAYS be connected to wireless to watch movies, videos, or TV while on the original Kindle Fire, once something was downloaded, I could watch it offline. This is a slight bother when I am somewhere that has no wireless, but this is becoming less and less a problem since so many people and places have HUBs or free wireless spots.The sound quality and larger screen for visual quality is excellent. I love that it has a built in camera and I have used it for Skype, taking photos, and taking videos. Excellent! I can already tell that I'm going to have to get another one because my husband keeps borrowing mine.

Reviews.Title: Delighted with this new Kindle
Reviews.Author: PT Cruiser
Reviews.Content: I wondered how much better this new Kindle would be than the original Kindle Fire which we use everyday and love. (I purchased the one with 32 GB and no ads.)
