It is a good value compared to the apple thing.

Reviews.Title: Better than I Thought
Reviews.Author: Doug Moore
Reviews.Content: So, after looking for quite some time, reading the reviews, comparing tablet to tablet to e-reader, I decided this was more bang for my buck and I haven't been disappointed.  Actually, this was a birthday present after I pointed it out.  My first has a boot issue.  I called customer service and spoke with a rather kind gentleman in South Africa...just a day after Nelson Mandela passed.  He told me he was ordering me another and told me when it would be delivered-and bingo! It was delivered 2 days early. He even sent me via email the return postage.  The new one is great - no issues, no complaints and great customer service.  The screen is super clear, easy to read and enlarging the view is a breeze. The sound is perfect and wonderful with stereo buds or headphones.  I tried the protective sheet on the screen but it made for bubbles so I tossed it away.  The hard cover is wonderful and offers good protection. If you are looking for a portable - this is the all-in-one you need.

Reviews.Title: Not satisfied
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Iron
Reviews.Content: Didn't come with a charger and won't charge with the one I have from a previous kindle. Called to find out what the issue was and was offered a $30 voucher to put toward a PURCHASE of the required charger. Not happy with amazon or the product! My previous purchase also had charging issues.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Amy Lynn Stone
Reviews.Content: This is a great product for the price.  My 5 year old loves playing the apps and watching his favorite shows.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Screen and Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: RN
Reviews.Content: Great!  Better than I thought it would be.  Does just about everything--but not for school use.  Overall--very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Takes about 12 hours to fully charge
Reviews.Author: Brenna Peterson
Reviews.Content: Unless you buy a special charger (sold separately), it takes about 12 hours to charge your Kindle 8.9.  The battery life is about 3 to 4 hours, depending on brightness, etc... and then it is dead and waiting for it to slooowly charge is very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet Not Great!
Reviews.Author: W. Adams
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet for my wife at Christmas.  She had previous owned an ipad, but unfortunately, it was stolen in a home invasion and was never recovered.  Since that time, she has occasionally used my kindle fire hd 7" but longed for her own table.  So I decided to purchase this 8.9" kindle fire.  All the same great features with a bigger screen I thought.  How could I go wrong?Overall, I suppose this tablet is okay.  As a amazon prime member, my wife has easy access to all the videos, books, and kindle apps her heart desires.  She has started reading much more because of the convenience of searching for and obtaining books, and naturally the bigger screen just makes that a lot easier.  Unfortunately, however, her experience surfing the internet has not been as grand.Before I purchased the kindle fire 8.9", I had read reviews that warned that this tablet had issues with stuttering while loading pages and generally unexplained slowness.  Since I'd never experienced anything like this with my kindle fire 7" I sort of shrugged it off.  I might have disregarded those problems a little to quickly I've discovered, because my wife has had lots of issues with pages with rich image content not loading quickly, stuttering during loading or just freezing of  the whole tablet.As the tech guy at the house (and I'm using that moniker loosely because I am not that tech suave) I've had to try to find a solution to this problem.  I've read pages and pages of supposed fixes, and I've tried more than I can recall right now.  One thing that has really helped is by using apps for all my wife's favorite websites like facebook, twitter, pinterest, etc. instead of using the web browser to view them.  (I've never had to use an app for these sites on my fire 7".  The web pages work great in browser mode.)But even though we've cut down on the problems, the slowness issues still persistent, though thankfully we've eliminated the freezing.All in all, the kindle fire 8.9" is a great looking tablet at a really good price.  It does work - more or less, and it is really convenient for using amazon prime services.  However, if you are thinking of buying this one, you should take the warning about slowness, stuttering loading pages, and freezes very seriously.  Those things might be a problem with your particular kindle fire 8.9".

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 inch
Reviews.Author: Joey Purnell
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9 inch is a pretty good tablet. It's not great but it's still pretty good. It has a nice screen with awesome speakers and sound! But it is pretty heavy so it's not that comfortable to hold. It has a nice sleek looking design. But I think the ports would be better placed on the bottom. But probably the biggest negative is the app store. It is very small compared to Apple and Google's app stores. Their are a lot of good apps NOT available on it like Instagram,Google Chrome,Youtube, Google Maps, Google Plus, and the free version of Cut the Rope. Speaking of web browsers, Amazon's silk browser is ok, but the fact that they don't have chrome in the app store just makes you want it even more! The battery life also isn't that great. But some more positive things about the device are, that even though the app store is limited most of the apps on their are really good! The reading experience is better than any other tablet on the market right now. And if you have Amazon Prime you have a lot of great options available to you. X Ray is also a really cool feature especially when watching movies. The front facing camera is also pretty cool to have. But sadly it does not have a back facing camera. Overall this is a good tablet. I would reccomend the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 inch over this because it is simply better but this is still a great tablet especially for the money. Thanks for reading my review and I hope it helped.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: A. Drahos "addicted reader"
Reviews.Content: love the size it makes a big difference on games and movies! and love my book results as well, i upgraded from the 7 to 8.9 in. i wear glasses to read and had to adjust the font size on my 7 but with this one i didnt h ave to and it made it so nice...my only complaint is it takes longer to charge but i have no complaints other then that.

Reviews.Title: 8.9 Model replaced my original Fire gen 1
Reviews.Author: MJS
Reviews.Content: Way better than the first one, better wifi, faster speeds, much easier to manage. I bought this toward the end of 2013. I rarely give 5 stars on products. If you compare the price, features and benefits it was a great deal. Up and running out of the box with no hassle. Transferred my apps, books and other items quickly.Has good battery life much more so than the Gen 1, would recommend especially if you want to save some money. This is our 4th Kindle w have 2 Fires and 2 readers.Will wind up with another Fire I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: John P. Fahy
Reviews.Content: after having 3 i pads in the house, my wife decided she waned a tablet to keep up with Dad and the kids. we decided to get her a Kindle HD for Christmas. She cant put it down and when she does the kids want to use it. Perfect for shopping, internet browsing, paying bills but better than our i pads we can watch movies and read books through our Prime account. I see more Kindles in our future!

Reviews.Title: Took a little time to get used to it.
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Del Checcolo "mamadel"
Reviews.Content: I was hooked on my smaller 7 in. kindle. But after much use and abuse it developed and issue and I was offered this upgrade for a low price so I jumped on it. After I realized that I needed to download the face book app, I was able to unlock the browser and it worked perfectly. Now I use it all the time. I love it, and I am still learning about it. One of the best things about a kindle is the tech support from Amazon. I have purchased 4 now and I will continue to get them. As good as an ipad for me.

Reviews.Title: Non-techy loves Kindle
Reviews.Author: Tea Lassie
Reviews.Content: I am a grandmother and not at all savvy when it comes to computers, but I love my new Kindle Fire that I received for Christmas.  It was easy to use and set up right out of the box.  I didn't even have to ask my husband for help and that is pretty amazing.  I love how easy it is to navigate, and the very bright colorful screens.  I also love how it responds to the slightest touch or swipe.  I use it mostly for reading books, but my grandchildren played some of the games on it and the graphics were so good.  I think it is well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: JayBee
Reviews.Content: Entertainment on the Go. Awesome size screen with HD videos. Ample storage for games and apps. Overall a good product and now a fan of kindle.

Reviews.Title: LOVELY
Reviews.Author: fernon wilson
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire HD has a BEAUTIFUL PICTURE, it's runs pretty fast and it has cloud connected. Would recommend it for anyone, but especially for gamers.

Reviews.Title: Okay
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: Not as impressive as I thought it would be. The battery life is not good. I hardly find the apps I'm interested in. disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Bonnie S. Kenk "parroted"
Reviews.Content: This is my second tablet.  My first tablet was a Google.  The battery needed charging at least twice a day (and I didn't even use it much) and the browser took forever.  The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is the opposite of this.  I've had it for about a month now, and have only had to charge the battery twice (IN ONE MONTH!).I'm pretty technologically challenged, so I don't really care (or even really understand) that this tablet only has a front camera.  If I want to take pictures, I'll use my phone.But, all in all, I would recommend this to people who aren't going to be using it heavily.  It really is great quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Nekiesha
Reviews.Content: It's a great product but a little expensive for my taste. It's easy to carry around and a great screen size.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use....
Reviews.Author: mitzimae
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle.  I prefer reading on the kindle to my I-pad.  I love that you can control the size of the font and the background is easy to read on.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and sound
Reviews.Author: Steve Brammer
Reviews.Content: I bought the Fire HD just to do e-mails and web browsing because my home computer failed. I found that I enjoyed streaming shows on it quite a bit. The picture is very sharp and the audio very clear. And I am enjoying reading at night more than my old kindle because of the built in illumination. The only drawback is the battery life (I just don't like being hooked to cords....)

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Tablet
Reviews.Author: David M. Loucks
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably cool.  Resolution is unmatched.  I'm an apple guy through and through, but why anyone would buy an Ipad when they could get the Kindle HD for so much less is sheer madness.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: JesseValentine
Reviews.Content: This tablet works great. I can easily read my books on it. The HD is clear and bright, and very sharp. Books, photos and aps download onto it very easily.

Reviews.Title: It's Good But Could Be Better If Access To Android Opens Up
Reviews.Author: ILoveTheUSA
Reviews.Content: So many reviews have been submitted so I probably won't give any new insight.  I like this tablet, the sound is good, the screen is excellent, and for the most part it runs smoothly for a dual core system.  My gripe with this is first, the wifi distance is weak.  On my laptop I will get very good download speeds at almost 50 feet from my gateway roughly 15+ megs per second.  On the Kindle it's well  below that.  When I try to watch Netflix it constantly freezes up and goes into buffering.  On web pages the load time is excessive.  When I am closer to the gateway though, the Kindle runs fast.  My second complaint is the gated community that Kindle users are forced into so we can't use Google Play and download a large number of apps.  Silk is a horrible web browser also.*********UPDATE 12/30/2013: I did research on Google and I guess it's Google that won't allow Kindle in. Also, the Silk web browser seems to be working better now for whatever reason. It's not as slow as before. On the WiFi distance issue I solved that by raising the gateway on a top shelf near the ceiling and now the Kindle picks up the signal no problem. That being the case I would now give it 4 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: Returned
Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: I had been very excited to get this tablet. I read reviews and ended up purchasing it instead of the iPad air. It arrived very quickly. I set it up and began it play around with its features. Here are my thoughts:I won't get into the pros too much because I'm pretty sure those are quite easy to see: screen, sound, size, price. I just want to get into the reasons why I sent it back.First the internet connection was really finicky when starting it up after it was locked. It would take quite a while to find the connection and sometimes required a restart to connect again.One of the main reasons I bought this was so I could video chat with my family. I couldn't get Skype to function properly. The audio was so quiet I couldn't hear anything people were saying. It would freeze the whole tablet, requiring me to force a restart. It is incredibly disappointing to have to force restarts on a brand new device. I troubleshot it for a couple of days, uninstalling/reinstalling and what not, but I couldn't get it to function. I'm sure I could have contacted amazon for some more troubleshooting, but I decided to send it back before reaching that point.I was really uncomfortable using the carousel function. It was neat to see the icons so big, but that was about it. Other than that it seemed like a huge waste of space to have only one or two massive icons available on the screen at one time.The App Store left a lot to be desired. There just weren't that many interesting options. Maybe I was just spoiled by my iPhone, but it feels really lacking to me.The straw that broke the camels back, prompting me to immediately return it, was something so simple and tiny: I wasn't able to save pictures from my email. How silly. A function that simple should be included without a doubt.In the end, it looks good, feels good, and sounds good. It was the tiny stuff that frustrated me to the pointof returning it. I didn't want to troubleshoot the device just to get it operational. I didn't want to deal with a finicky internet connection. I didn't like the lack off App Store options. Skype was a mess. I went ahead and purchased an iPad air. I should have just done that from the beginning.

Reviews.Title: A great tablet at an even better price
Reviews.Author: Leane Maddren
Reviews.Content: I replaced my first generation 7" kindle fire with this and have been pleasantly surprised and how much different the HD version is.  Wi-fi connection is fast - the only thing I have had trouble with is working out where my downloads are going to!  The size is great for watching TV shows and love the available apps and of course, is a fabulous book reader.  Love this - have not found that much difference between this and my husbands ipad at a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: I wish I hadn't bought it.
Reviews.Author: WashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: This tablet is a pain to use. The Silk browser crashes all the time. It jumps around opening new tabs, etc. I hate it. The tablet crashes and when it works, I am constantly waiting for it to skip back to home page.I first bought the Kindle Fire original. Love it and use it all the time still. It delivers as promised. This Fire HD is just a cheap knock off.

Reviews.Title: Not as  slick as billed
Reviews.Author: M. Eggleton
Reviews.Content: This machine functions as an ok book reader and internet browser. Some drawbacks though.  The touch screen isn't nearly as sensitive or accurate as my HTC evo 4g and find I have to (95% of the time)  touch 3 or 4 times the screen to get it to react or more accurately place the cursor.  Also this is a little too big and heavy to comfortably hold and read a book, it should be laying down for comfort.

Reviews.Title: kindle always agood purchase
Reviews.Author: Bonita R. Delbert
Reviews.Content: The kindle has always been a great idea and a great purchase.  I have loved it since I purchased my first one

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Mario
Reviews.Content: Totally love it. I ordered the case for it after I recevied it and love it also. Defintely recommends it.

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: R Reilly
Reviews.Content: it is easy to set up and use, plays music clearly, videos and games look great and books are easy to swipe.  very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire is the best!
Reviews.Author: Michelle Costello
Reviews.Content: I cannot live without my Kindle Fire. It is the best present I have ever received. It does it all there's no need for any other devices.

Reviews.Title: I love my new KIndle!
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: The screen is much larger and clearer than my first kindle fire.  My first one was fast, but this one is even faster in loading. I loved the first, and this one is even better!

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: M. Pinto "randysue"
Reviews.Content: Works great. Love the larger size for watching movies and shows. Great app selection. The reading capabilities are awesome. Better then I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: Refurb Kindle
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Item looks brand new and everything seems to work perfectly. This will be a Christmas present so I just briefly tried some programs but it moved quickly and connected to everything I attempted.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Jody Bender
Reviews.Content: So far a great product! Easy to use and just plain fun! Enjoying playing with it before giving it to my husband for Christmas!

Reviews.Title: WOW UPDATE *** Crashes & frustration !!
Reviews.Author: michael
Reviews.Content: This is for my son so far I set it up with Kindle Free Time and a bunch of other apps. The screen is awsome ! BUT he get it tonight for the first night of Hanukkah so I will report the look on his face when he opens it and uses it. I only set it up for him and played with it a little so the updated review will straight from my my 5 year old later tonight. But so far so GREAT +_ free shipping thanks !***UPDATE***DAD THIS IS AWSOME !!! And that is straight from my son's mouth !! Wehn he first opened the Kindle he was a little confused, it had his name and Free Time was all set up for him to go, but he was not used to seeing content just for his age. To be honest he was used to his I Pad touch and my wifes IPad.So after a little selling and showing him that he could have  most of his normal games and Netflix on the same pad he started to explore the free time.And to be honest no BS he has not switched back to the reg Kindle side of the pad other than to watch Netflix. HE LOVES IT & ITS ALL HIS books games etc etc. And I dont have to worry if the shows or games are right for his age.For all of you parents who have tech savy little ones let me tell you that the " Free TIme" for 2.99 is OUTSTANDING ! There are easy over 1000 books all age driven the games are great & the vids are a little young for my boy but he has found enough to keep him busy. Its just so much for 2.99 !The pad & the free time app are perfect !!Update ***** jan 1 the Kindle keeps crashing and freezing I have reset it twice to try to fix but it keeps bogging down freezing and apps just close and stop working. I don't get or maybe I do we are through the 30 period and it's prob going to totally fail. I thought this was a pretty fast pad but after using an ipad air and a hp slate this thing IS SLOWWWWW buyer beware. I still give the free time 10 stars fantastic but you can't add music to that side AND maybe Amazon should let us parents include some apps from the reg kindle side to the free time side have to drop it to ** 2 stars  just for the frustration maybe someone can give me a hint on this freezing and app crashes !!ANOTHER UPDATE NOW THE FIRE SAYS I AM OUT OF STORAGE SPACE ????!!! My son only has 15 apps and its full ?? are you kidding me my ipad has like 40 apps and still has a ton of space this stinks lowering it to a 1 star a total waste of money I should have bought him a mini thanks Amazon !!

Reviews.Title: Refurbished Advantage
Reviews.Author: P Steedman "Paul Steedman"
Reviews.Content: There is absolutely no difference between the refurbished unit and the new item. I was able to save money and purchase a higher quality item as my first Kindle Fire HD. The unit was perfectly packaged and would make a perfect gift as well.

Reviews.Title: GREAT BUY!!
Reviews.Author: "FE"
Reviews.Content: You told me it that the refurbished 8.9 would be like brand new and it was, ABSOLUTLY BEAUTIFUL!. It charged right up and it only took a few minutes working with it before I was able to read books, watch movies and I'm still learning. One of my best buys but I have ALWAYS been VERY SATISFIED with AMAZON!!

Reviews.Title: The Kindle is great for the money
Reviews.Author: P D James
Reviews.Content: I use my kindle for everything now, very rarely need to power on my P.C, can read, listen to music, Google everything.

Reviews.Title: Good for Amazon Prime and Freetime Users
Reviews.Author: Tan Bo
Reviews.Content: Dolby audio is better that in iPad. Nice performance of video playback and reading. Freetime is great for kids. But built-in browser is not as good as Safari or Chrome. Some software are not compatible as I expected.

Reviews.Title: I prefer the 7" over the 8.9" version
Reviews.Author: Indywolf
Reviews.Content: I had a Kindle Fire HD 7" version which i gave to my wife who wanted it. Honestly, the sound worked better on the 7" better than the 8.9". Also, it seemed to function better, and was better for Reading. I honestly am not real Thrilled with the "Dolby Audio" on the 8.9". Maybe because the speakers are further apart. It doesn't sound as loud. Just prefer the 7" to the 8.9".

Reviews.Title: love kindles
Reviews.Author: Deborah Krumwiede
Reviews.Content: Love my kindle, I own 3 Kindles.  I have not bought a hardback book since I bought a Kindle.  I do not have to turn on a light when I read at night.

Reviews.Title: Kindle is my bestest little buddy
Reviews.Author: Melody Kilpatrick "Melody"
Reviews.Content: I'm really in love with my new 8.9" Kindle HD. I have three other Kindles--one from each generation and every time I buy a new one I think I'll give my old one to my granddaughter. But I can't part with any of them. I've formed such a strong attachment that they're like my pets!! They go wherever I do. I can't recommend the Kindle line of tablets highly enough, whether you're experienced (you'll love all the new features on this model) or a novice, you'll enjoy your Kindle more than you can even imagine possible. Watch movies, do email, take pictures, use Skype, play games, listen to music with Dolby sound, shop, oh, and by the way, you can read a book on it!!!!Trust me, you won't be sorry if you buy any of the Kindle products!

Reviews.Title: Best purchase ever.
Reviews.Author: Bittycat
Reviews.Content: Love Love Love it!!  It is really great and the service that Amazon gives is awesome.  This tablet does everything you can imagine.  Perfect for any age .  Once again the support from Amazon is worth the price alone.  Thank you Amazon !!

Reviews.Title: No better deal for a $229 9" tablet out there
Reviews.Author: Would-be Writer
Reviews.Content: I haven't used it much, but when I have I love it. The resolution is wonderful and it's not even the better-pixelated HDX. Gmail was easy to set up and sync on the Fire HD, no problem there. I bought this because I couldn't see spending $500 for a similar-size iPad. I have an iMac and an iPod Touch and I like Apple, but they need to accept reality and lower their prices on their iPads. Apple no longer has a monopoly on the segment they invented.

Reviews.Title: Sorry I bought this
Reviews.Author: D. Gendreau "D. Gendreau"
Reviews.Content: I like the screen size of this Kindle Fire....but that's about it. It is extremely slow - emails take forever; and I am constantly experiencing "network issues" when I play games. Compared to my first regular Kindle Fire (which I have none of these problems), I am disappointed in this one and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Good product to have
Reviews.Author: Evie09
Reviews.Content: I really like it and enjoy using it but it's not as easy as I had hoped.  I guess once I master it, then I'll love it.  It is much better than the ipad.  I am glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: I like it......but.....
Reviews.Author: kittypaws
Reviews.Content: THE DEVICE:  There is no flash player to play videos.  If it had a flash player, I would give it 5 stars.  I wish I had known it would not play video clips such as You Tube and videos on Facebook.  Other features are good and overall operation is good.CUSTOMER SERVICE:  So far, I would give customer service 1 star, and that would be for a working phone number.  I was disconnected by the first representative I talked to, and when I jumped through the hoops online to receive another call, I was transferred 3 times until finally a representative said her computer had crashed and I would have to call back later.  During all the various "hold" times, I had to listen to the most annoying music of all time, a FRANTIC piano piece, which added to my frustration.At this point, I don't think I could - in good conscience - recommend this item.

Reviews.Title: Love This Product
Reviews.Author: deb
Reviews.Content: I do love this product.  It is great.  It is fun to carry around, play games, search, read books.  Lots of uses and lots of fun.  I do recommend this product.  The sound on this is also great.

Reviews.Title: Great when it works
Reviews.Author: Cherie M in EP CO
Reviews.Content: Annoying as all get out when it doesn't, something which occurs with much too great a frequency. "Silk is not responding" is a BIG PROBLEM! This message (along with a frozen device) occurs at least once daily. Come on, Amazon, fix your silk connection.

Reviews.Title: Happy with product
Reviews.Author: Theresa Soule Cross
Reviews.Content: I own two kindles, the 1st generation kindle with 7 inch screen and this one - the 8.9 and 32 GB.  I can't give much of a technical review but for my purposes I absolutely love this product.  Everything works seamlessly.  I am impressed with the improved sound quality which makes watching tv shows and movies much nicer.  And if you opt for the kindle free time, that is worth it in my opinion.  My 7 year old and three year old love it.  I like how kid friendly and password protected it is.  The picture quality is great, and magazines are really enjoyable on this product.  I recommend buying the micro hdmi cable on amazon (which at my time of purchase was only 9.99) and you will be able to project all kindle images onto your tv, including movies.

Reviews.Title: This is a great machine at a good price. ... BUT! !!!!!!
Reviews.Author: David Ecale
Reviews.Content: I was planning on waiting another year for the KF HDX 8.9 as I'm not *that* rich and it's price was just too much for my pocket, but this unit's price (refurbished, 64gb, 4G LTE, SP Offers) minus a 20% discount sold me. ... That and my Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 (original) just plain blows up with the latest Kindle App (which is a piece of unmitigated bloatware)! ***SPECIAL NOTE: See below for the fix for Kindle Bloat on the Samsung Galaxy Tab!*** So:The Good: larger screen; nice layout; fast enough to run the kindle App (bloatware that it has become); lots of space (64gb selected); good price; more to come, I'm sure. ...The Bad: no GOOGLE Play Store - I have a bunch of paid4apps to reload the hard way; A bit choppy when scrolling; Not the easiest interface to live with after 2+ years with ANDROID 2.2 on 3 other machines. I do miss the freedom of a cleaner ANDROID interface, then again, it's a KINDLE, not an ANDROID!The OK: Special Offers (non Special Offers version was not available with the 20% discount, 64 GB, and 8.9) aren't much of a problem. The splash screen has a rotating offer & there's also a(n almost) hidden Special Offers Tab. This is not as much an annoyance as I expected & just maybe I'll hit something that I'll buy; Speed is good, but not great. Expected as this is an incremental upgrade & not the HDX. Price/Performance tradeoff applies here. ...The Frustrating: It doesn't fit in my custom 7" bag from Eddie Bauer ($5.00 from the local Thrift Shop), but that's my problem as I selected the 8.9 vs. the 7; The HD & HDX don't have the sound out port next to the mini-HDMI port like the original Kindle Fire (Grace Digital docking system frustration).OK. All things considered, a great machine at a great price. I'm in the process of dumping my bloatware Kindle App from my Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0. .......One other note: I have had my Kindle Keyboard since it first came out. I'm not abandoning it for the simple reason that I can read it in bright daylight outside. This is one limitation of the Color machines. That and battery life. So, I trade off as the day develops.(300+ books and counting. Alternate free book sources include ManyBooks_dot_net & Gutenberg_dot_org).-----Additions after a week of use:1) My case (from eBay as I didn't like the Amazon cases) has 3 small magnets in it. This means that it activates the Kindle HD's magic (magnetic) auto-off switch when I close the cover. This is a nice feature; however, it is quite annoying when I am reading with several interruptions. Example: loading 22 DVDs into a Kubuntu (Linux-based) system required interruptions in my reading every several minutes as I had to swap DVDs. Closing the cover (to protect the screen) as I placed the Kindle down meant that I had to re-login to continue reading. An annoyance! Furthermore, I am unable to find anywhere where I can explicitly turn this truly annoying feature off! I'd prefer the option to manually switch the unit off, or let it time out (currently set at 30 minutes).2) It is a bit klutzy to adjust screen brightness when reading a book. This used to be in the aaAA section on the older B&W; kindles & in the Kindle App for Android. Sadly, not in the Kindle Fire HD! Thus one step has morphed to three steps. Gaaaaa!3) Bloatware. I purchased this unit because it was capable of operating the latest Kindle App at a reasonable speed. The Kindle App for Android has bloated to the point that it is almost completely useless on my Samsung Galaxy Tab (P100) unit. The real crime here is that I can't back-load to an earlier version that actually works on the P100! Shame on you Amazon!4) SP Offers. After a week, I know that my next Kindle will definitely *not* have special offers. They aren't that ugly, just persistently annoying over time. I do like the (almost hidden) Special Offers tab on the top selection bar, but the continuous cycling of offers does become tiresome as I use the machine. Oh well, I'd have paid for the no special offers option, if I had known, but it wasn't available in the features that I wanted on the refurbished model. Live & learn.5) Wireless: I have the 4G LTE version w/ATT. ... No choice here when I purchased the Kindle, except that I'd have preferred the Verizon version. I have had lousy reception with ATT over the years, so I'll take this one with a grain of salt. I haven't turned this feature on & have it in reserve, so we'll see in the next few years if ATT has improved their coverage. PS. ATT coverage in my home sucks rocks. The only way to call by cell phone is to have a WI-FI connection to a router & a cable modem! //This is mostly as my home is in a geographic shadow for the local ATT & T-Mobile cell towers. When I had an ATT cell phone, I had to go outside and stand in my front yard (in winter) to actually complete a cell phone call (not fun at 30 below in Minnesota)! WI-FI call switching has saved me from many potential frostbite episodes over the years.//And, after 2 weeks, some insights:1) If I get tired of the ads, then I have the option to pay an additional $15 & Amazon will shut off the special offers. I am considering this, but have not yet made a decision.2) After I got everything up & running on the Kindle Fire HD 8.9, I decided that it was time to work on my Samsung Galaxy Tab. I saved off all of my critical data. Then I performed a *HARD* reset & wiped the tablet clean! This erased all existing memory & all downloaded apps on the tablet, then reloaded the built-in apps from the ROM memory. !!! And a miracle occurred! !!! The pig of a Kindle App with all of it's bloatware was blasted into never-never land and the pre-loaded Kindle App from ROM was re-installed! The older app works like a champ! It has revitalized my Galaxy Tab as a 7" eReader! So, absolutely, positively, no Kindle upgrades ever again on the Galaxy Tab. Why replace a GREYHOUND with a PIG when you don't need to!Now I have both a working 7" Kindle eReader & an 8.9" Kindle eReader!More to come. ....

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: lmmwals
Reviews.Content: I don't like this Kindle as much as my previous one. The browser freezes or crashes a lot, the screen does not orient to hoe your holding it and the camera is only forward facing.

Reviews.Title: Glitches
Reviews.Author: Jacquio
Reviews.Content: While I loved my original Kindle Fire, I am not crazy about this one. Tremendous amount of glitches and some features I had on the original were not included with this version. It shuts off when it feels like it. You constantly have to reload apps. (some work, some dont). Internet capabilities have changed also. Im very disappointed with this version. Miss my old one. Dont understand what the problem is. Maybe I just got a bad one out of the bunch.

Reviews.Title: Not Terribly Impressed
Reviews.Author: A. James
Reviews.Content: Cons: The touch keys don't always work so well, sometimes you have to type when the unit is vertical because it won't work when horizontal, sometimes it freezes up.  It doesn't have a USB port.Pros: It did play video movies on the tv via a micro HDMI cable. I could read books when it was charged up. I was able to get my email.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire ok but has problems
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer M.J.W. in Atlanta
Reviews.Content: Kindle fire not all it promised. Battery life sucks. It turns on by itself  when charging, and gets hot. Speech to text jumps three pages - a chapter, doesn't sync with my other kindle. I still use it for internet but my biggest need was for reading. For reading/text to speech I like my first kindle best( keyboard)  Wonder if the latest kindle will be any better

Reviews.Title: Best tablet ever!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I looked at several tablets including the iPad and with all things considered, the kindle fire hd 8.9 is the best option for the money in my opinion. Now that I have received it and used it for a few weeks I am very happy with it. I couldn't believe how cool it was the day it arrived. I spent hours and hours with it for a whole week! I couldn't put it down. I still use it daily and would feel lost without it. The screen resolution is fantastic. It's fast over wi-fi (I didn't opt for the 4G but I'm sure that's great as well), and has lots of great apps, with more being added all the time. I have Hulu+, Netflix and Spotify on it but with Amazon Prime alone, I can watch thousands of video movies and tv shows. With an added HDMI mini cable you can connect it to your digital tv and watch videos from amazon or the other apps on your tv! I highly recommend the kindle fire hd if you have amazon prime or are considering getting it. I have used prime for years to get free shipping on prime eligible items of which I can almost always find. I use it a lot for reading magazines and it saves trees. Also books. I have had kindles since the 1st generation ereader and have a lot of books from those previous purchases. The only negative remark I have is that the speakers were not as great as I expected. The newer model might be better for that feature. I really don't know. I would recommend buying the fast charger adapter. The device doesn't come with an adapter at all so if you don't buy one or have one already, you will have to charge it via USB on your computer. I had an adapter but it didn't charge very fast at all. The one for fast charging does a better job. I highly recommend the insurance too. It's well worth the money. I love this table and I'm so enthused about it!

Reviews.Title: I was very Nervous
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Santiago
Reviews.Content: I Was very nervous about ordering a Refurbished Kindle,but everything has been working properly. The Kindle is in great condition and no one would be able to tell that it is a refurbished model. I am very happy I took the leap and would recommend anyone to do the same.

Reviews.Title: No Need For Itunes!!!
Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: For me, the best reason to own this tablet is that you are not shakled to Apple!! You can connect directly to your PC and just drag n drop whatever file you like. I watch .avi movies all the time and stream Netflix perfectly anywhere there is wi fi. I love this thing!!!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: michelle baumann
Reviews.Content: Our entire family loves this kindle!!  We might be buying another one for Christmas. Thanks to the Amazon amazing support team for taking care of us with the replacement of our old kindle with this great new one!!

Reviews.Title: great kindle
Reviews.Author: Beverly MaKarrall
Reviews.Content: the Kindle fire is going to be something i look forward to use in my retirement years and while traveling

Reviews.Title: It is a great tablet with cheaper price
Reviews.Author: Baby's Slave
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Kindle Fire. Love it. I've never used other well-known tablets so I can't compare with them. However, I can do whatever I want on Kindle Fire. AND IT'S MUCH CHEAPTER!I can get online just like using my computer. I can buy books, videos, magazine, apps, in few steps. This model has a built-in camera. Now I can even Skype with my family when I am away from home. I only use it to read, play games, and once a while surf internet. I don't know what iPad or Galaxy offers, but Kindle can give me everything I need and it is a lot cheapter. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Best Thing I Ever Bought since my Computer
Reviews.Author: Lynn b.
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Kindle Fire HD, it is easy to run my games, check the weather, read books on and listen to music. I love the fact that it has 32 GB and Cloud storage. I was so happy with mine I bought one for my daughter-in-law , she does not even do computors nor laptops, she is having a ball with hers!

Reviews.Title: absolutely love it!
Reviews.Author: bridey
Reviews.Content: I bought this Kindle because it had the highest resolution of all the popular tablets. Also had a 20% off voucher from Amazon for a refurbished Kindle. I am so impressed with the resolution, Dolby stereo sound, 4G speed, etc. I've had multiple tablets and come from a family who always has the latest and greatest. This one by far impresses me more than any of the others my brother has had at twice the price. I strongly recommend going with a refurbished Kindle. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Worth the price!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Chris Peterson
Reviews.Content: The best money I ever spent. Love this Kindle. The sound and picture qualities are amazing! If watching movies the battery doesn't last long but the PowerFast charger does the trick. Be sure to purchase the charger with the Kindle if you intend to watch movies. Just a suggestion.

Reviews.Title: my photos are crystal clear!
Reviews.Author: Gloria
Reviews.Content: Programs come up faster and I love seeing all the details in my photos I couldn't see on my first kindle.  Love that my photos are much larger.  I need to read up on taking photos tho, still don't know how or what all is needed to take a photo and if I have all that it takes on this kindle to be able to take them...Using the Internet is much easier and faster as well.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Pattie
Reviews.Content: Love it! Can't believe it's refurbished. Easy to use, love the quality and can't wait to use it on the plane.

Reviews.Title: Really researched this decision and so pleased with it!
Reviews.Author: Teresa A. Brown
Reviews.Content: I was very unsure about this and actually was advised against it, but went ahead and tried it and so glad that I did.  I use the Kindle mostly for reading books, messing with apps such as Facebook, and our Sunday school emails our lessons and we read it during class.  My husband uses it when he is playing in the church band.  He uses the app GuitarTapp tabs & Chords and gets his music so that it will scroll for him and he can change from song to song as he needs.  We both love it.  I am able to view Youtube videos and they are so awesome!  This has done all that we have asked it to do and more.  Very pleased with our purchase and we were blessed enough to get it at the refurbished price and you would never be able to tell it was not brand new.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: The fire
Reviews.Author: Jackie
Reviews.Content: I bought the kindle white just for reading books, Then the kindle fire came out and my husband bought it for me. I didn't think I would use it that much because I used my kindle white for reading and I thought all that extra stuff would go unused until I started using it. I fell in love with it. I take my kindle fire with me everywhere. Now I'm a 60 year old woman who didn't grow up with all this new technology, and I don't like learing new things it frustrates me. This was easy to learn. Now this is where it get good. If I had problems I called there customer hot line. And these people are GREAT. They always talked me through what ever I was having problems with. Usually it was just me not knowing what to do. For instant I like listening to autiobooks in bed. It helps me fall asleep. I downloaded a book and it didn't pop up on my kindle. I called the hotline and they said see the little half circle on the top of the page, push it and your new bood should pop up. Sure enough it did. It wasn't the kindle it was me. But they are always there to help. They have the BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE of any device I have ever owned.  The one thing I didn't like on my fire it didn't have 3G my older white has it and I love it I don't have to be hooked up to the internet for it to download.  I see with the new kindle you can get the 3 G with it and I'm going for it. I also am excited that you can get a camer with it also. I've got noting but good to say about Kindle.  Also if you have a kindle and you want to trade it in for another kindle they will work with you to do that.

Reviews.Title: I am glad I purchased this!
Reviews.Author: Susan A.Savion
Reviews.Content: I took it on my recent trip to Santa Catalina Island and a trip through the southwest.  Unfortunately, I was not always in areas that had wifi available.  Also, it took a bit of time to connect to wi-fi, as there is apparently a 2nd step to take after it says you are already connected before you ACTUALLY become connected.  But otherwise I love the beautiful format.  I read my book(s) under the brilliant stars inside my sleeping bag on top of the island. The lighted page is very welcome.  The attachment light I purchased for my regular Kindle has already burned out.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: kelly Burchfield-Denton
Reviews.Content: I am more than happy with my Kindle Fire!The whole family uses it :) LOVE AMAZON! I'm enjoying prime so much I wish I would have gotten it sooner!

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: A....
Reviews.Content: Received it fast. Works exactly as expected. Highly Recommend! Cannot go wrong with this purchase. If you are considering, go ahead and buy it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: JoyOK
Reviews.Content: Although I Loved my first Kindle Fire 7" and never tired of the many uses I received from it, like reading the many e-books I downloaded. I searched the web and felt that the Kindle HD 8.9" would give me a larger screen to view the web and streaming videos and the many games I love to play. I recommend the Kindle HD 8.9" and Love to shop Amazon .com I now you will too.

Reviews.Title: no charger
Reviews.Author: jojo
Reviews.Content: The two kindles I had previously came with a charger . I had to go to the store and buy one. it takes a longer time to charge.  I wasn't going to buy one on line and pay for shipping.  I wish they would have said that I needed one . I would have brought one at the time . I do like it so far.

Reviews.Title: Needs a "use booklet"
Reviews.Author: Dewey Fritts
Reviews.Content: I had difficulty getting onto and using it at first.  I had a friend talk me through it and turned out I had to call the Kindle Fire number.  The cstomer service person was very kind and took her time to help me sort out some of the problems.  She had to help me change my password.  I also checked a book at the library that was somewhat helpful (not from Kindle or Amazon).  I ths been three weeks since I recieved it as abirthday present and am still exploring the features.  Hopefully I will have it all figured out before my next birthday.....

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB
Reviews.Author: Elaine B. Dafnis
Reviews.Content: I loved my first Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB just fine until the battery would no longer accept a charge.This first one was a 2012 Christmas present, and the battery problem occurred in August 2013.Amazon was just terrific in their response to my problem.  They had my second Kindle Fire HD in my hands within 24 hours ofcontacting them.  My second Kindle Fire HD is just wonderful.  I am so glad to have a wonderful product, and the wonderful supportof Amazon.I would recommend Amazon to anyone, and have done so.

Reviews.Title: Great Kindle
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Kindle. Graphics are stunning and the size is just right. The tablet holds a charge very well.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Susie Womack
Reviews.Content: The only thing that comes to my mine is..............LOVE IT.............LOVE IT...................LOVE IT!!!!IT does everything I wanted it to do.  What more can I say.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Marylou
Reviews.Content: The reason I bought the Kindle Fire was because I can read my books now with out having to sit by a lamp and the color, I can also play my games anywhere now too,  the only problem is that its a little to heavy for me and I can not read that long cause my hands get tierd.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Sarah Lowenstein
Reviews.Content: If I didn't know better I would have thought it was brand new.  It exceeds all expectations.  My only complaint is that it did not come with a charger which I think is just ridiculous but obviously not a deal breaker!

Reviews.Title: Really enjoying my kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Rachelieachelie
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle.  I wanted a tablet to stream TV shows and movies and to skype with family.  The kindle fire meets all of my needs perfectly.  The kindle fire is also a quality tablet for the price - the screen is made from gorilla glass and is durable and the body of the tablet is smooth with all pieces fitting together exactly.  What I don't like is that the kindle fire does not come with a plug-in wall charger, and with two kids (one under a year), having to have my computer out and on to USB charge is annoying.  I wound up using my previous kindle's plug-in wall charger, but having to pay for another charger for the price of the kindle fire seems silly.

Reviews.Title: The kids absolutely love it.
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: I bought this mainly for my wife and kids. All I can say is that my wife and I barely get a chance to get on it due to them constantly using it. The kids are always reading, playing games or watching a movie on it. My main suggestion would be to make sure you are a Prime member. We get so much free stuff with that membership.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Sherry Briggs
Reviews.Content: Needs longer charge on battery, needs screen with sun readable(bought a screen cover but does not work, love the kindle fire inside does every thing  I need.

Reviews.Title: thing i like and dislike
Reviews.Author: David Walters
Reviews.Content: Size is perfect for me i dont have big hands. I dont like not being able to recieve plctures in a text. i dislike  that there is no way to take a plctures of anything but yourself! For the price i would think it would have a two way camera!seem like you need to fix that problem.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't hold a charge.
Reviews.Author: S. Crumpton
Reviews.Content: It doesn't hold a charge for more than an hour or two. Need to keep it plugged in if watching movies.

Reviews.Title: Great Pad
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: We have several pad at home and this one is as good as any on the market. I use it for books mostly but surfing is good too. Resolution is great and battery life is acceptable. MUCH better than an iPad for the money. All the reviews I read were right, great pad for the money.

Reviews.Title: More than expected!
Reviews.Author: John P. Murphy
Reviews.Content: I have become pretty skeptical over the years so I was pleased when this Kindle turned out to be as great as it is. This is a fabulous product. Internet browsing is a breeze, checking e-mail is as simple as it can be. I joined Prime right away so I had free books, movies, TV, games, apps, everything I could think of immediately at my finger tips. I run a CAD workstation all day and this is a godsend for somebody that does not want to use a computer when they get home. Lightweight, awesome graphics, tons of stuff on it. If my wife doesn't stop borrowing it I may have to buy another one. Really! It's that good.

Reviews.Title: Wish I could give it a 5 star rating
Reviews.Author: jennifer
Reviews.Content: My son got the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 as a Christmas present in 2012. If a few unimaginable, disappointing problems hadn't reared their ugly head just recently I'd give the Kindle a 5-star rating, unfortunately for now, kindle is just mediocre. ;/Let's start it this way... until yesterday I WANTED to <3 the Kindle. I've gotten 3, the Kindle, Kindle Fire HD 8.9 and Kindle Fire HD 7.I was sharing my son's Kindle for reading books until I got my Kindle this month (I have the 7" Kindle Fire HD) I ignored some of the "glitches" thinking I'd take the time to straighten things out once I had my personal Kindle...well no such luck.1) There is no way to keep content from anyone you share an account with, be it a spouse, parent or child. Meaning my horror books are visible to my son, no matter what I do, unless I want to delete my purchased content. I personally like to read and reread books, now I'm forced to waste money and get rid of a book...bummer!! Luckily my son is not a kid to open something that's not his BUT some of the title pages are scary for a young child, so I'm left with only one option. Don't buy, or buy and delete, which still makes the cover photo available while I'm reading the book.2) There is an app for monitoring your children's Kindle activity (Kindle Freetime) but it's a pay for app and the ONLY way to keep adult content, inappropriate content from a child's view. Disappointing! I should be able to block material. This could be a solution to above complaint.3) There is no way to organize your books and apps. For someone who has purchased dozens and dozens of books in 8 months, this is a real pain in the bottom. Considering it's actually available on the earlier and less expensive versions...why leave that option off the Kindle Fire HD? Again, this could be an easy solution to the above frustrating complaints.These are enough for me to be disappointed with the Kindle. I'm considering returning the 2 most recent purchases, and no longer purchasing Kindle eBooks, so that I don't risk my son being exposed to books I'd rather he not see.BTW before anyone comments back the books I'm personally discussing are true crime, mystery, suspense books, nothing crazy, no smut, no triple x, I just don't want my son seeing the cover to Black Dahlia or the likes. My son won't be looking for them but he simply can't AVOID seeing them as they are listed in the cloud ;/There should be a way to organize or remove books from view.Darn Kindle I wanted so badly to like you. Great visual, great sound, fast web...but the MAIN feature you are known for...eBooks...really second class.

Reviews.Title: My Second Kindle
Reviews.Author: Kimyatta Evans
Reviews.Content: I loved my 1st kindle.  After owning it for a few short months I began to have re-charging and timing-out problems.  I put up with it for a few weeks.  Then reached out to Amazon.com who were so nice and replaced it for free within less than a week.  My 2nd kindle is great.  It still times out a bit more than I would like but have not had any of the charging issues I had with my 1st one.  If Amazon.com could resolve the timing-out issue, my kindle would be the best device ever.  I love it more than my smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 32 GB
Reviews.Author: Tom C
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd one I have ordered. Because the first two were defective. I enjoy the Kindle so much more than the Nexus 7 I had previously and much more than my wife's IPAD 2. But, this 3rd Kindle had a ghost cloud on screen. At first I thought it was a smudge and when it wouldn't wipe off, I knew it was a screen issue. Anyway, it's still better than the others. Don't know if I want to bother returning this one again or say forget it and deal with it. Amazon, immediately replaced the cloud or pixel discolored Kindle the next day.

Reviews.Title: LOVE MY KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: N. Tierney
Reviews.Content: So I had an iPad through work but when changed jobs had to return it.  I decided to get a Kindle Fire instead since I already have a Prime Membership and loved that I could watch a lot of tv shows and movies for free.  I have to say I love this way more than I did the iPad.  My kids have the smaller version and they are so easy to sync (unlike that other program!).  Just press one button and we all can share the apps and books that we want.  The sound is great and the picture is awesome.  The only issue I have is you can't get as many apps as you can through apple...like Candy Crush Saga, I have to use my iPhone to play that :(

Reviews.Title: Keeps getting better
Reviews.Author: CassieH
Reviews.Content: I hesitated about this purchase and since I already owned  the first Kindle Fire there was no rush. When the item went on sale  I decided to gave it a shot and I'm glad I did. I really like the larger screen more than I thought I would. Well worth the price and works as well as my first 2 Kindles. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: I can't go anywhere without it
Reviews.Author: Joan
Reviews.Content: Received this as a gift to read the paper (its going digital three days a week).  I liked it so much I gave one to my daughter for her birthday.

Reviews.Title: OMG - we love it
Reviews.Author: V. Saling "Book Addict"
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing product... we use it everyday... you should get one if your thinking about it... It is so easy to use, easy to read even in the dark... games are so vivid... get one for yourself today.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet.
Reviews.Author: Ronald D James
Reviews.Content: A great tablet at a great price. In no way would I have guessed that it was refurbished. Basically I just pocketed the difference in price between this and a new one. The graphics are great – I don’t feel silly watching a TV show or movie on this device like I did on smaller tablets. And in general, working with a larger and higher definition screen is a big help for my less than perfect eye-sight.

Reviews.Title: Hopefully the next Kindle Fire and win the name BLAZE
Reviews.Author: Askeptik
Reviews.Content: I like the size and generally I like the Kindle both books and musicI do think it could use a better camera, one with some pixel strength and one that can be aimed outward.I find that Kindle being totally devoid of Google products is a detraction and the access to the web is not great.But I find I am loyal to Kindle and Amazon and Amazon's marvelous customer service.

Reviews.Title: Very nice!
Reviews.Author: Christina Poirier
Reviews.Content: Kindle is very nice and it was a birthday present - she loves it and it is also great for internet, email etc!  Very nice, thanks!

Reviews.Title: Fire H.D. 8.9"
Reviews.Author: John R. Woodson
Reviews.Content: I have had a very satisfactory experience with this unit, it is amazing , the quality in it.  I seldom go to my desk PC now as everything is right on the Kindle.  I am very satisfied.  The only quirk I have so far is the sound.  I haven't figured how to turn it up so I can hear it !  That will come, I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Country2560
Reviews.Content: I really like my kindle fire.  I use it more than I do my laptop.  I can do almost everything on my kindle fire than I do on my laptop. The only thing I don't like about the kindle fire is that I can't take photos with it.  I still haven't figured out the purpose of the camera because you can't take photos like you can on an IPad.  Other than that I am very happy with the Kindle Fire. +++++

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD is pretty amazing!
Reviews.Author: Marcus Gamble
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for her birthday she reads a lot in her spare time and she loves all those addictive games you can get. Interenet access is great, even in areas with terrible wifi. We skype all the time because we are dual military so good wifi is a must!Only thing I can ding the HD on is no rear camera. I think a rear camera is a standard in technology like this these days... Other then a rear camera everything else impresses me about the HD. Great battery life, great lighting, easy controls, super quick processor, and almost dummy proof!

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: pbra133177
Reviews.Content: I had the Kindle Fire and finally wore it out.  I just received the Fire HD 8.9 and love it.  So easy to use.The colors are amazing. So pleased with the purchase. And having a camera on it is great.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Kindle
Reviews.Author: C. Mcgregor
Reviews.Content: We had actually purchased two of these for our Grandsons last Christmas.  Of course they love them.  Kept telling me I needed one since I had ordered books through Amazon all the time.  You know what they say about "old dogs new tricks".  Put it off and put it off.  I would order 4-5 books at a time and always had the excuse I still have one more.  Finally broke down and got one for me!  I absolutely love it.  You can do email, Facebook, any apps from the app store, AND books.  Love reading on it.  You can adjust the brightness, the color of background and size of print.  It is perfect if you read at night and don't want a lot of lights on.  I love when I need another book it is instantly there.  It is just the greatest little gadget ever and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: qualityatagoodprice
Reviews.Content: I wish I could replace my laptop with this kindle...  It has a great feel, just the right size and weight, amazingly bright and crisp screen.  Quick respond and fast navigation.  Add editing for MSFT docs and vpn for corporate intranets and it's perfect!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Mitzi  Allen "Mitzi Allen"
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 in May of this year. I absolutely love it. It is everything and more than I expected. After deciding that the Kindle Fire HD was what I wanted, I waited a long time before I made the final decision to buy. I just wanted to make sure it was what I really wanted.The quality is superb. Crystal clear viewing, fast downloads, quality speakers, and  I am extremely pleased with Amazon Prime. I 100% recomend this product.

Reviews.Title: My heart will forever belong to kindle!
Reviews.Author: Katelyn Payne
Reviews.Content: I have used an iPad, a nook, and kindle. The kindle will always my first choice, I love using it and I never have a problem. If I do have an issue I call amazon and they help me, they are by far the easiest people I have ever had to work with! They make life easy! :)

Reviews.Title: Started off great and has declined since
Reviews.Author: Christian Clark
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle about a week ago and have been using it for school. It is fairly fast and it works great for school and scheduling. I recommend it to anyone. However, there are a few issues. 1. My email says it is "checking email" but won't upload any new messages I have received, so I have to use my laptop (started happening 3-4 days after use). 2. There was one random time with the screen's pixels went all different colors and I managed to fix that (happened on the 4th day and hasn't happened since).Wishlist for the Kindle1. Outside camera, not just the camera for skyping facing the user.2. More customizationOther than that, if you have any second thoughts buying this product, I highly recommend it and even though there are a few kinks still, the quality of the product is very high.UPDATEAfter posting my review, a couple hours later my email began working again!UPDATEThe email has ceased working once again, a few hours after it began working. Also, sometimes letters need a firm press to work.Wishlist: once you hit "space" after using the symbols keyboard, I wish the keyboard would return to the letter keyboard.It still works great and am happy to have it.UPDATEEmail is working again and has been working for the past week. I really enjoy using my Kindle Fire HD and it has replaced my iPod.However, the office app that is pre-downloaded onto the KF is terrible. Only some of the PDF files will actually open and the ones that don't, there's an option to "send error" and I do that. I received an email this morning with one solution, upgrade the office program. I went to do that and the app COSTS $15!!! So, if your Kindle is going to be used for business, you may want to look at other tablets.UPDATEThe "on" button at the top of the device is not working anymore. There is plenty of battery left in the device, as I charged it last night. It will only give me the Kindle Fire start-up screen then go black...UPDATEMy kindle works, however, the "sleep" button will only turn the device off, even if I just tap the button. Other than that it is working just fine.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: It's late so I'm going to try and keep this really brief.CONS:  Bad buttons. There is only one huge con to note. The buttons are tiny and they fit into the sides of the kindle in a way that make it really hard to press them. If you buy this, make sure you get a case that can take advantage of the open/close wake/sleep feature.  No back camera. I don't really care about this, but I know this will likely be an issue for some.PROS:  Perfect size. It doesn't feel like an oversized phone, and it doesn't feel like I'm carrying around a giant cutting board. I like the 8.9 size better than any other tablet I've used.  Battery life. The battery life is great. It's kind of necessary since its main purpose is for reading books, but still, it's worth noting.  Lightweight. It's weight is almost perfect. Light enough that you'll never tire of holding it, while heavy enough that it has substance while you're holding it and using it. It doesn't get uncomfortable, and you won't ever thing about the weight. Definitely a good thing.  Simple interface. The interface is extremely accessible and intuitive at all times. It's simple and doesn't have the usual "dominoes on a table" style interface I've come to hate so much. This is definitely a more personal and subjective pro, but I thought I'd mention it. Just remember that the interface may be a con for some people.  Fast wifi. What can I say? The wifi works well. If I'm not mistaken, it has some of the best wifi technology available at the moment.  Front camera. The front camera is good for Skype. Means I can do video calls when I'm on vacation/not at home. Don't really know what else you'd use it for though.  Auto adjust brightness. This is old news, but I find that my kindle's auto adjust seems to work better than my phone's. (Samsung galaxy s2) This is probably more my phone's than the kindle. The point is if you're not trying to conserve battery, just use the auto. It works well.  Swype. I haven't really kept up with Apple recently, but last I heard, android was the only thing with Swype. Definitely a pro. I wouldn't even think of buying a tablet without it. I'm writing this review on my kindle. It would have taken 10x as long without Swype or a keyboard. That's just what Swype does, allows you to keep your wpm up while freeing you from keyboards. This allows you the freedom a tablet should have. In fact, that's kind of the whole point of tablets. Besides, Bluetooth keyboard are mini sized so your wpm is going to suffer in whatever keyboard size you start using less. Again, not sure, but if the iPad doesn't have Swype, then I'd buy this over that regardless of anything else.  Kindle perks. Kindles get some special perks if your an Amazon prime member. You can borrow one free book a month. It's a bit underwhelming, but free is free and pros are pros.  Amazon integration. This will be a huge con for some and a huge pro for others. I use Amazon for a ton of stuff so I enjoy it. if you have Amazon prime, then you'll also get a seamless integration of Amazon instant video. The kindle also syncs with all of your Amazon cloud data. This makes it really easy to keep up with everything on multiple devices.OVERALL: I think it's pretty clear how I feel about the kindle fire HD 8.9. It's a great tablet for a great price. It's probably worth a lot more to anyone with an Amazon prime account. I'm sure there are a ton of pros that I forgot, and at least a few more cons I haven't really thought of yet, but suffice it to say that I'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Adequate but lacking.
Reviews.Author: Kyle D Esala
Reviews.Content: Web browsing is an extreme pain on this device. The browser is laggy and takes forever to display a page. Don't even think about scrolling quickly through a page because all you will get is a blank page for a few seconds before it can catch up. I would think that in our world today, web browsing should be a fairly basic thing to nail down. Amazon definitely has some work to do on Sylk.Otherwise when used as a strictly video watching device for Amazon videos it works perfectly. I have a large library of titles I've purchased and am also a prime member so I have lots to watch.The only other thing that I feel is missing is an actual app for the Amazon store itself. It seems like a no brainer to have that built into the device but it does not exist. As mentioned above about the web browsing, shopping through the regular website is a painful experience.

Reviews.Title: Fire is lukewarm.
Reviews.Author: PageTurner
Reviews.Content: Its........... mmm... good, verging on great.  What it does, it does well.What I don't like... no sdhc port to hook up memory.the touch-screen works well, but if you've large fingers like me, it can be difficult with some menus.worst of all is the CONSTANT advertising or suggestive selling or buying hints with most of the apps available for the Fire.The Fire uses a version of Android, and many of the apps available are written for Android.. but too often they dont' work on the Fire.No input/output from the mini usb port, evidently its just for charging the battery.  I'd hoped to find software that would let me control my Canon sxi camera with, but with no IO port, no can do.So do I like it? yes, reservedly.  Do I wish i'd saved a few more bucks and gone with a Windows RT unit? yeah.. I think so.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Cindy Burns
Reviews.Content: Got this as a replacement for my smaller defunct kindle fire and it's great! Love the larger screen and Amazon was great in their willingness to assist me.

Reviews.Title: Satisfaction Guaranteed
Reviews.Author: S. L. Cooper
Reviews.Content: First purchase I made was the 7 inch Kindle...love it and now love the Kindle 8.9.  I'm not much for reviewing electronic items so I only have one thing to say...a friend has an iPad and the Kindle does everything it does and more at a lower price and Amazon support.  You can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: Above and beyond
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My children, my husband, nor I can put this Kindle down.  We have downloaded MANY books and games.  It was a lifesaver during swim meets AND during our summer road trip.  Perfect for people of all ages.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire second one
Reviews.Author: Al F Yatlin Jr
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle fire.  The first one I had was good brand new.  I was playing a game on it and all of a sudden a red screen came up and it quit working.  Amazon being the good company that they are sent me a new one.  Which is the subject of this review.  It works good.  Except for one small thing there are lines that go through the screen some times when the brightness is too high.

Reviews.Title: Why would you ever buy anything else.
Reviews.Author: M. O'Brien
Reviews.Content: This unit replaces a gen. 3 Kindle. It is head and shoulders above the old unit which we dearly loved. Now instead of having to drag a laptop along on a trip to do basic things, I take the lightweight Kindle Fire HD 8.9" unit with me. It can do everything I need it to do when I am on a trip. The screen is amazing in HD color and you have the comfort of e-Ink when you are reading. I couldn't ask for a better unit. You can argue all day long about this can do that and that can do this but this can do everything I need it to do and it cost a lot less. That's a winner for me.

Reviews.Title: Love The Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Samssong
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of research before buying the Kindle Fire HD, looking at different pads etc.  I am in my 70's and somewhat computer literate, but was a bit skeptical about the purchase. I've had so much fun learning my way around the Kindle. It's been quite an adventure. I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: r. price
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing unit.. good picture.. with real  hd quality even the small speakers sound exceptionalWould recommend this unit to anyone who wants or needs a Kindle Fire.. Simply put the best possible thing you could get for the money

Reviews.Title: Glad I purchased
Reviews.Author: Alyshia Selmon
Reviews.Content: Love the HD screen. I have gotten many compliments on how bright the colors are on my screen. The size is perfect and the sound quality is awsome. I would recommend this for children and adults. Its is not just for reading. There are games, videos, movies, and other apps.

Reviews.Title: Terrific
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: I use it for reading books mostly and for me that is where it shines. I've read more books in a few months than I have in many years. I like being able to have it anywhere, waiting for a haircut, waiting for a meal at a restaurant if I'm alone. Less TV and more reading. I do check e-mail, calendar, Facebook and occasional browser, games I don't bother with.

Reviews.Title: Great product with 1 annoyance
Reviews.Author: Adam Gagnon
Reviews.Content: This is my second kindle fire (bought this one for my mom). It is just as amazing as the original but a bigger, higher res screen, and more flexibility as a tablet. My only complaint is it is loaded with ads that Amazon wants 15 bucks to turn off. Having paid 200 for my original, 80 for amazon prime, and almost 300 for a new one trying to squeeze me for an extra 15 dollars to turn off ads that shouldn't be on a product I legally purchased anyway is a really tacky move. I love Amazon but that is a scummy nickle and dime tactic.The unit itself is amazing though. Highly recommended, nothing else in its price range even comes close.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Scrapper
Reviews.Content: It's OK but not a door buster item.The HD 8.9" screen freezes, the screen rotation lock doesn't always work. The additional touch screen (scroll, enlarge, move, etc) don't always work either. I have performed the "hard shutdown" as suggested on line and also by the support group. I don't think that should be necessary for the amount of money charge for this model. The sound and screen resolution are great and when everything works as it should I love it.I liked my regular Kindle Fire better for the above reasons. It never gave me any trouble what so ever.

Reviews.Title: Portable and light
Reviews.Author: Anshu
Reviews.Content: It is a good alternative  to iPadsPros:- 1920x1200 resolution HD screen, but only 254 ppi :(- Light weight- Long battery life- PriceCons:- No external memory card slot- No back camera- Speakers are on the back, which can make sound muffled if kept flat on a bed- "Power adapter sold separately"... really?

Reviews.Title: great machine
Reviews.Author: J. Gehl "John"
Reviews.Content: The 8.9 kindle has not only met but exceeded my expectations.  The picture is wonderful, sharp,  crystal clear.  The sound is better than the old kindle,  but not still cannot hearin moving car.  Love the blue tooth capability.  I did not know if I would like the bigger screen,  but I would not be happy with the 7" sreen.  Over all thank you,  thank you,  thank you.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: David L. Green
Reviews.Content: hight deff. is supper clean, fast to run new apps, and you just can't beat the price. batter life is about 6.5 hours if watching movies get the quick charger its a life safer.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: James Felker
Reviews.Content: It does everything we were looking for in a inexpensive tablet. Works great for social media and for the kids to play around on.  More convenient than a lap top and a lot cheaper than an I-Pad

Reviews.Title: One major disappointment
Reviews.Author: James R. Aced
Reviews.Content: Works well.  The biggest problem is that it is not Android or Apple compatible for some APPs.  I guess that I should have looked into this before I purchased.  Once there are more APPs, I will be very happy.

Reviews.Title: great tablet for the price.
Reviews.Author: nanaoftwo
Reviews.Content: We bought this for when we travel with our granddaughters and when it is just us two. It is very clear and fast. Our only problem was when we signed up for at&t; and I didn't get the 49.99 first year, I was told that I had to sign up for 2 years at 14.99 a month and other fees for start up. So your info needs to be clearer.

Reviews.Title: My Fire
Reviews.Author: pxmidnight "Phyllis"
Reviews.Content: REALLY love this! Sometimes I want to just be by myself and watch a program (netflix, HBOG), sometimes I want to play with folks I know (Scrabble, Words with Friends), sometimes I want to read (DUH!). Shoot! I can even skype on this! Love it!

Reviews.Title: Amazon Customer Service ROCKS!
Reviews.Author: R. H. Pass "photosbyrose"
Reviews.Content: after having my Kindle HD for not quite 11 mos. it seemed to have developed a 'shimmer' on dark barkgrounded pages & apps. I  used online live chat to CS and was only hoping for a recommended fix via download. what I got was an immediate replacement! no questions asked, FedExed to me in 2 days (I chatted on a Saturday evening, I had the new one Tuesday Morning). I will never hestitate to use Amazon, and I plan on renewing my Prime Membership this month.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: L. A. Coley "mrchaplaincoley"
Reviews.Content: I have used my Kindle Fire 7 almost every day for hours since I got it over a year ago. So I was happy to get this larger HD tablet because I watch Prime movies off it almost every night. My husband goes to sleep before I do and the TV light is too bright. The light the Kindle gives off is just right for me and not too bright for him. I had games for our grandsons on my smaller Kindle Fire so my memory was maxed out. The 32GB gives me so much more space to play around with plus the extra space on Cloud. Pictures are truly amazing with the HD feature. The HD with movies are so bright. I really didn't think the HD would make that much of a difference but it has. It gives a larger screen to check emails, FB and surf the web. Helps in shopping online. I'm a big Amazon fan so I've been very pleased. With the Prime membership I get free apps on my Kindles, watch free movies so what more can you ask for? I like the Skype ability. If it had a rear facing camera and a scanner app I would be perfectly happy getting rid of my laptop!

Reviews.Title: Wife and daughter love it, screen response not very good
Reviews.Author: clcntx
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter love it but I hate the the screen response.  You often have to touch the screen several times to get it to respond - sometimes with excessive force.  It helps if you zoom in on the item or word you are trying to select, but even zooming in can take 2 or 3 attempts. Downloads, image quality, browsing, etc. are all great, if they could just improve the touch screen response it would get 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: After a month, I still love it! A OK...UPDATE 10/9/13 and 2/7/14
Reviews.Author: Retired "Retired, and enjoying my free time. ...
Reviews.Content: I have used my KF nearly a month. I still love it just as much as the first day. I treat it carefully as I would any item of electronic nature. I do not use a screensaver, as for me there is no necessity. I surf the internet, A OK...I add Kindle books, A OK...I use Google Blogger app, A OK...I check Gmail, Yahoo mail,  A OK...I do nearly everything I do on my desktop PC. A OK...Battery life, about 8 hours with active use, 6 hours if watching streaming video. Still A OK...Car Charger,  I plug it in overnight,  A OK.  Doesn't drain my car battery to charge KF, A OK...Go to Starbucks, read book for two or three hours....A OK...still on free WiFi so then watch a movie, A OK....go home...Plug in KF, 3 hours later, take KF to bed with me, read a book, watch a movie, A OK....then go to sleep...Get up, wake up, Plug in KF, do my chores, a few hours later, start all over again....It's a good life, I love it, A OK....UPDATE 8/7/2013: I did get the KF HD 8.9 WITH the Ads.
