Audio and video stream flawlessly, and the HD is beautiful.Skype also works great with the new camera.The two added speakers on the back are really nice, and the new external volume button helps. I also like that you can access your favorites any time by tapping the star, and the full 360 rotation works great.As many other reviewers have noted, you have to unlock the screen for your Kindle to work with many cases. They are not backwards.Overall, I could not be more pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: An Absolute Joy to Own
Reviews.Author: BluesHawk707
Reviews.Content: There are more than 2000 reviews so I won't go into great detail but I'll share my two cents - I love it!  This Kindle Fire HD is on par with the iPad in every way.  It is easy to set up and use.  My two-year old can use it without any problem.  I have Amazon Prime and it works great with the large collection of TV shows and movies.  I am happy I bought it and strongly recommend it.  The sound and picture are terrific.  Way to go Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Nice size and features.
Reviews.Author: ashrod
Reviews.Content: for the most part it is easy to use. Unfortunately I have had some problems with it freezing up, without any way to remedy without shutting down, if it allows it.  I also think that it is odd that when you purchase the Kindle it arrives without any way to charge it, unless you purchase the charger separately and then the charger shows up a couple of days later.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: Love all things about this devise. Great to read from, watch movie or browse the web. Exceeded my expectations. Highly recommended. Clear screen with great HD.

Reviews.Title: Everything I want in a tablet
Reviews.Author: KWK
Reviews.Content: It's fast, capable, and the picture is great.  The kids love it (freetime is terrific) for games, movies, and books.  We really have enjoyed using it as a portable movie device through the HDMI to the different screens around the house with Netflix and Prime videos.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Debi Lucas
Reviews.Content: So far we have no problem whatsoever with the Kindle Fire.  We love the screen size, at our age, we need it, especially when playing some of the games and Word.  We haven't tried music, videos or the camera yet.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD review
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Jones
Reviews.Content: I love it more than I expected. Data plan is a very good deal. I have recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: The Ultimate Fire!
Reviews.Author: Sooner1906
Reviews.Content: I bought the first generation fire a couple of months after it was released, I was happy with it despite some technical glitches and issues...it served its purpose well as a media consumption device. Two months ago my wife bought me the Kindle Fire HD 8.9, and it blew me away. Every complaint that I had about the original fire was addressed, and then some. The 8.9 is great, it serves its purpose as a media consumption device but its size makes it useful for school work also (buy a good BT keyboard). Some people complain about the ads, but honestly I enjoy them, some of the advertisements are pretty cool and some of the offers are pretty good. In my opinion it is not worth $15 to disable them.Pros:-A must have for Amazon prime members-fast and powerful processing and browsing-great screen resolution-Great speakers (this was a major complaint with the original fire I can now watch NBA league pass with the speakers turned up without earphones)-Great price-Great book/movie/app selection-X-Ray (I didn't think i would use this feature at first but it is actually pretty cool. Watching movies and being able to get information and recommendations is great)-Upgraded the silk browser (I didn't love the original silk browser but this version is pretty awesome, the suggestions and bookmark tab is very useful)Free time (love this app, easy to set up and very useful for anyone who has kids)-Upgraded book and magazine experience (scrolling and page turning animations are smoother, pages look crisp and easy on the eyes).Cons:-Customization (This is really a stretch considering the fact that i actually like the UI used for the fire, but it is not a native android experience and thus not very customization)-No memory expansion (this would have taken the 8.9 from 5 stars to 7 stars. I understand why Amazon did not do it but it would have been nice)-No front facing camera or GPS (these are really minor issues, there was only one time where I could have used the front facing camera but I also have a smart phone so no real complaint)I love my Kindle fire HD I would recommend it to anyone. Amazon really stepped up their game with this product!

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 for my wife as a Christmas present.  She was always complaining that she could never get on the computer because of me!  I will not make this a long review, as others have already done so.  I will say, however, that the Kindle has exceeded all of my wife's expectations, as well as my own.  It was not difficult to set the email account up with Verizon on the Kindle.  She has enjoyed the Facebook app. and uses it daily.  She finds it very easy to surf through the Internet, and equally as easy to send and receive email.  I have had a lot of fun with Amazon Prime watching the old Western "B" movies...movies I have not seen in 50 years--Roy Rogers, Johnny Mack Brown, Gene Autry, etc.  There are an awful lot of movies offered through Amazon Prime that are free to download, and I find this feature to be most useful and a super value.  New owners of a Kindle get a free 30 day membership with Prime, and after that, it is $79 a year.  I expect full well to renew after the 30 days is up.  I did have one problem however;  for some reason I was unable to download videos after 10 days.  I called Amazon service on a weekend, and they told me they would turn it over to the technical department.  I called the next day to see the status of it, and was told it would take up to 3 business days to address my problem.  I received an email from Amazon late the same day, tried the video downloads, and yep, it is now working.  As far as the charger not included with the unit, I don't think that is a big deal.  I purchased a wall charger, cord, car charger and a nice protective leather (like) cover for under $15.00 over E-Bay which included shipping.  So, I was able to purchase the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 for $249.00 on a one day only sale, and I think this was a terrific value for the money.  Knowing what I know now, would I make the same decision?  Absolutely!  There may be better tablets out there, but for the price and the value received, I don't think you can beat the Kindle....

Reviews.Title: Complete Success!
Reviews.Author: Kris James
Reviews.Content: My husband is good with computers, but slow to adapt to new technology. Over the past few years he's slowly joined the mobile device age. Before his birthday in October, he said he wanted a tablet for a combination birthday-Christmas present, but he didn't know which one. We both did hours of research on the various options (and boy are there a lot), but in the end, there was only one obvious choice for us: the Kindle Fire HD 8.9".My husband uses it to check his fantasy sports teams while watching the games on TV, so the wi-fi version is perfect for us. Its speed is impressive, and the screen size helps him avoid the mobile versions of his favorite websites (traditionalist, isn't he?). The tablet's sensitivity is pretty awesome, too. We were playing a game app involving rolling balls and navigable mazes, and I swear, I could feel the weight of the pixel ball as it bumped around the wooden barriers.We're Amazon Prime members, as well, so the freedom to continue watching our favorite free shows and movies was a definite factor in choosing another Kindle device for our household.

Reviews.Title: good enough
Reviews.Author: av Joe
Reviews.Content: The screen is big enough to read easily.The web pages load pretty fast off the WIFI internet.Apps open and close pretty fast.That is pretty much 98% of what you want from this machine.If this is what you expect from this machine, you will be happy.This is not a laptop.

Reviews.Title: oh yes!n
Reviews.Author: gail weatherbee
Reviews.Content: did alot of research on tablets and when they say the resolution is equal to or better to the IPAD then it is.  love the APPS and the internet access.  Have already bought one for my son.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9..easy
Reviews.Author: Susan Davis
Reviews.Content: At first, I was totally overwhelmed by the Kindle when comparing it to my mother in law's IPad.  Then, I purchased an eye opening e-book that explained everything in easy to understand language.  From that day on, I am so thrilled I purchased the Kindle FIre 8.9 4G LTE instead.  Love the graphics and the sound and it's fast!!!  LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: RICK EZERSKY
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle & the Fire is the best so far. The HD resolution is awesome. The main reason I bought it is I read a lot at night and with the back lighted screen I don't have to get up and shut the light off. Also the pictures & maps are larger than on my Kindle Touch.I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: It's a Keeper
Reviews.Author: barbara cates
Reviews.Content: Love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" .  I can almost as much on it  as I can my Ipad. there a few appts that I wished it had. As far as getting on the web and surfing the net or checking my email, or Skype it is excellent

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Cat lover "Cat lover"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new Kindle. It's so much easier to turn off, No holding a switch to turn it off and it's way easier to remove unwanted books from your device or even from the carousal display.

Reviews.Title: Great product at a great price
Reviews.Author: GARY R HART
Reviews.Content: Wasn't totally convinced on purchasing this item, my son-in-law talked me into the Kindle.  Now that I have it, I love it, an awsome tool with amazing capabilities.  Don't know what I would do without it now.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Efrain V
Reviews.Content: Very cool. The wife loves it! Very user friendly. I would def recommend this product to anyone interested in purchasing a tablet.

Reviews.Title: My second Kindle
Reviews.Author: movie fan
Reviews.Content: Fantastic smooth flawless operator... but what else would you expect from Amazon after all I even buy my under ware here!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Mary Weiler
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this Kindle!! I love it and I love all the things it can do. Wish I would have purchased it sooner.

Reviews.Title: my Kindle
Reviews.Author: Cory Campbell
Reviews.Content: Love it, Love it. Awesome tablet, picture and sound are unbelieveible. I have the 32G and it is very fast, no buffering.Streaming is fast and easy. Movies are just like using your Blueray player at home.

Reviews.Title: Love The Convenience
Reviews.Author: Richard Schaefer
Reviews.Content: I've thought about getting a eBook reader for quite a while and finally opted for the Kindle. It gives me just what I wanted. I did not like the fact that within a week of my purchase Amazon offered the same item for $50 less. I felt a bit ripped off by that. That is not a problem with the Kindle, but with Amazon's marketing strategy.I would recommend a design change to put the connection ports on the side. With the Kindle in a cover, the only way to close the cover is to position the Kindle with the ports along the lower edge. This means they hit you in the stomach if you use the Kindle while lying in bed. Connections on side would solve this problem.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Landy
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet, not overpriced and not any functions or features you will never use. The Kindle does what a tablet is meant to do very well, books and video.

Reviews.Title: Novice
Reviews.Author: Ruth Pauline Green "Knitbugmouse"
Reviews.Content: This technology is very new to me. But now I can buy all the books, games etc I want with no storage problem.  I have a large stash of hard cover books taking up way too much room and want to downsize and this is a very good investment towards that.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire H D  8.9 Dolby Audio, Dual - Band  WI - Fi, 16 GB
Reviews.Author: Debra Brown
Reviews.Content: I'm really enjoying this tablet still learning how to use some of the features.So far it is everything that I need and more. I would recommend this tablet to anyone that is talking about getting one.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Monica M. Payne
Reviews.Content: Love it. I would recommond this tablet to anyone. Easy to use and has everything in it that I need. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Best gift for my wife.
Reviews.Author: Skip Reilley
Reviews.Content: My wife is a voracious reader, and years ago I had gotten her the original Kindle, which she loved. But she also loved our Android phones so much (they operate very similarly) that I finally upgraded her to the K-Fire and now she's reading several books at once. It's a brilliant machine - beautiful to look at, easy to operate, and surprisingly good battery life. I'm not as much a reader as my wife is, but I have to admit to being a little jealous not having a Kindle Fire of my own.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: David Shaak
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my husband for Christmas as he is disabled and enjoys reading.  He got quite excited at the different types of books. Very clear pictures.  On button a little hard to find at first but he now has the hang of it.  thinking of getting one for myself instead for easy of access to fb etc instead of setting up the laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great! Though takes getting used to.
Reviews.Author: Leha
Reviews.Content: First, this is not an Android tablet. This is a Kindle with most (but not all) capabilities of a typical Android tablet. Having said that, it is better than most of them. Give it some time and you will love it.

Reviews.Title: Great, but not perfect ... which is intended
Reviews.Author: K. A. Young "youngka"
Reviews.Content: My summary is that I'm very satisfied with the product, though it's not perfect.DISLIKES:It really comes down to media/content management as the biggest downer, and this is something that Amazon did on purpose.  So, yes, there is definite intent on Amazon's part to create an imperfect device.The first content managment issues is GAMES.  The Kindle has this wonderful menu bar on the top that separates Games, Apps, Videos, etc.  And, as long as you acquire your media from Amazon, it places the media in the proper location.  If, however, you're inclined to upload your own media, the Kindle will not allow you sort into the proper location.For example, I already own the Angry Birds Star Wars game.  I'm not going to buy it again, just because I've changed devices (just like I wouldn't re-purchase a song just because I upgraded an iPod).  Fortunately, it's easy to migrate media through a process called "Sideloading."  You tell the device through an easy setting that it should allow installations from non-Amazon sources.  Voila!  You can bring in those games.Unfortunately, since the game didn't originate from the Amazon store, it won't be recognized as a "Game."  It just goes into the generic "Apps" menu.  So, I end up with only half of my games in the "GAMES" menu, rendering it useless.  I only use the "APPS" menu which has all of my games, but also all of my non-Game apps.  Irritating not to be able to use the full menu structure.The lack of recognizing VIDEOS is also irritating.  Again, if you purchase a movie from Amazon, it will show up nicely in the VIDEOS menu.  If you rip a DVD and put it on your device, it will not show up.  You'll have to use a file explorer app like ES Explorer to find and open the video.  Same with home movies, so this isn't a copyright integrity issue ... it's purely a decision to cripple the device when working with non-Amazon-originating material.  Anything that did not originate from the Amazon store will be dead to the Kindle and you'll have to find a back door to locate and view it.Frustrating not to be able to go into the VIDEOS menu and look at my son's pee wee football highlights.  Nope, got to go through an explorer menu tree to do that.CAROUSEL is also annoying.  Anytime you use anything, it goes into the carousel.  Delete it from the carousel.  Use that app again and it's back there.  Just adds a bunch of clutter.  There is a separate Favorites function, but it would be nice if the carousel were a bit smarter.  In its current incarnation, it's just useless clutter.The included Cloud storage is useless, excepting the music portion (250 free song storage/stream).  Not only does it not allow anything to be streamed, but it won't even allow you to access files you store there.  Just a pointless mess.  This has been discussed ad nauseum, so I won't repeat.  Dropbox, Box, and countless other online cloud storages are much better and have good apps to use.So, the biggest disappointment is clearly the media management of this device.  Amazon intentionally crippled the device and made any non-Amazon media use/visualization very cumbersome.LIKES:Video is amazing.  Read the other reviews, but it is crisp.  1080p source material is just awesome.Sound is also crisp.  Watched the opening sequence to Expendables 2 in 1080p Blu-Ray transfer as my test for video and sound.  Wow.  As mentioned, the video was insane.  The audio was wide and expansive.  Really nice simulated surround treatment.File manipulation is easy. Things like YouTube, which are "missing" from the Amazon app store, are easily sideloaded onto the Kindle.  Putting files onto the Kindle is easy.  Using them and Kindle's native management of those files is crap, as mentioned above.Responsive touch pad.  Check out YouTube vids from back in Sept 2012, when the 8.9 Kindle Fire HD was being demoed at various shows and events.  The touch pad looked pretty clunky in those reviews -- unresponsive, unreliable.  Ouch.  Made me nervous.  Whatever those bugs were in those prototype units were apparently solved prior to shipment.Great linkage to Prime for streaming content.  Surely, it would be nicer to get more movies from this century (most are from the 80s and 90s), but there are some good titles in the mix (Thor, Transformers, Rango, e.g.).  Still don't know why it costs 5.99 for a physical DVD to be shipped to my house, e.g., but to buy an electronic-only version of the same movie costs 9.99.  I hate to be gouged, and so I haven't bought a title, yet.  Rentals at 3.99 for most newer stuff is still expensive enough to keep me a RedBox customer ... much better than the DirecTV 5.99+.Ads.  Yes, I like the ads.  I like them, because it lowers the cost.  I can choose to pay more to remove the ads, but I don't.  I love the idea of being able to choose a lower price.  People who hate the ads can choose to pay more to remove them.  What a great system!  How could you ever complain about that?  (this refers to the lock-screen ad.  The "what others bought" ads that appear below the carousel can be turned off without cost.)It's a great tablet.  I would buy again.  Amazon already figured this, which is why I expect they're fine intentionally crippling various aspects of media management.

Reviews.Title: Well Designed Jewel
Reviews.Author: F. Wallace "Will Wallace"
Reviews.Content: I love this product.  The main reason is it is much more intuitive than the iPad. It is also far more visually appealing. Kindle really understands their users, their market. I love using this product, interacting with it. It is graphically stunning with wonderful sound. It is lightweight and slim.  Silk, the browser, really surprised me, it is so well designed. My only complaint with the product is that the power on button is sometimlyes hard to find, over recessed on the side.  That said, buy this product, you won't be sorry.  Get the larger size too!

Reviews.Title: This is the greatest tablet!!
Reviews.Author: Linda C. Collins
Reviews.Content: I had the previous 7" Kindle Fire.  This 8.9" Kindle Fire HD is sooo much better.  I like how fast it comes on with the automatic cover.  The Wi-Fi is easier to get to and connection time is really fast.  Everything downloads so much faster.  And ... I really like the larger screen.  I've been recommending it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Well,,, its GREAT
Reviews.Author: Ashley Lova Dearest "Ashley"
Reviews.Content: My mommy and daddy got me one 4 new year and i really love it!!! Especally playing games and taking pictures.. Im 8 and i really enjoy rhis kindle!!! (ashley wrote this 4 mi lil sis<3) but i also enjoy it , it keeps her quiet 4 dahh whole day thank ya lawwd!!! Ohh and its NEW YEARS!!!! Happy new years guys L0L im off topic but oh well!!!!!!~

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Amy G. Divel "amyd"
Reviews.Content: This is the first tablet I have had.  It does everthing I expected it to.  Very easy to use!  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: VJAW
Reviews.Content: Keep this new Kindle at your fingertips to enjoy the massive variety of apps, color and and internet look ups.  Does not limit my curiosity.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Jane Deaton
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new Kindle Fire HD 8.9". It responds so quickly, I am able to download the books I enjoy without difficulty. I also downloaded scriptures which I used at church this past week and I was able to find chapter and verse and follow along without any problem. I am totaly impressed. I look forward to watching movies, and downloading pictures. No complaints at all. I did much research and reading of comments. Thank you for selling such a good product.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire HD
Reviews.Author: allison johnson
Reviews.Content: Well I want one of these for myself..my daughter has been on it since Christmas eve.  she loves it and soon I will have one too.  Thanks and Happy New Year

Reviews.Title: Blown Away!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Seeds of Love"
Reviews.Content: I don' t give away accolades without merit ... Amazon has surpassed my expectations with the 8.9" Fire. Received today and everything is working 100 percent. I have not had a problem with operations or functionality. Learning to setup the device and navigate from one app to the other has been smooth.

Reviews.Title: But...some issues with free time
Reviews.Author: Hattie B. Holtapp "guh"
Reviews.Content: I love this thing.  However, if your illiterate child happens to try and escape Free Time, and obviously doesn't know the pass code, he or she will probably tap the blue writing underneath, which is the friendly offer to reset the Kindle back to its factory settings.  Also--it's basically impossible to install Scrabble, for some reason.

Reviews.Title: Bought it as a gift for my husband
Reviews.Author: Marcy Ann Alexander
Reviews.Content: so far its everything the best reviews said it was......movies have a good picture and the sound is amazing....still finding things and figuring it out but so far a great buy....he gave me an iPad mini for Christmas but we use these devices for entirely different reasons and his fits him perfectly....wouldnt mind having one myself....the screen size is nice...not too big and not too small..get a case...makes holding it much easier

Reviews.Title: Fixed all my issues with First Gen Fire
Reviews.Author: Baxterlf "baxterlf"
Reviews.Content: This has surpassed my expectations. I had the first generation 7" Fire and was happy with it but it had some short comings. All of those are now fixed with this device. The screen is greatly improved. The swipe keyboard is wonderful and now has predictions. The web browser is faster and smoother. All the Amazon features are improved and work seamlessly. Everyone is blown away when they try it out. I appreciate Amazon allowing side loading of apps and it is easily done. The email is tremendously improved and now includes calendar integration built in. So glad customer feedback was listened to.

Reviews.Title: I like it a lot more than I thought I would.
Reviews.Author: Linda P.
Reviews.Content: I love the size of it, the ease of use, the number of free items that I can download and the number of applications it has.

Reviews.Title: Having a great time!
Reviews.Author: B. Tiscia
Reviews.Content: Present from  my husband. Cant put it down.  Color and screen are beautiful. I can sit in any room with it and get excellent WiFi. Love playing games on it. So much more reasonable than an Ipad .

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Treva
Reviews.Content: Love it, Love it, Love it.  Received the Kindle Fire HD from my family for a Christmas present this year and was just over joyed.  I really didn't think I would get one as I have a Kindle with the keyboard already.  But the Fire HD is fantastic so far.  Received a one month free trial of Amazon Prime and I have been taking advantage of this service and will most likely sign up for this service at the end of my trial period.  I just stick it in my purse and go.  This is the greatest invention since the light bulb.

Reviews.Title: Loved it but...
Reviews.Author: Kindryll
Reviews.Content: I had to return it. I have arthritis and it was just too big for me. However it was perfect except for that! Wonderful color apps, so easy to use right out of the box. I got the smaller size and its perfect, I never leave home without it! If you are looking for a larger tablet you can't go wrong with this, it's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: J. Rodarmel "jim"
Reviews.Content: I was never much of a reader, but I am now.  I love reading on my Kindle.  I find it hard to put down.  I've downloaded several books, and a couple of movies too!  I strongly recommend this!!

Reviews.Title: Great video quality
Reviews.Author: Luke2080
Reviews.Content: To be clear, I use a tablet for two reasons: reading books and watching movies.  Thats it.This thing is light, and the video quality is great.  Already a good addition to my laptop bag on flights.  And I can play Angry Birgs on a big screen.  So maybe three reasons I use a tablet.I plan to test out skype and some other features, and I'll update as I do.  For now, very content with its ability to let me consume content.  :-)

Reviews.Title: my hubby likes it
Reviews.Author: shielateodoro36
Reviews.Content: Got this as a Christmas gift for my hubby and he really likes it.  But, there's not a lot of cases available in the market for it so he's wary of taking it along on trips.  And I didn't order the fast charger with it, so USB charging via his laptop is a SLOW process.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Review
Reviews.Author: Vicki L.
Reviews.Content: Wow I am so busy learning all I can on the Kindle Fire and will take me some time to get it all I want it to be. I just love my Kindle reader, will have to update that soon.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Carl Riley
Reviews.Content: Love being able to read books and magazines without lugging them around. Never thought I''d say that, since I was always steadfastly against it. It'll help control my magazine collection, instead of having them all around, cluttering up the house.It's a bit slow to boot up, but otherwise, it is great!

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: Linda (the purple one)
Reviews.Content: As a reader and writer this is a great resource. Looking forward to exploring all the new options.  Reading a book electronically will be a new experience.

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift,  my husband just loves it.
Reviews.Author: pauline georgakis
Reviews.Content: The fire can do so much, stream movies, watch tv programs, besides the books.  It even shows the cover of allThe books you have read so you can find previously read books easily.

Reviews.Title: Kids love it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We bought each of our daughters (10 and 12) a Kindle Fire 8.9 HD for Christmas and they love it.  They gave my wife back her iPad and have not asked for it since.  My only complaints are: 1. The lack of a wall charger - the USB charger takes over 10 hours to charge it from a PC or MAC - way too slow, AND, 2. its lack of USB and MicroSD ports.  I know Amazon does not want to allow storage expansion to force more folks into using the Cloud, but it is still the major problem with these devices,LOTS of apps available now - my girls were able to find most of their favorite iPad games and at lower prices.

Reviews.Title: Big and Bold
Reviews.Author: Debra Miller
Reviews.Content: Very lightweight but lots of power. I love this so much more than my first Kindle fire.Crystal clear screen and vivid colors

Reviews.Title: Love my kindle fire
Reviews.Author: cindyr
Reviews.Content: I love the graphics & clear picture of it. Still learning how to use. Wish it came with a paper instruction manual, to look at while using it.

Reviews.Title: love this thing!
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: It does everything!  The display is simply amazing!  Audio is very good for a tablet as well!Only things I can knock it on are:-Not as many apps as my Android phone-My android phone also has a better cameraOverall extremely pleased though!

Reviews.Title: My 2nd kindle
Reviews.Author: Mohamed K. Alkhalifa
Reviews.Content: I used my 1 st kindle to download my favorite books but with the all new kindle fire which is a must for me

Reviews.Title: the powerfast accelerated charging accessory.
Reviews.Author: Wanda Asire
Reviews.Content: One thing I would liketo ask.  It says on a black card included: "Connect the opposite end of the USB charging cable to a Kindle Powerfast accelerated charging accessory (sold separately).  I have one for the plain Kindle I have, can I use that one?

Reviews.Title: One word, WOW!
Reviews.Author: Ralph Chapman "Tech Boy"
Reviews.Content: I will not get as techinal as others have, but I will say the speed and quality live up to all the positive reviews.  We have only had ours for a week now but love it so much.  Decided to get one when using my brother-in-law's over Thanksgiving.  Very clean design and good quality parts.  The sound is excellent  and the picture quality is increadable.  No troubles connecting with our wi-fi and downloading all the new contents, updates, and games.  Love the responce time of the touch screen and havn't had any problems with it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle HD Review
Reviews.Author: Dennis Jeff
Reviews.Content: The Kindle meets all my expections and is fun to use. The screen is very clear and bright plus the sound is very good.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: MSHusker
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD was a great purchase.  The clarity and crispness of the color is amazing which enhances my experience when reading magazines purchased on the Kindle.  The 64 GB storage will support my book and magazine habit for a long time.  The 4G connection works great and you cannot beat the price.  I did find it a little confusing to get the wireless started but there are several good user's guides out there for $2.99 or less - Some are free with Amazon Prime.  The touch screen still smears up on a regular basis, so I wipe it down with cloth regularly - a small inconvenience to deal with for such a great product.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Suezy Smith
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my husband for Christmas.  He is not a computer person but loves the Kindle.  He will like it even better when you plays games on it.

Reviews.Title: My Mom Loves It!
Reviews.Author: Shannon M.
Reviews.Content: I got this as a Christmas gift for my Mom, who is not computer savvy at all.  She has figured out how to use it with ease & loves it!  She kept telling me she wouldn't like one, but I knew she would if she'd take the time to play around w/ it & I was right.I only bought the 16 GB model & was worried about how quick she'd fill it up.  So far, she's downloaded several books & has only used about 13 MB of space on the Kindle - this also includes a few apps that I downloaded for her.My parents have an unsecured wifi connection set up at their house & it connected w/ ease, no issues what-so-ever, as it did at my house w/ a secured connection.With that being said, I personally have the iPad 3.  As far as I'm concerned I wouldn't trade my iPad for a Kindle... ever! (Hence the 4 * rating.)  I feel like my iPad is much more responsive (screen, touch) & faster (wifi) & way more apps available.  I have the Kindle app on my iPad also, so I'm still able to download & read books if I want.  The Kindle Fire is, obviously, geared more towards avid readers, which I am not.  So, if you're a reader, I think you'll love the Kindle Fire HD, but if you want to be able to do a lot more on a tablet (& can afford it), I would recommend the iPad.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire!! Color and lighting is great
Reviews.Author: patriot
Reviews.Content: I had the original kindle to read my books on. The kindle fire has a light built in, so I dont have to attach a light to read in the dark. To be able to search the internet. I Like the carousel feature. The colors are very vivid. I haven't watched movies on it, yet but Im basically a reader, thats what I bought it for.

Reviews.Title: loving it
Reviews.Author: lonnabuy
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my husband.  So far so good.  He is enjoying it. blah blah blah blah blah

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice
Reviews.Author: Jim Watts
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect tablet for an older user who has never used a computer before.  It is ready to use right out of the box and easy to learn to use.  The carousel on the home screen and favorites are excellent for ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a great product.  Easy to use and fast downloads.  Easy to learn how to get APPs and watch movies, read books.

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Michael Goudy
Reviews.Content: I love the size of the Kindle Fire HD.  The color is great.The sound is awesome.  It's really like stereo speakers.The only problem I have is that I can't stay connected to mywifi connection sometimes.

Reviews.Title: awsome
Reviews.Author: frances
Reviews.Content: I love the larger screen now the kindle is the right size. adding the camera was great, make it a better one please. give it a port so i can use my wireless card. not every place has wifi. the picture quality is great, more apps please.The draw-back is all the advertizments !!! When I want to buy something I will go to the store !! Stop taking up my screen space with junk I do not want !! I paid for my device and should not have to share it with a bunch of adds.  These few things would make it purrrrfect.

Reviews.Title: OMG -- I love it!!
Reviews.Author: kwenbee13
Reviews.Content: Waited months and months for it to come out -- and was so happy when it arrived!!You'll definitely want to buy the 'quick charge' accessory -- as charging through the PC USB port takes FOREVER!!!Great color, easy to navigate.Haven't had a lot of time to play around on it, or watch any shows or movies -- but the color is sharp and I"m sure they will be great once I have enough spare time to sit and watch a movie!Get one!!

Reviews.Title: Would recommend
Reviews.Author: kelly block
Reviews.Content: Beautiful display and super easy to use. My sister who is awful at computers loves it so far. Only down side is make sure to buy the wall charger since it does not come with one.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: I love it...It's amazing!!!!  I enjoy that I can read a book, watch a movie, listen to music or Skype on this model.  However, it would've been nice to have an instruction booklet for this product.  I still don't understand all the functions of my Kindle Fire after using it for a month.

Reviews.Title: This is a great tablet, I have iPads and Samsung tablets also
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This a  great tablet for the price, especially with the $50 for 4g per year.the only thing I am waiting for is for some of the apps I would like to have work better but that will come eventually, especially the native mail app could use updating.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this kindle for my wife for Christmas.  She hasn't put it down, yet.  She's doing something with it with all of her waking hours.

Reviews.Title: I love it!!
Reviews.Author: E. M. Steele "ernbone"
Reviews.Content: My Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is everything I expected and more...I purchased it to be able to watch movies, do email, play games and especially read...We travel fairly often and I was tired of lugging my laptop and wanted something to answer business email but not do work on...The first movie I watched was 'Casablanca' and it was incredibly sharp...The keypad is large and because I have fat fingers I use a stylus which is not a problem at all...It was this or the iPad...I have friends with iPads and asked them the pros and cons...The wi-fi capability was the deciding factor for me...I also purchased the leather case for it with the magnetic closure which automatically puts it to sleep...Quality product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The picture quality if absolutely great!! It is way better than my second generation ipad, and for the price, you cannot go wrong. I would definitely buy another kindle over an ipad in the future.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: Perfect for me.  Learning more each day of its capabilities.  Images are nice and sharp, everything is working as perscribed.  Having lots of fun with it.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire 8.9
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Ryan "kindle lover"
Reviews.Content: I love it. This is my 4th kindle. I have purchased several as gifts. The new kindle 8.9 is great. I like the larger size and the dound is great. I am so glad I "upgraded"!

Reviews.Title: great to use
Reviews.Author: George M. Stephens
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire is easy to understand, easy to use, and easy to read. Already had a kindle tablet and enjoyed it, but this is a great improvement.

Reviews.Title: The good and the bad
Reviews.Author: M. Stjames "Crow Passion"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD 4G LTE model because I thought it would be able to pick up the ATT signal at least as well as my iPhone 5.  Well, it doesn't.  So I'm kinda wishing I had gone with the less expensive wifi version alone.  It was only when I switched out my Comcast internet modum for a newer model which had wifi that I was able to get connected.No denying the HD provides dazzling picture quality.  And I do love my Kindle.  But it's really easy to buy too much stuff to download.  If you don't have iron self-control, stay away from the Kindle.Would I buy it again - Yes, but not the 4G LTE wireless version.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: E. Allgood "allgoodart"
Reviews.Content: Only had it for three days now and it is great improvement over my previous kindle that I loved alot until I got this one.  The screen size is perfect for us upper middle-aged people.  Be sure to get a touch pen, the power fast charger and a case to make the use of it super easy.

Reviews.Title: great kindle
Reviews.Author: Blair W. Williams
Reviews.Content: After recently buying my wife the Kindle 7hd, I was unable to use it.  It was in constant use.  So I upgraded to the 8.9.  Both are fantastic tablets.  The only complaint that I have, is that Kindles do not have an instruction manual.  Inclusion of one would make sense and clear up a lot of confusion and frustrations.  Nonetheless, I have no complaints about either Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Judi
Reviews.Content: I received this Kindle Fire for Christmas.  The previous Christmas I received a regular kindle.  I thought that was great, but having it in color is just great.  Also, for reading since it is backlit, I don't need a light.  I enjoy playing games on this since my prior Kindle was black/white.  I like the larger screen and if you can afford it, I would highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Overall a Great Product
Reviews.Author: Shirley McLain
Reviews.Content: I have been using my Fire a couple of months now. I have really enjoyed it. It is easy to use and the colors are bright and clear. I gave it four stars because of one feature and that is the on and off switch. It has been difficult for me to locate it. I end up turning the reader around and around trying to locate that little button. I would not hesitate to purchase it again but the on and off switch needs improvement.

Reviews.Title: bluetooth
Reviews.Author: teddy
Reviews.Content: i see that kindle fire supports bluetooth - instead of using the touch keypad, simply purchase a bluetooth keyboard - microsoft makes a gorgeous mini that comes with a cover that acts as a stand for a tablet!

Reviews.Title: It is a neat device
Reviews.Author: robertfetter
Reviews.Content: The only thing additional I would like is a remote shell to access from my other computer. Android is a lot like Linux, so I would expect that.

Reviews.Title: Better than carrying a laptop around!
Reviews.Author: S. McPike
Reviews.Content: Functional device for those interested in staying connected.  Large screen and easy access.  This one is a must for anyone who appreciates something larger and easy to operate.  Kindle's reputation is an assurance to quality.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire 8.9"
Reviews.Author: wendyh
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire, I have always loved reading and gaming on my old kindle but being able to watch movies and tv shows is really great too. Picture quality is fantastic, sound is great and I am learning more fun things to do with it everyday.

Reviews.Title: The best money I ever spent
Reviews.Author: t bear
Reviews.Content: I searched and researched so many different products before purchasing the Kindle Fire 8.9" HD model. For the short period of time that I have had it, I keep  finding more and more uses, things,apps and all around really neat things this Fire can do. I was a little leary of buying this, even though I have had an older model Kindle reader with apx. 160 books on it and have never had any issue of function of this product. When I received this unit I carefully unpacked and fired it up. I was so impressed with the functions, HD colors and just general feel of this product, that my main response was, WHY DID I WAIT THIS LONG TO BUY THIS UNIT! I know I have really only scratched the surface of the functions of this and can't wait to discover all.One point that I have to share is that I am a retired Law Enforcement Officer and have gone on to getting my NRA and State certification for firearm instruction. As such I haveto haul around a large laptop case and a digital projection case as well as a large rolling box with a number of firearms for demonstrative purposes. As Iget older this becomes a rather difficult venture. With the Kindle Fire HD, I was able to download the NRA program onto the Kindle and using the proper cable, etc. I now can leave my laptop at home, thereby reducing that weight, my next step is to purchase a hand held projecter, available from Amazon, and further reduce the amount of equiptment. I now can load up and go to locations and use my energy to teaching my students all the proper instruction in safely using, care and feeding of same. Point is, without the Kindle Fire HD, I would properly reduce the number of classes that I perform. Without any doubt, if the reader is thinking of purchasing any other tablet, Ipad or others take a good long look at the 8.9" Kindle and I am sure that this will meet most, if not all. In closing, I want to say Thank you Amazon for your innovations.

Reviews.Title: Great Notebook
Reviews.Author: Samuel Mudrak
Reviews.Content: I really like it for reading books as well as reading some of my onlne magazine subscriptions.I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: HD 8.9" Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Dolores G. Keshner "book worm"
Reviews.Content: Love it, just the right size. The colores are bright, it's fast when looking up stuff on the Internet; just love it.

Reviews.Title: Nice, nice
Reviews.Author: kamarce
Reviews.Content: I waited a long time to decide what I wanted to get.  Either a replacement lap top (newer, faster, lighter) or the smaller media devices.  Since Kindle has good reputation, quality, and support, I took the step with Kindle Fire.  So far so good.  Baby boomer me, with no smart device experience, is enjoying the journey of this new technology.  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: loranda haywood
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet, its better than Ipad 3, the HD movies and tv shows are a perfect picture, it's like i'm watching it at a theater, I love all of my apps. My husband bought me this for christmas after he seen how good it works now he wants one.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Estela M. Diaz
Reviews.Content: I tested it out then wrapped it for Christmas for my son.  Loved it!  I have the original black and white basic and the Kindle Fire; both have been the most reliable e-reader I have ever had.  I compared the capabilities with other similar HD tablets and this was the best for the money.  Why pay much more for similar tablets..Got it sooner than expected.  Great customer service!!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Judy Vasser
Reviews.Content: I have 3 Kindles.. not the original Kindle, but the one after it with 3g and internet access.  Then I ran on to one at Target for $65 that I purchased for my grandaughter without the 3g or whatever.  Then they came out with the Kindle Fire HD and I ordered it.  We have downloaded movies from Amazon and the grandaughter loves that she can watch her movies in the car.  Love it..

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Clgood
Reviews.Content: I love this Kindle.  I have watched HD TV shows on it.  Downloaded lots of books and some apps.  I'm still figuring out a few things, but all-in-all it is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: kindle
Reviews.Author: louhoy58
Reviews.Content: it is amazing love being able to search anything and relaxing in my chair thanks hubby for a wonderful gift

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Lauren Fairfield
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of kindle and bought one a few years ago.. the kindle fire is way awesome,. I love that it is in color..

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Michael Russell
Reviews.Content: Its everything that I hoped it would be, right size, easy to use and has a great HD picture. PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: I Think This is Great!
Reviews.Author: D. Knight "Dee Dee"
Reviews.Content: This replaces last year's Kindle Fire and I enjoy this one so much more. The main reason is the larger display - it's just easier for me to see. But it is also easier to use. I didn't realize that at first, it takes a little while to get used to the changes in the user interface even though they are minor. When you do get used to them you realize it really is easier to use.If you are getting this and are also looking for a great case, I recommend this one: Marware Revolve Portrait and Landscape Standing Case. This is the one I have and I think it is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Neville T. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire HD. my only problem is that I can not purchase anything from the Amazon Apps Store, when I am out of the USA. Apart from that. Great Tablet

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: RUBY BERRY
Reviews.Content: This is a nice tablet but the camera feature is too awkward to use. I like the size 8.9 makes it easy to view movies and web content.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is nice for my wife
Reviews.Author: Wayne Bradbury
Reviews.Content: My wife likes the Kindle Fire HD, but she hasn't figured  out how to load music or most of her pictures to it since it is registered under my sign-on and my music and her music have different play lists and different favorite singers in them. The Amazon Cloud seems to be pretty trickie to upload songs onto because it can only be under my Amazon Account.She does like playing Scramble and Words with Friends on the Kindle Fire instead of on her Android phone because it is always freezing up in the middle of a game and the Kindle Fire doesn't do that.  She likes reading on it a little better than on her old 7" Kindle too.

Reviews.Title: just right for what I'm using it for
Reviews.Author: Avery L. Hasty
Reviews.Content: I use my kindle fire for emails and checking on amazon orders.I found it much easyer to carry and operate than my laptop.I can be done by the time the laptop fires up.It also works with my skype account.

Reviews.Title: You Get What You Pay For - Kindle Fire died and so has my faith in Amazon
Reviews.Author: FranTodd
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews thoroughly before buying.  Our Kindle Fire froze on the boot screen just four months after the one year warranty expired and all Amazon could do is offer us a refurbished Kindle for half the price of a new one if I return the old one.  If you read the reviews this is a repetitive problem for Amazon and they are probably making money hand over fist on the refurbished units.  I love saving money, but when Amazon advertises the cost of a Kindle being much lower than an iPad, you have to factor in the cost of replacement.  I've had an iPad for many years with no problems whatsoever.  Granted, I dislike Apple's OS, but the unit hasn't died on me.Amazon refused to replace my unit, even with a refurbished Kindle, to save face with a customer who has given them business since the day they started.  I'm also done with Amazon.

Reviews.Title: you get what you paid for and a lot less than you expected
Reviews.Author: Andrew Edmundson
Reviews.Content: Since the only thing that Amazon seems to be able to dream up in their marketing is that kindle fire has a lower price than other competing products it should be no surprise that it is an inferior product. It is a mediocore performer as a reader and Silk is a joke. Constantly crashing with even the simplest browsing.Amazon should be embarassed by quality and performance of their product and even after a few years of many complaints  from users offered no update to improve Silk.Over a year of frustrating attempts to use my Kindle Fire and still Disappointed .

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Tere
Reviews.Content: I've had people come and ask me what I have.  Can you say green?  People who have other mini-laptops are so green!  I feel sorry for them.  The HD is crisp, the audio is great -- even without headphones that I recommend be used to get the full enjoyment.  As I am a member of Prime, I can tell you watching movies on this is just an incredible experience (especially when husband is asleep next to you and you wear headphones!) and I love it.The ONLY problem I have is wi-fi just SUCKS up the battery charge.  I haven't bought the FAST battery charger yet -- next payday -- but you'll want one.  And probably a keyboard, if you prefer to type rather than using a stylus.  I use this to take notes in class, and it is wonderful!  (See my review of the HP wireless printer, the HP 8600 Premium Pro -- I can print my notes right from my Kindle!)I thought about the HDX, but heard the rear camera wasn't all that great, I can't advise to that.  The special ads I've already learned to overlook them; they aren't that intrusive.  When I bought my model, it wasn't available without the ads, so I just got it. I'm not sorry I saved the money, LOL.  There are more apps than you'll ever need (be careful to read ALL the reviews and take heed as I've bought a few that just don't work!).  If you don't need the rear camera or the "Mayday" key (I don't) then buy this.  Also highly recommended is the extra two year warranty plan.

Reviews.Title: We were lied to and misled
Reviews.Author: B. K. Wallen
Reviews.Content: The kindle is not a bad book reader. Having said that however, anyone with children BEWARE!  First, the default is one click purchasing.  This will usually cost you around $50 if you catch it quick enough.  Much, MUCH more if you don't.  No kid can resist instant gratification with a single click, consequences down the road.  GAMERS BEWARE!  Most free games have many, many add-ons available for PURCHASE (think 'one click' ease).  Recently our device completely reset itself (Amazon blames us). Guess what happens to every purchase (other than books) ever made.  THEY COMPLETELY DISAPPEAR!!  No problem, you purchased these via Amazon one click so they can be restored. Right?  WRONG.  Amazon advised they keep none of this.  Try going to each individual 'developer' of these apps to try to restore your purchases.  We are not sure how to figure out exactly who each developer is as the purchases are listed simply as 'Cuddly Puppy' and such.  No developer info is given and we are not sure which game each add on goes with or how the developer will be able to go back through amazon and provide this for us.  Will their customer service be like amazon's?  Hope not.  No more add on game purchases and NO MORE KINDLES for us.  We are extremely disappointed in Amazons business model for the Kindle.  Apparently it is just an income producing shopping conduit for Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Very disatisfied customer!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Art Liberatore
Reviews.Content: Total BS, you pay close to $300.00 for the equipment  to get, and it comes with a cord and no plug.  If that's a way of doing business, trying to squeeze even more money out a consumer then I want no parts of any anything this company sells.  If I could of given no stars, I would have.  I will tell all my friends and family about this and recommend they go else where!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Donna Lynch
Reviews.Content: I am a faithful Kindle owner, also have several friends I have encouraged to buy a Kindle, so it pains me to say I am disappointed with this purchase. I bought this as a Christmas present for myself. I went with the bigger size, but opted for just the HD because of the price.First off, the larger size makes it hard for me to hold in the palm of my hand (and I have big hands, really).It's really, really, really HEAVY!!!  I knew it weighed more than the HDX (kinda wonder why that is?), but figured it couldn't be THAT heavy...it is.I didn't buy the charger plug, thinking I had just bought a new one and it should work...wrong.  So, I am forking out another $20 to buy the plug, based on reviews I've seen here. Wondering why this wasn't included without the full charger.  Like buying a car without a gas tank.It takes FOREVER to charge, and on top of that it no way stays charged for 10 hours, more like 4.Now I know why I saved $70 on this purchase. Amazon is trying to get rid of this lemon of a tablet.Extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: I'm disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Jacquelyn Briggs "carb queen"
Reviews.Content: It freezes constantly and I have to restart.  Also, it doesn't support  flash, which I had on the original 7" Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE Kindles......when they work
Reviews.Author: Motherskiss "PROUD AMAZON ADDICT"
Reviews.Content: I have had 4 Kindles. The first time I received the Kindle Fire (1st gen) I knew the charging design was flawed. Sure enough not 6 months later...charging problems. by that time the 2nd gen was born. I was hopeful all would be well. Nope charging problems. So I am sitting here having gone almost two weeks without my Kindle. I requested a replacement the moment the screen flashed out never to turn on again. That was almost two weeks ago. I have been calling Amazon everyday since. Finally yesterday they agreed my replacement should have been here by now, so they sent out another. Hopefully it wont take a week to get here. i had to actually pick up a paper book to read. Made my earth footprint just a little bigger.

Reviews.Title: Love this Kindle!!!
Reviews.Author: Jorge Salinas
Reviews.Content: I had bought my wife a kindle fire before.  She loved it very much and got great use out of it.  I had no idea what to buy her for her birthday and saw this advertised on your website.  After a little bit of research, I found this would be an ideal gift for her.  At first she was taken back by it being much larger than her other Kindle, but she quickly adapted.  I hardly see my wife anymore, to be honest.  She is lost in the world of kindle.  :)

Reviews.Title: wifi connectin issues.
Reviews.Author: barry massey
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire hd and all you can do with it...except for the wifi issue. The device will not stay connected to the wifi. I have to go in and turn off wifi and then turn back on every time I use it. Otherwise it is a great product.

Reviews.Title: Personally, it works for me
Reviews.Author: L. Semmel
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 16G for roughly 3-4 months. I originally did not want a tablet; I already had a Kindle 3G (which I love) and a smart phone (which I hate) and my desktop computer for internet when I needed to do something online. I have been pleasantly surprised. I am not technologically dumb, or especially tech-savy, but contrary to many reviews I read I found the Fire to be pretty easy to use. Maybe because I took time to figure it out and had no preconceived notions or expectations? I don't know.Short versioin: Do I like it? Yes! Could I live without it? Yes. Are there things I would change? Of course. But I like it! :DLong version:-Physical features. Heavier than I expected, but manageable. Occasionally I turn it off without meaning to, usually when I'm trying to adjust the volume and hit power instead. I wish the power button lit up when plugged in to let you know if it was fully charged or charging. Its kind of wierd that the speakers are on the back of the device; the sound can either be amplified or dampened depending on where and how you have it sitting. It does not come with a charger, only a USB cord, which I think is stupid, but since I already had one from my Kindle 3G it wasnt as big a deal as it would have been. It does charge a little slower than I expected, and the battery only lasts about 8-10 hours, less if you're playing a game.-Readablilty. I like that I can adjust the screen brightness for interior light. BUT the screen glares horribly outside, even in the shade. If I know I'm going to be outside, I take my Kindle 3G instead. Otherwise, I have no problems.-Ease of use. I don't know how other tablets are set up, since this is my first, but I find it fairly easy. The carousel holds all of the content you have accessed recently so you can scroll through and find what you want. There are also tabs at the top marked games, books, apps, etc so that you can search by media type. There is a search bar above that, but I haven't used it at all so can't say whether or not it's good. When away from the home page, a bar at the bottom offers home, back, search, and favorite buttons. You drag down the top bar for settings, which is where you go for parental controls, applications, security, etc. Books in the carousel tell you the percentage you've read at the top corner, but I do wish I could sort my books into "read", "new", etc, like the regular Kindles. Overall, I think it's pretty simple.-Preloaded content. The HD comes preloaded with a few things I find helpful, such as Skype, Facebook, Pandora, and an email management program that allows me access to multiple email accounts from one location, which I really like. It also comes with Kindle Free Time (which my kids are mostly too old for), OfficeSuite (which I'm still trying to figure out if I even need) and IMDB (which for me is a waste of space). You cannot remove these from the device. Why must this stuff take up space if I am not going to use it, EVER? They are not necessary, so why are they there? That's that much more space I could have for books! But then again, they only bug me when I notice them, which is not very often.-Silk browser/WiFi. I had a bit of trouble connecting to the internet at first, but a 15-20 minute phone conversation with tech support got the problem (my router, not the Kindle) sorted out. I have taken my Kindle all over and had no problems with the WiFi anywhere that has a signal, even a low one. Even out in the boonies. Silk browser works fine for me, have no problems with speed unless my internet service is being wonky. It comes with Bing.com as the default search engine, but you can change this in the settings. Absolutely love that I can use it for recipes without having to drag the laptop to my tiny kitchen!-Movie/sound quality. I have only watched YouTube and FB videos so far, so no movie opinions yet. YT and FB seem to be fine, relative to the quality uploaded to the site. Sound is better than my laptop, not as good as my iPod. Again, wierd that the speakers are on the bottom.-Camera. I dislike that the camera only faces one way. To take pics of something other than yourself, you have to turn it and look at a wierd angle. Pic quality was not great, either, but that might have been operator error.-Shopping. The Fire HD has two quick-links to Amazon shopping; the "Shop" tab at the top, and the "Shop Amazon" widget in the carousel. My biggest complaint is that when shopping for books and apps the page is a little hard to navigate. In all fairness, I'm comparing the "computer store" to the "tablet store", but it seems that some categories available on the computer are not available on the tablet. I can still find what I'm looking for, but it takes longer, especially if just browsing.-The ads. A lot of people have a problem with the preloaded ads on the Kindle. If an ad doesn't interest me, I don't pay it any attention, just like tv. The recommendations at the bottom of the carousel also don't bother me, and if they do, I can turn it off. If you think they will bother you, then either get the more expensive one with no preloaded ads, or pay the $15 or whatever to have them removed.

Reviews.Title: Changes made from the original, not good changes!
Reviews.Author: Jeramie Coffelt
Reviews.Content: A couple of things, first Flash is NO LONGER SUPPORTED.  They use their own version but it doesnt work worth a dang and you have to do some work around to get flash player to work (Download Dolphin Browser).Also, the touchscreen doesnt seem to work worth a dang.  Perhaps its mine alone but honestly, it is slow to react pretty often.

Reviews.Title: The icons won't stay where I put them, and the Amazon Cloud sometimes goes missing!
Reviews.Author: Merrall G.
Reviews.Content: I've got an iPad (4th-generation), a Kindle Keyboard, a Kindle Paperwhite, and this Kindle Fire HD 8.9" In addition, I've got the Kindle App on my iPad. Of them all, I like the Kindle App on my iPad the best (because it allows outside content to be saved on it, ie not only from Amazon). Apart from that, I like, or dislike, each of the Kindles for different reasons.Since this review is about the Kindle Fire HD 8.9", I'll just refer to the others where it's relevant.Bear in mind that I'm 72, and I'm Australian (with an Australian billing address), and I'm currently in South Korea (where I'll be for a while). Those three pieces of information are relevant to what I have to say.KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9"When I bought my Kindle Fire HD, I was actually on a trip to America. Naively, I thought that - having bought the Kindle Fire HD in America (although using my Australian billing address), I'd be able to download movies, for watching while I'm traveling around (which I do a lot). Moreover, I thought I would be able to join Amazon Prime, and have access to all the thousands of movies, and TV programs, that Prime members can download - just for their $79-per-year subscription. Also, I expected that I'd be able to get access to individual songs, as MP3 downloads.However, despite the fact that, as soon as I got my Kindle Fire HD, I was sent an e-mail from Amazon, telling me all the wonderful things I'd get as a Prime subscriber (including free 2-day shipping) - and giving me a one-month trial to boot - I could not, in fact, be a Prime member.  As soon as I tried to activate Prime, I was told that I was geographically restricted - couldn't even get one-track MP3 downloads. It seems that - to get into the Prime deal - one must have a US billing address, and a US home address.So that was a big disappointment. I was initially so miffed that I thought I'd return the Kindle Fire HD to Amazon, especially since I was still in the US at the time I found I would be subject to geographic restriction. But I kept the Kindle Fire HD because I realized that it was better for a few other functions, than either the Kindle Keyboard, or the Paperwhite.PLUS FACTORS for the Kindle Fire HD 8.9"1) AUDIOBOOKSIt seems that audiobooks don't have geographic restrictions, as movies, TV programs, and music have. So I've bought several audiobooks and, although the speakers aren't really powerful, they are powerful enough, if you are sitting in a quiet room, to hear the book reading very clearly. In addition, it's possible to use a bluetooth speaker, to get louder sound if it's wanted. Since I majored in English Literature - many years ago! - I'm on a mission to listen my way through all of the classics of the English language (which is so much more relaxing, via listening, than doing all that eye-wearing reading, with a hard-to-hold paperback that won't stay open at the pages you want it to). For example, I've just finished listening to "The Great Gatsby" and that was easy listening - except that the reader, Jake Gyllenhaal, wasn't able to project any sort of vocal personality for the all-important females - Daisy in particular. Just listening to Jake Gyllanhaal's effort to "find" a voice for Daisy (unsuccessfully) left me feeling there'd be no way that a listener/reader (who didn't already know the book well) could believe in Gatsby's obsession with a Daisy that the wish-washy unnoticeable voice personality that Jake Gyllenhaal's narration assigned to her.Given that it would surely not be easy for a man to render the voice of a young, upper-class, beautiful temptress, with any subtlety or authenticity, I think Audible should use cheaper unknown actors, so the budget could stretch to both a male and female narrator. What Audible seems to be doing is trying to tempt buyers by hiring big-name actors to do the narration. If Jake Gyllenhaal's no-impact rendition of Daisy is an example of the worth of using famous actors, it's a strategy that could backfire.2) MUSIC VIA THE AMAZON CLOUDAlthough I can't get single-track MP3 downloads, I can get instant music to the Kindle Fire HD, if I buy CDs (with AutoRip). As soon as you pay for those CDs - to be delivered to somewhere (anywhere for CDs - expensive shipping to Korea or Australia, but cheap to a friend in America, especially with free shipping for an order over $25), all of the songs are automatically delivered to your Kindle Fire HD (as well as to your PC, Kindle App, etc.) So I'm very happy with that - I've now got about 17 albums loaded up: everything from Vera Lynn and Frank Sinatra to Jackie Evancho and Josh Groban. As I write now, on my PC, I have "David Foster: Hit Man and Friends" playing in the background (on the Kindle Fire) - a bit away from me, rather than blasting out of the PC in front of me, to distract me.3) GADGET/SOFTWARE INSTRUCTION BOOKS (IN KINDLE FORMAT)Amazon has zillions of instruction books for IT gadgets and software programs: Kindle Fire HD itself, iPad, Android, Dropbox, Evernote, etc. For those sorts of instruction books - which have colored pictures, and screenshots, it's useless trying to learn from them, on a Kindle Keyboard, or Kindle Paperwhite: the pictures, tables, and screenshots don't translate well into black and white format, and the screens are too small to be able to get  "pageful" of text and graphics at the same time. I've never used a Kindle Fire 7", but I'd expect that Kindle to also have a screen which is be too small for these kinds of instructions book. But the screen size of the Kindle Fire HD is perfect for showing pretty much the information (plus graphics) that would fit on the page of a real book - or on the iPad screen.A second advantage of having those gadget/software instruction books on the Kindle Fire HD is that you can keep the "pages" open on the Kindle Fire while you are trying out operations and techniques on, for example, the Kindle App on the iPad, or on the iPad itself. So it's really like having a book beside you.A third advantage is that, if you had those instruction books on an iPad, (for using as a reference book "beside" you, while you learn on another gadget), too much of the iPad charge is being used up to keep the books "open" for long periods of time. (It seems that the iPad gobbles up power a lot faster than the Kindle Fire HD does.) So, if you keep the iPad on its default auto-off setting (2 mins), to save the charge, it keeps turning itself off - unless you are actually touching the screen. The Kindle Fire HD stays "on" better, because there's not such a risk of running out of power too soon, if you leave it set at a higher time period for auto-off (such as 30 mins). Of course, it's possible to set both gadgets to "Never" to keep them on all the time you want that "reference book" open beside you - and I did that once, with the iPad. But I forgot to put it back to "2 mins" when I'd finished. So the iPad stayed on "forever" - presumably keeping a sensor fully employed, checking for Wifi hotspots wherever I went (even though it wouldn't have found many that I could connect to, since I don't have a cell-phone with a Wifi hotspot). The result was that, the next time I went to use the iPad - thinking it was still well charged - it was stone dead! Well, the Kindle Fire HD doesn't run out of charge as fast as the iPad, so it seems safe to leave it set on something like 30 minutes (auto-off) all the time - although it would probably be a good idea to set it back to 5 minutes, when finished using it.4)GOOD FONT/BACKGROUND COLOR OPTION FOR GLARE-SENSITIVE EYESI have eyes that are very sensitive to glare - white glare from screens, and glossy surfaces. The Kindle Fire HD, unfortunately, has a very glossy screen (compared to the Kindle Keyboard, and Kindle Paperwhite). But I've found a very good way to deal with that glare, such that I can comfortably read from the Kindle Fire HD screen. You can choose your default screen colours - with three options: black font on white background; black font on off-white (sort of like the Kindle Keyboard buff color), and white font on black background. I find that, even with the Kindle Fire HD's glossy screen, I can read very comfortably with that white lettering on a black background. It's a great way to reduce all the glare we get from white screens.NEGATIVE FACTORS for the Kindle Fire HD 8.9"1. GEOGRAPHIC RESTRICTION FOR MOVIES, TV PROGRAMS, MP3 MUSIC DOWNLOADS, AND PRIMEOne big negative, for me, was outlined above: with an Australian bill-paying account, I can't download movies, TV programs, or MP3 music tracks - or be a member of Amazon Prime (although on my account screen, I keep getting messages that inform me I should join Prime, to reduce the shipping charges that I'm incurring - to Korea,mostly, and that's definitely not a free 2-day deal).2. KINDLE KEYBOARD AND KINDLE PAPERWHITE BETTER FOR READING LONG BOOKSDespite being able to set the screen for white lettering on a black background, it's nowhere near as comfortable to read lengthy books (such as novels) on the glossy KINDLE FIRE HD screen - and it's quite a bit heavier to hold up. For general book reading, I actually prefer the Kindle Keyboard best of all - with the e-ink off-white background that's not so glary, although it's handy to have back-lighting on the Paperwhite for reading at night, on airplanes.3. CAN'T PLACE YOUR ITEM ICONS WHERE YOU WANT TO PUT THEM, AND MAKE THEM STAY THERE!If you've got a lot of books loaded on to the Kindle Fire HD (and this is also relevant for the iPad Kindle App), you can't make them stay on the Home screen, in some order that suits you. It always happens that, as soon as you access one book, it comes to the top of the heap (so to speak), and so you've lost your grouping of similar kinds of books. In my case, I've got a bunch of RV books, many Instruction books for gadgets, various Travel guides, and Novels, etc. So it annoys the hell out of me when I've gone to the trouble to have all similar books "sitting" arranged beside each other, on the Home screen display. Then, as soon as I access one book, that book comes to the top of the display (or the beginning of the display), and will then end up mixed up with other books that are not in a similar category.Now, compare this with iBooks, on the iPad - which is excellent from this point of view.When you save a book for reading in iBooks, you can hold your finger on the book (or pdf) icon, and then move the icon to wherever you want it to be, in your collection. Subsequently, having placed each icon where you want it to be, it stays there - such that, every time you access that book (or pdf), or any other, the items go back "to bed" at the place on the "bookrack" where you put them. Not only does that allow you to keep all your collections grouped together, but it also facilitates developing a visual memory of where particular books or pdf files are, on the bookshelf - very useful if you've got a large collection of pdf files, and they all look pretty much alike, until you bring them up on to the reading screen where you can read the "cover" print more easily.This feature (or non-feature) is particularly a pain (on the Kindle iPad app), with Lonely Planet pdf files of their guidebooks. Lonely Planet has a few guidebooks as single-file pdf files. But, mostly, they supply the books as a bunch of separate chapters (like mini-books)- without an overall single-file pdf for the books that you've bought. So, just imagine what a mess you can get into with all those individual chapters - especially since the topics of the individual chapters can't easily be read until you bring them up fully on the screen. In addition, for almost all of the guidebooks that come in chapter bundles, the background colors are the same. Each country group of chapters has a unique picture on the cover of every chapter in the collection, but the pictures are small and you can't really see them until you bring a book (a chapter mini-book) up for reading.Consequently, you get a really messy situation because of Kindles (for the iPad app, or stand-alone Kindles)not allowing you to place your books, in the display, where you want them - and where they will return to after use. For instance, if I bring up a chapter of "Nicaragua" (out of perhaps 13 chapters), and then I bring up a chapter of "Columbia", and then one of "Bolivia" and also "Peru" - all of which I've got on my iPad (saved in both the Kindle App, and iBooks) - I end up with all of the chapters totally scrambled in the filing system; that occurs because no one chapter goes back to "its place" among the other chapters for the guidebook that it belongs to.So I have to use up more of my iPad's memory than I'd like, by saving all those chapter pdf files into both places: in iBooks, to keep the chapters where I want them to be "filed"; in the Kindle App, so I can access the contents page, touch on a topic in the contents, and get taken immediately wherever I choose to go. (With iBooks, for the same LP guide books, you can't access the contents page as a list, touch on a topic you want to go to, and be routed instantly to that topic - a very helpful feature of the Kindle App.)4. CAN'T USE THE AMAZON CLOUD TO COPY PDF FILES)FROM THE iPAD KINDLE APP TO THE KINDLE FIRE HD.When I buy those pdf files of guidebooks, from Lonely Planet (and they are not the same as buying Kindle-ized books of LP guidebooks - which are usually awful, with unreadable maps), I can save those pdf files to the Kindle App on the iPad, and that's fine - except for the mini-book chapters not staying where I want them to stay! However, the Amazon Cloud doesn't seem to allow me to then copy those pdf files on to the Kindle Fire HD - where I'd really like to have them.Imagine wandering around the back streets of just about any Latin American city (where I intend to be for some months of next year), with your iPad in your hand for consulting your off-Wifi guidebook. If you're foolish enough to be doing that - particularly an old woman like me - there's a pretty good chance some local desperado will grab the iPad and run. On the other hand, a Kindle Fire HD 8.9" would be a way less attractive trophy for a street-roaming snatcher (one who can tell an iPad from a Kindle Fire HD!); the Kindle Fire HD would also be much lighter for carrying around all day, and consulting; plus, even if the Kindle Fire HD does get grabbed, it's a whole lot cheaper to replace than an iPad.So I'd really like the Amazon Cloud to allow copying of pdf files from my iPad Kindle App, to my Kindle Fire HD. It's probably possible but I can't figure out how to do it. The Amazon Cloud doesn't seem to want to talk to anything not directly bought from Amazon, even if the pdf files are now "in the Amazon system" by virtue of being saved into the Kindle App on the iPad. .Now, here's the point of this for Amazon's bottom line. The Kindle Fire HD, as we all know, was designed to make it easy for all of us to buy Amazon books, audiobooks, movies, etc - although I, with an Australian billing address, can't manage to buy movies, TV programs, MP3 downloads (or join Amazon Prime). We know, and accept, that this gadget was definitely not dreamed up by Amazon, to facilitate open-sourced buying. But you would think that a Kindle App on an iPad would be able to talk to a stand-alone Kindle, via the Amazon Cloud. Seems not - friends only if Apple is the friendship broker.Nevertheless, it seems to me that Amazon could benefit from allowing Lonely Planet pdf files to be transferred, via the Amazon Cloud, to a Kindle Fire HD. Why? Well, as most people have probably discovered, it's nice to do all the travel research on an electronic gadget. But, when it comes to the boots-on-the-ground traveling, nothing beats having an actual dead-tree guidebook - extensively thumbed, and defaced with with notes, stickers on pages, and highlighted text. It's very difficult to have those user-friendly possibilities if you are interacting with any kind of tablet, except for trivialities - such as the best places to sleep or eat.Therefore, allowing Lonely Planet's pdf files to be uploaded on to one's Kindle Fire HD, from an iPad Kindle app, would probably produce sales, from Amazon, of the real books when the travel time comes. Why again? It's way cheaper to buy the actual LP books from Amazon than from Lonely Planet, even if you live in Lonely Planet's country: Australia.
